text: Once again, yelp has not failed me.  This place has great food.  The meat was tender and very flavorful, and the salad was fresh with the dressing spot on.  They were very accomodating to a last minute order change.  The baklava was a perfect way to end the meal :) This is one of those places that I want to try everything on the menu :)
Great find!!! :) yummy food! Yummy gyro! Yummy souvlaki! yummy yummy!!! And friendly service!!! We are coming back!!

Was craving a good Gyro and after a Yelp search decided on this place! The reviews do not lie, one of the best Gyro's I've had in a long time! Got the Big Fat special which includes a Big Fat Gyro, fries (which I upgraded to greek fries for a small upcharge) and a regular fountain soda. Total came out to about $12 which is not bad because the Gyro was definitely big, fat, delicious! The fries were also very good - nice and hot on the inside, crispy on the outside, just like good fries should be. Highly recommend and will come back again next time I have a craving.

I was recently fortunate to have been treated to lunch at this restaurant.  It was fantastic. The service was great, the portion size was very good and even if I would had to buy, it was very reasonable. I will definitely go there again.

Service was great - food came out fast and was amazing. This is already a spot I love and have only been there once. I Will be returning. The dining area was clean - the atmosphere completes the experience.  Gyro plate Greek fries  Pork Loin Pita.... you really can't go wrong here.
I've missed having a good gyro sandwich having lived in Chicago.  This one today was really good.  My second visit here. Today's gyro and fries were not even hot.
This is an excellent place for for fast food dinner.  Or for a catered affair.  Great food and great service.

Great place to meet after the sports park. Went with family and friends had gyros, chicken cababs, salad and hummus.pizza was a little dark but only on the edges. Hummus appetizer was nice fresh and served w toasted pita. Fast and made to order. Second time ead better than the first time we went.

The best!  Try the gyro and chicken plate, you won't be disappointed.  Always great taste, quality, quantity and value - unbelievable(we keep meaning to try other items on the menu, but we really love this meal).  It includes the best tasting rice, pita bread and greek salad.  We have tried all the Greek places in Vegas over the years and you can't beat this place!

It's a nice clean casual dining experience with very good food and friendly service.  The yummy delights are much tastier than Gyro Time or Market Grille Cafe.  The portion sizes are huge.  I haven't found a meal here that allows room for dessert yet (especially since it's so hard to resist a side of their luscious Greek fries!)...must keep trying.

First time I had to wait over 20 minutes for a take out order. Even if they gave me a compliment drink for waiting. It was still uncomfortable waiting. Also, another issue after you get home and you find out your order is not exactly what you order is bad. I have came to this restaurant for the last 5 years but have moved to the southwest side of town. I guess being moved for about a year has made the service change. I will think twice about  stopping by and grabbing food on my way home.
If you like Greek food this is the place to go awesome food and make sure to try the saganaki!!!!

Have been coming here for years now and again and again the food is always consistently good. We've tried almost everything on their menu by now and never at a loss as to what to order - it's ALL good. The gyro meat is one of the best we've ever had anywhere, very moist and has a great flavor. Service is friendly and reasonably quick since all food is made to order. I especially enjoy their lemon herb chicken souvlaki. I'm not a big steak fan so I wish they could also include lamb on their menu. The pita is soft and plentiful. The rice is a winner! Try the Greek Pizza - a pleasant surprise.

I heard about this place from a friend. Went durning lunch hour and line was out the door!  I never mind waiting when there is a line, just means it's good!  I got the chicken and beef skewer combo.  I forgot to take a picture, I need to remember to do that.  Oh boy, the rice it comes with is so good. It was fluffy and seasoned so delicious.  Everything was really good and you get a lot of food.  Definitely going back there is do much I need and want to try!
This is a great little restaurant. Great customer service and I loved my big fat gyro. Not that expensive and worth a try!

Have enjoyed great food but last two times I called for delivery (a week apart) they did not have a driver available on a Wednesday night and today after visiting their website and ready to order a substantial worth of food I was informed they don't deliver unless it's a large party? Please change your website as it is misinformed. You guys have great food but being let down again does not persuade me to visit again.

I have been coming here for years since its first year and the quality is consistently good if not even better now and the portions have never minimized unlike many successful restaurants that get greedy!  For $11 I get a delicious chicken kabob, plenty of Gyro meat, yellow rice, salad, and pita bread...a meal that lasts 2 days and I usually don't even eat leftovers but I look forward to stretching this out! The owner is always appreciative and nice, humble guy =)

I ordered a plate and I'm giving it two stars because of the gyro but the spinach pie, rice and salad were bland!  The avgolemono soup was just ok! They put a thickener in it which I definitely did not care for!The service was just ok too! Cashier spoke like he was in a race and the server was not very friendly at all!  I'll come back for a gyro but nothing else!
Excellent food, addicting to say the least. Staff is amazing too, food is made to order and is always delicious. Highly recommend!
Im back again! The food is still worth the U Turn you have to make on Charleston.  They are sprucing up the place still same great greek feel and same great staff!
Best food in town! I could eat here daily. It's a cafe' style restaurant and stays pretty busy. Try the Chicken Souvlaki plate! Rice, salad, pita, and juicy chicken scewered.

Stumbled across this place by accident on a trip out to Suncoast.  It's edible.  This isn't the most delicious or authentic greek food I've ever had, but it isn't terrible.    Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but also wouldn't tell anyone it's not worth trying at least once.  Overall, just average.

bill and I eat here every Friday for lunch, last week I tried the Greek pizza. it was out of this world (with chicken) this week (today) I will try it with chicken and gyros. this is the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas hands down.!!!!!!!!!!!  jeff b ( a Chicago transplant)

First, this place gets busy during lunch and there are always patrons up until closing time, It is a real food find on the west end of town.  Yassou Greek Grill Café is my favorite little Greek restaurant in Las Vegas.  This unassuming restaurant serves up some of the most delicious Greek food in town.  My favorite is their Chicken Souvlaki platter.  It is served with two skewers of savory, tender chicken and comes with a small salad, buttery, lemon rice, warm, fresh pita bread and cool and creamy Tzatziki sauce this meal is very filling.  Their menu has all the standard Greek favorites such as Gyros, Spanakopita, and Dolmades. Other notable menu items are the Greek Fries served crispy and hot served with spices and feta cheese. The atmosphere is casual and friendly. The one drawback is the parking lot is small and hard to navigate any vehicle larger than a Mini Cooper. Yassou Greek Grill Café is located at 7871 W. Charleston near Buffalo, their phone number is 702-798-8989 daily hours Monday-Saturday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m.   Now open on Sundays and the food/quality is excellent.

Yummy Yummy Yummy! I love Yassou. This place is really laid back, the perfect place for lunch. The food is amazing. I always order the chicken gyro plate with a side feta fries (can't resist). The portions are great and the food is always fresh. Definitely one of the best Greek grilles in Las Vegas.

OK I really don't wanna oversell it because it takes away the kind of surprise I enjoyed today on my first visit, but in fairness I have to say it was stunning! Almost unbelievably good...as in: I had to pause mid-mouthful to make sure I wasn't dreaming! I got the under $8 lunch special with a chicken and a beef skewer, greek salad, pita and rice (oh the rice! 'wasn't expecting mild mannered little grain like rice to be such a star!) The chef (whom I could see from my seat) even took time out from cutting up fresh cucumber (by hand) to make sure I was enjoying my order. I don't care if you live on the east side, get yer butt to the west side, order some greek food and get happier with each bite. :)
The workers were kind and greeted us well, and I recommend the big fat special if you're really hungry. Their gyros are amazing and their Greek fries are really good too.

I really like the clean atmosphere,everything tasted good, spanikopita was a bit dry, Greek fries were just ok and the big fat pita was not bad, but just kinda basic, the Sevier here was great very polite people, very fast, i just can't get past the basicness of the food nothing stood out as fantastic

Yassou is worth trying.  My most favorite restaurant ever. Hedary serves similar food but is way more expensive and inferior in flavor.  Yassou: please close later on Sundays,  i cannot make it before 5pm. 8pm is a great time to close haha.  I went to Hedary to fill the void cuz you closed so early and i was not very pleased, not going back there.

Was here for lunch on 11/20/2010.  I ordered a Gyro (platter).  It was quite good. I love these and had not eaten one in a very long time.   I found the side of greek salad lacking a bit, it had enough cheese & dressing, but otherwise was all lettuce (only one olive).  I would have liked to see more "stuff" in the salad.    The "lamb" was a little dry, not ready to believe its always this way though. Having only eaten here once, this may have only been the luck of the draw, not sure. I will certainly try it again.

Probably the best gyros I had outside of Chicago. The only downside if I had to pick one would be that they are a little light on the sauce. The portions are generous and the veggies were just right. Their fries are a tad on the expensive side, but their portions more than make up for it. The service and cleanliness is also a big plus. I would definitely go back, but will order extra sauce on the side.

This is one of our favorite local spots in Vegas for lunch. The food is consistent and delicious. This family-owned and run restaurant is a great option for a delicious lunch or dinner. We often share an order of Saganyaki (fried cheese!!!) and then it's either the Big Fat Gyro of the steak souvlaki pita for me!

Wow this is probably the best service I have received from any restaurant in Las Vegas. While it's hard to find decent Greek food in town, I would have to say that this is probably #2 on my list. Plus they still accommodated us when we showed up 15 mins prior to closing. There were a couple items that prevented it from getting a 5-star rating. So let's break down the food.   A great way to help judge a Greek restaurant is by ordering their hummus and we did just that. They provided quite a bit of pita and croutons for you to dip in your hummus, unfortunately the hummus had no flavor. There was no lemon zest or taste of olive oil that normally comes through at other places. Heck I'm not much of a salt person and even I thought it needed some sodium.   Next up, we had their Greek fries covered in Greek seasoning, feta and parsley...I thoroughly enjoyed these. These would be so good with a gyro!  Now the main dishes - Your steak souvlaki was overcooked and tough to chew. Your chicken souvlaki was the savior as the robust flavors bursted in my mouth. Ah yes! Your lamb was tender and flavorful. Surprisingly it wasn't very greasy either.  Your tzatziki sauce wasn't as thick and tart as other places. I could swear it tasted more like sour cream than Greek yogurt, but whatever, it was still good. The rice was instant rice which was ok but I love me some homemade rice. The salad was good, mine just had a bit too much dressing.  The owner is a great guy and constantly checked on us to make sure we were satisfied with the food. Though it seems pricey, I thought for 3 people it was a great deal especially all the food we ate.

Great Greek food for lunch or a quick dinner!    The lamb/beef gyro was excellent!  We ordered the hummus before our meal and it was perfect!  Friendly staff and reasonable prices!  It was busy for a late lunch, but the service was fast.

First time impression: I read reviews and thought this restaurant must be pretty good......NO!!! Had the gyro plate and meat was just like leather. Was thinking to make shoes out of it! I gave 2 stars only for the service...for the food 0 stars.

:):):) hi I was also there on it happened, I'm a regular here for the past 5 years, I love the food and the staff , it feels like family ... About the overpowering thing the lady exaggerated , it was just a discussion between employes, I know all of them and they are very friendly with customers and between them.               The food is the best in town and overall this is the best restaurant!!!!!!!

Hidden Gem! Hands down best Greek food I've had. Mom and pops owned. When you see dad in the back cooking, it gives you comfort and you just know he's making sure your foods delicious.  BTW, he's not my dad but he's someone's dad in there.   If you haven't yet, check it out you'll be happy you did.

YUMM YUMM YUMM!!!! Found this place on accident and couldn't be happier that I did. The lunch special is the best and can't beat the price! I love this place! Parking can be tough if it's during the lunch rush hour.

My favorite place to go!!! Family owned and very authentic Greek food. The staff is always kind. Things I've tried on their menu: Mediterranean cheese pizza, spanikopita, big fat gyros, Greek fries, yellow rice, the salads, fruit smoothies  and the lemon herb chicken....it's all delicious!!! The chicken was juicy and very flavorful. The gyros are the stuffed with meat and toppings. I've dined it and ordered for pick up and it's never been disappointing.
First time for my me and my husband.  I am of Greek decent and this tastes just like Yiayia's cooking. We will be back on our next visit to Las Vegas!

I usually come during lunch hours ,and its always crowded.  I came on a Saturday night...and it was just as packed.  I can see why...the lemon chicken pita is fantastic!  And very generous with the portions!.  Also the spanikopita and hummus were just as tasty.  I've known the owners since they ran Lou Christian Dry Cleaners.  Their customer service was spot on there...and equally good here.   Just wished they gave you more napkins. ..

Happened to be on this side of town, which for some reason the good Greek restaurants seem to be (I'm Greek, live in Henderson...get with the program people), and happened to stop to have a bite to eat. I'm very glad I did. First of all, the people are very friendly and gave us a sample of the Greek custard dessert they had, which of course we purchased.   My friend and I both got the gyro plate and were both pleased. The beef/lamb was seasoned just right and I loved the salad and rice that the plate comes with. I usually don't eat the rice, but theirs was good. Now for the custard dessert...wow, this was delicious. It was a generous piece that my friend and I shared, warm custard, topped with phyllo and of course, some honey. Highly recommend.   I'm looking forward to going back!

Mmmm, one of my favorite Greek restaurants in town!  This is, surprisingly, one of the only places in the whole city with taramosalata - my favorite Greek dip!  The service is fast, the food is cheap, really, I couldn't ask for more :]

Being greek I'm extremely picky about greek food. This place has some of the best gyros and tzaskiki that I have had in the states.  The greek fires are also pretty solid. If your in the mood for a gyro this would be the place to go.

The best Greek food in Las Vegas.  It's nice to see a real family owned and run restaurant where they actually care about the customers.  The staff is always friendly and the food is super tasty.    Our family has been eating there since they opened and the food is consistently great.  The dining room area was recently expanded to allow more diners during busy times.    Go there and try it, you won't be disappointed.  If you are feeling daring, order a Greek coffee and have the owner's son make it.  He makes it perfectly.

This place used to be one of the top Greek restaurants on my list. Went there today with a coupon from the Entertainment book and discovered that they will no longer take the electronic version of the coupon, which I have used here before. Based on principle, I'm giving them a 1 star review. Don't offer an electronic coupon if you're not going to take it. Furthermore, at least post a sign that you're no longer accepting the coupon.
I had the chicken kebab plate. Plenty of chicken (2 skewers) the rice and were also very delicious. I will be back!

I love this place! I have been going here since they opened and not only is the food excellent the family is always glad to see you. They started small, but have expanded there seating and staff to accommodate the rush.There are so many things on the menu that are excellent and I usually order a side of Spanakopita and Taramasalata (with extra pita) to start, as I like to take it home to snack on later. The portions are generous, and I am always torn between the Chicken Salad or the Super Chicken Gyro, both are fantastic. Allow yourself a little extra time during the lunch hour or call ahead as they have a big rush of people and the parking is terrible. There are very few spots and it is difficult to maneuver through the narrow parking lot when its full.
We had the Greek Salad and Beef Gyro with a side of rice pilaf. I must say it is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants here in Vegas. Definitely coming back for more
Best Greek food in town! Staff is super friendly and food is delicious. Chicken Souvlaki and Gyros are must haves.

I've been going to this establishment since I was a little kid. It always brings back good memories. The employees are always great and the food is always spectacular. This is the best Greek food in Las Vegas hands down. I highly recommend it. What's better than supporting a family owned restaurant. If you want Greek food this is the place to go!

This is the best Greek place in Las Vegas, hands down. It would be stellar based on the food alone - not only is it authentic and delicious, but you can tell that someone actually cared about what they were making. On top of that, the staff and service people are always polite, cheerful, kind and courteous. This is honestly the kind of place I could eat every single day and it would never get old. I appreciate these guys and definitely recommend anyone who loves Greek food (or food at all) give it a shot.
I will literally drive 8 hours down from Reno just to eat here. The best Greek food I've ever had!!
Service was professional and courteous PLUS the food was DEEEELICIOUS at a great price!!!!! WILL BE BACK FOR SURE!!!
Very good :) the steak and chicken are perfectly marinated.  Pita was the only disappointment, it just wasn't the best.  Otherwise, it was great
Food is great- I recommend getting your food to go- LARGER PORTIONS! Always very fast, exceptional customer service and foodies very tasty!

The food here is delicious. I've ordered everything, and it's simply fresh, great tasting food. Customer service is fantastic, even when they're busy. I think it's family owned and run, so go support a local business for a change. Oh, If they have rice pudding, get it, the simplest, tastiest dessert ever.

I love the food... too many house flies for me to deal with!!  On six or seven visits the flies are terrible... with the open lamb meet it makes me sick to think about it.  If they do something about it then I will be back for sure!!!
I had the 6 oz herb chicken pita and it was delicious. I also added a Cyprus smoothie (strawberry and mango_ which was quite tasty. I would definitely return.

Nestled upon the Southwest hill of Buffalo and Charleston is this local gem that all must visit opening at 11am.   Today I had the Calamari under the Greek Plates section of the menu. It was the best calamari I have ever had, and I have had a lot of calamari in my lifetime. The plate was generous for the price; with salad, rice, and the fluffiest pita bread I have ever had surrounding.   The sauce that was also provided with the Calamari plate would be a world wide phenomenon if it was ever bottled and sold. I can't quite pinpoint all the flavors in it, which leads me to believe it is something special. All I can tell you is that you must try it for yourself and be enthralled in its zesty goodness as I was today.   The place is very well kept and clean with table clothes and sturdy chairs. It's as authentic as you can imagine. With authentic Greek Coffee in their Espresso Bar, Gyros, Hummus, Pita Sandwiches, and all sorts of authentic sounding appetizers and plates. They even have imported Greek Olive Oil and Greek Coffee Grounds for purchase.   The service was beyond excellent and as I was standing by the cashier to pay for my meal, I read a framed article about the place. It was then I realized that I was served by the owner himself and his family.   It was a wonderful experience and I am now determined on completing all of the menu.

My go to spot for Greek! Service is always 1000% Owner is on location so that's nice.  The meat is just perfect and is made with care. Juicy and tasty ALWAYS.  The yogurt sauce is amazing but they make you pay for extra in those little plastic cups. ( so that kinda sucks) but I pay eat. Eat it. Then come back for more always. :-)  I also bring all my friends to introduce them to the best Greek that I've found.  So check it out! You won't be sorry!

This is our favorite Greek place in the whole city. I love the home-cooked taste of the meats and dessert. Their tzatziki over a warm pita is heavenly. I honestly can't even go into detail about how good the food is. Just go try it!

Best Greek food this side of Athens. Family-owned; they treat customers as they would treat guests at their home for dinner. I have tried almost everything on the menu--it was all great. My favorite is the Super Lemon Herb Chicken Pita. Makes my mouth water just to think about it.

I'm obsessed with this place! It's vegetarian-friendly, but not vegan-friendly, because of all of the feta cheese. My personal favorites are the Greek fries & the spanakopitas. Spanakopitas are kind of like spinach & feta turnovers.  I should warn new-comers, they don't make falafels. According to the owner (who is a nice man that loves his restaurant), falafels are Mediterranean, but not Greek. He only serves strictly Greek food. At first I wasn't sure about the place, because of that, but it helped me try new foods that I probably wouldn't have given the chance otherwise.  It's definitely worth trying! I now come here at least twice a month. :)

Not friendly, tables were dirty. Food was good though... Came here before and got a salad which came with a minuscule amount of dressing, they seemed inconvenienced when I asked for more, they then gave me a second minuscule lil cup of dressing!

I've been here a couple times, the service was great and so was the food! Definitely worth all the 5 stars on the Yelp reviews. Especially those cashier guys. Shout out to them! However, this time I brought my mom and sister to try. We ordered 2 entrees and greek fries. When we got our food, my sister went to go ask for one extra plate from the man, which I believe is the owner or management. He wanted to charge $1 for one extra plate...I've never been charged for an extra plate before anywhere. Quoting what he said, "It's a dollar if you share like that." Share like what? We have 3 people and 3 things, sorry we wanted share...we just wanted one plate, we didn't ask for 10. I don't know but that made me really mad. I also don't want to pay an extra dollar for a plate I'm going to throw away in 20 mins. By the way I'm one of those broke college students, when every dollar counts. I can buy a super large drink at mcdonalds for that dollar. I'll be getting to-go or bringing my own plates from now on, but I don't think we will be going back for awhile. Call me a cheapo.
I have been coming here for several years and have always had a good experience. This is a family owned business and they all work very hard to make it a great place.

My big fat Gyro is so good and don't forget the Greek fries ( with feta and garlic). It makes the meal. My family and I live in Louisiana and whenever we are in Las Vegas we go to Yassou Greek Grill with out fail. Everything is good and the staff is super friendly.

we discovered this place about a year ago and have always enjoyed the food but today's experience was horrible.  We have put up with the high prices (2 plates & 1 drink always seem to come out to $20+) & super long wait time, (for a FAST food place) but today was the worst.  In order to avoid waiting the usual 15+ minutes I called ahead.  When my husband paid, the cashier got the order wrong that had been given over the phone.  My husband had to correct her a few times in the same transaction.  We thought it was strange we were not given a receipt or a table number.  Over the phone they had told us it would be ready in 10 min but it took 19.  We were once again waiting.  Also, over the phone I had said I was calling in advance to eat there, yet they set up our food in to go boxes - but didn't give us a bag...I don't understand the logic there.  When we got the food both to go boxes had smeared food marks on them - looked very unsanitary & unprofessional, and the order was wrong STILL.  We had been charged $2 for the extra rice my hubby ordered, but it appeared that they simply substituted his salad for a small amount of rice because the salad was missing altogether!  To make it right, they quickly (for once) made a salad to go, but even THAT box had smears of food or whatever on it.  GROSS!  The one good thing about this place is that the food always tastes great, but after this experience we may be looking for a new local Greek place.
This is one of my go to spot for the big fat gyro. One of the best I've had. If you haven't tried this place. You are missing out.
I tried this place and loved it.  They make ever to order, and at a reasonable price.  If you are wanting some good greek food this is your place

Hands down the greatest gyros I've ever had. I'm from NYC so I know what a quality gyro tastes like. That being said this is the only restaurant in Las Vegas that truly makes an amazing gyro with abundant amounts of quality meat full of amazing flavor and the price is just right!! Love this place!!
Decent food, decent-sized portions, reasonable price.  Tried the Super Gyro, it's good, and the Chicken Souvlaki Plate is tasty with good sized portions.

I just came back from a Europe trip and really missed some authentic food. This place is hands down the best Greek joint in town! You have to try their lemon herb chicken with anything you won't be disappointed!
The food was very good and service great. The portions are not small at all from their appetizers, sandwiches or plates. They have a nice variety too.

My family and I had lunch here the other day and the food was excellent and the staff was very friendly. We ordered 3 Super Mini Specials,The Big Fat Gyro, and the Gyro Plate. If you are looking for a way to try different meats the Super Mini Special is the way to go as you get chicken, lamb and beef kabobs.

LOVE. God I miss it.  Run by a honest-to-goodness Greek family, this place is home-cooked Greek food heaven. And the portions are huge- if you get a plate, you'll have a meal for tomorrow too!  The ambiance isn't great, but let's be honest-- few places in Vegas give you that. If you're in Vegas, you aren't there for the scenery. So get over it.  I digress. Back to the food, oh God the food. The gyros are whopping fistfuls of juicy, perfectly seasoned delight. The spanakopita is just flaky enough to give you the feeling that you're eating something healthy-- but it's Greek, so you're not. The steak souvlaki..... sorry, just choked on my own drool. Perfectly tender, marinated, I'll even lick the skewers those beautiful chunks of meat are served on.  Every time I'm back in town, I make sure to stop here. Still haven't found an equivalent in my new city. I no longer believe that is possible.  ...Now I'm depressed.
This place is great!  Great food and a great value!  The gyro and chicken plate are out of this world!

Yassou is great for greek food!  Everything I've had there has a great flavor.  The meats are juicy and tender.  The salads are fresh and makes me feel like I'm eating healthy. I still have a few things I'd love to try on their menu like the spanakopita and dolmades.  I've had their "Big Fat Gyro" sandwich which has everything you need for a good lunch especially when I am limited on time.    The ambiance is lacking but the food more than makes up for it.  Everyone working there was super nice and the prices are reasonable.
Nothing special, average food for way too high of prices. Food lacks flavor, people are nice. Way better Greek food in town

I have gone to Yassou Greek Grill twice now for lunch and both times it has been a top notch experience. First off their prices appeal to a heeb like me. You can get a huge gyro platter for under $10 bucks, it filled me up both times I have had it. You would be paying $15 or more at another Greek restaurant for a similar dish.   The title of Best Greek food I have had in Las Vegas is a toss up between Market Fresh Grille and Yassou Greek Grill Cafe. Both have been consistently high in quality and taste of the food. The variety of food on the menus will keep you going back for more. But the tie goes to Yassou because of the excellent economical pricing.

The food could have been served hotter, the gyro meat could have been moister and more flavorful, the staff could have been a lot more knowledgeable and friendly, and the soda machine could use more carbonation. Too many other Greek food options in town for me to ever consider returning.
Best Greek in town outside the Strip.  I always get the Gyro Plate here for lunch.  Just sucks they close Sunday's.
Nice location and atmosphere.  The chicken kabob that I had was awesome - tender and tasty.  Good prices.  Too bad I haven't found a Greek restaurant this good near me.
The best place to get a gyro. Meat is tender, pita bread is fresh and the sauce appears to be homemade. People are friendly and service is great. No better place for Greek food

Tonight I had the Olympic Veggie Pita in my life I ever experienced such a tasty and delicious sandwich. The service was great and the place was clean as a whistle. I would recommend this place to anyone

My experience there was very nice. The company that I work for rented space for a celebration. The people that work there accommodated our needs, and were very friendly.  The thing that caught my attention was that this was a catered event but, they still were kind enough to take orders of people that had dietary restrictions. It's a small cozy place, and I would go back! And of course the food was great!

It's kind of like walking into a mass production restaurant. If looks like everything is made on an assembly line. The gyro I ordered had old, limp onions on it. The onion's tasted like sweaty armpits. The Greek french fries had way too much salt on them. I threw them out. What a waste of money.  I have never gone back.

I frequent Yassou almost on a weekly basis.  This is the best GREEK food in town.   If you go for lunch, try to go before 12, otherwise, there is aways a line!  I prefer eating at places that have a line because that tells you the food is fresh and yummy.  They have a few awesome lunch specials.  You can even use a coupon from the Entertainment!  The chicken kabobs are the best/ If you like Gyros, order the big fat with feta and Greek fries.  They also have a lemony soup that's great for our weather now. YK

My family and I enjoy eating at this restaurant.  The staff is always friendly, the food tastes great, and it's very clean.  My favorites are the Super Steak Pita, the Gyro, and the Combo Souvlaki.  Tastes very much like my families dishes from Greece.  As good as it gets when it comes to authentic!

My favorite Greek restaurant..try the super chicken pita sandwich.  The rice and Greek salad is the best in town.  Their baklava is so delicious.  Everyone is friendly.  You can call ahead and order on the way if you are in a hurry! 100%

Love, love love Yassou. I come here with my family and we the share vegetarian plate, greek salad, beef souvlaki & chicken souvlaki. Even though the fries are very good, we skip those and pay for the extra salad because....... their house made salad dressing is sosososososos GREAT. The salads, btw, are perfectly dressed.
This my favorite Mediterranean restaurant  in Las Vegas. Great prices for the amount of food you get. The staff is always friendly and easy to talk to. The service is #1. My once  week must have.

A favorite place to get greek food. The value for your money is amazing. I've been going there for years and most of the time I could barely finish the portions. My favorite dish is the Steak Souvulaki plate which comes with two steak skewers, salad, rice, pita bread and amazing home made yogurt sauce. The greek pizza is amazing as well. There's a family feel when you get inside, it's almost like visiting your grandma for lunch. Very nice friendly people, and can't say that enough the best greek food in Las Vegas. It's a must try joint

A very warm and friendly place, all the employees are so nice and always are so polite.  The food is so tasty, succulent tender chicken prepared with savory seasonings along with rice and "green" lettuce for your salad with a light oil, not the half green and yellow lettuce at some places. If your looking for "real" authentic Greek food, you have found eureka!
This is one of the greatest restaurants here in vegas, the food is always excellent and the customer service is outstanding! I highly recommend coming here as often as possible!

Hummus was lacking in all zest. 3/10  Taramosalata is reminiscent of mayonnaise, with a hint of yogurt. 6/10  Dolmades are zesty and delicious despite being half heartedly wrapped.   10/10  Yassou Gyro is tasty, a great gyro.  9/10  Big Fat Gyro is also tasty with a little kick with the feta cheese.  10/10

Best Greek food in Vegas had the Gyro plate, Was excellent great portion size pita bread was warm and toasty, came with a salad and rice on the plate lots of meat!!, best i have had yet, wish i would have know about this place sooner, wife has been craving Great Greek food since she was prego. Owner was very friendly, Great customer service A++, Would highly recommend!

The food here is excellent!  Minus 1 star for having Faux News on the TV... what is with these businesses who feel it necessary to show you they can't think for themselves and need fox to tell them what to think.. honestly I usually won't frequent a business that does this... I hope they get the message.

My son who lives in Summerlin recommended this place while we were visiting. We love Greek food and were happy to try it for lunch. Punch line ... The food was so good and tasty that we have since gone back a second time with in the week, this time with our granddaughter. I had the steak and gyro plate while the wife and gdaughter split the chicken and pork slovaki plate. The portions are big and everything is made after you order, so it's fresh and hot. Service is fast and friendly. Only down side... It's a small place and get be busy at peak eating hours.

Been eating here for years. I lived in Vegas from 2006 - 2008 and that was my weekly Saturday go to lunch spot. Every time I go back to Vegas, i must stop in. Peter (the owner) is always friendly and loves to feed me. This food is authentically Greek as it gets. Feels like my grandmother is there cooking for me. I never really liked the "quick service" plastic plates here, because I feel it cheapens the food. Their food deserves fine china. I love it and my wife couldn't stop talking about the salad dressing (this was her first visit). They always do it right. A must eat for a trip to the West side of Vegas....

So delish, Jeff was friendly and greeted me and introduced himself right away. This place was recommended to me and  I read their great  reviews and had to try it, even though Mad Greek was a block away from where I was and I knew they wouldn't let me down.  well.......I'm soooo glad I tried Yassou!!!  I too recommend you give it a try, it's great food, affordable, clean and they're all friendly.
Simply the best fast Greek food, and some of the best food overall, that I've had in my 49 years in Las Vegas.  'Nuff said. -- -- -- -- -- On the newly-established Nighthawk 100-point scale:  94.

If you like real authentic Greek food, this is the place. My recommendation would be the chicken and gyro soulvaki. My all time favorite here. They also make the baklava fresh and in house. I cant wait to come back here. Christian and his father are dedicated to this family business and serving the community they live in. Keep up the great work guys.

This place is AMAZING. Authentic, and delicious. There is a huge selection and everything you might want is represented. They even have pastitio, which I rarely find, and it is absolutely delicious. All of the souvlaki selections are tasty and the portions are HUGE. Even the rice is fantastic. The food is consistent and made pretty quickly despite being extremely busy at all times. I'm serious. If you like Greek food....come here.

My favorite greek food restaurant in Las Vegas! They have the best gyro meet in town! Everything is fresh!  They always include feta cheese too.  It's locally owned and the people who work here are very nice!   The only downside is it only works til 8pm. I wish they worked til at least 9 and may be til 10pm Fri and Sat night.   But always stop by here for lunch any time I'm in this part of town!
I would of gave it more stars the reason why is because they should of stayed open later than 8:00pm!! Why not 9pm or 10pm?? They are making money why not stay open much later!!

Definitely worth it!  First time I tried this place was by accident while looking for a place to eat.  All I can say is the food is just awesome!  I live in Las Vegas now and I practically come here once or twice a month.  The customer service is great as well.  If you get a chance, definitely stop by!

Forever my favorite Greek restaurant in town. I've tried to venture off and find somewhere closer and although they've been good, it's not the same! The chicken souvlaki plate is the best!! 2 skewers of grilled chicken and onion, seasoned and marinated perfectly served with rice, a salad and pita. I love their Italian dressing and tzatziki sauce also. The owner is here pretty much everyday, very friendly gentleman and remembers his repeat customers! Trust me, if you want some good Greek, this will surpass your expectations.

Delicious. This place is NON-STOP busy, I knew it had to be worth trying. I'm so glad I have found a GOOD genuine Greek spot in this city!  Go! You won't regret it. The owner is a good man. It was obvious how much his business means to him.  So good!

The service was very friendly but the good unfortunately just wasn't that great...the servings were large and part of it was fresh... but it just wasn't great...they microwaved the soup, and didn't have the heat on the meat... they just shaved it off and tossed it on the grill,so it didn't get hot...overall kind of disappointing

Awesome place for brunch. I was craving for some salad and yelp gave me this address. The servings are huge. Staff are very friendly and efficient. They cook your food as you order which is not a big deal since they do it very fast. They have plenty of tables inside and outside. The place is good for groups, for family, dates, kids, or just by yourself. Lunch time here is pretty busy. The restaurant is busy with to go orders and people that are eating inside the restaurant. As busy as it gets, they don't forget your order and it should be in your table after 20-35 mins. Will come back again.
Good food. If you order a gyro (I always do!) you might want to ask for sauce on the side otherwise they just put a little bit right on top. Besides that it's always been awesome!

For the most part, the flavors are good; but I prefer the Great Greek. The size of their gyros are much bigger than the big fat gyro. I would visit them again if I'm on that side of town, but it's something I would not go out of my way.
Enjoyed the food after i finaly got it. Not a very friendly restaurant thoe, watched as an older grey curly haired man was yelling at the employees. Not the way I want to enjoy my dinner.
Best Greek fast food in town. It's so perfect. Their yellow rice is the perfect comfort food, as is there spanakopita and saganaki. Perfection.

We shared hummus, chicken souvlaki, and the best rice pilaf I've tasted. Service was friendly and quick. Not a fancy place, but for great food at reasonable prices this hit the spot. 5/5 for the rice and hummus alone, it's good enough we're grabbing some baklava for the road.
We stopped in a few times and we always enjoyed our meal...its nothing too fancy, but real good flavors and huge plates that make your tastebuds happy :) Mmm...

Best Greek in Las Vegas!  Possibly the best Greek food I've ever had!  Went for the chicken skewers lunch special and it doesn't get any better that. Went back for dinner and was just as good.  Worth the 30 minute drive each way!
I have to say that Yassou is THE BEST in the business. Coming from the east coast and from a Greek family...this place has been my salvation. I cannot rave about it enough. I highly recommend it!!!

This place is absolutely my go to for Greek food.  I get the gyro plate which comes with rice, pita and salad.  They let me substitute my salad out for more pita, which I love.  The pita is always soft and the rice is so perfectly cooked and flavorful.  I've brought many people here with me and every single person has always wanted to come back again and again.  I highly recommend it.  My only complaint is that if you want to split a meal (because the portions are huge) with someone they charge you and additional dollar for a styrofoam plate and fork.
my favorite greek food in vegas, also very friendly staff & clean eat-in area. win/win. highly recommend.
I love this place! Best Greek food in Las Vegas...even better than Greek food I use to get In NYC!

Came in today and got Awesome food ! Really love the way they cook everything and the Greek fries are the best ! They can get understaffed sometimes, but overall the food makes up for everything. If it wasn't for my 30 minute break I could easily stay here and enjoy my food and willing to wait for my food! Great place!

The food is good however, I took my out of town family there and we wanted to order a Gyro  filled with just lamb and the proprietor said they cannot fulfill that request. The Gyro has to be   mixed with beef. I did not understand what the big deal was, It is a Greek restaurant and   Gyros are usually filled with Lamb. A good restaurant should accommodate its customers  Because we pay the bills. I decided not to ever return and not give Yassou my business.

Love it here! They always treat me like family. Their skewers are so good that I have a hard time ordering anything else. Everyone that I send here always raves about it. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!!!

Wow. Yum. Great Greek. This is a casual dining spot, but the flavors and the well prepared meals make you feel as if you're at an upscale Greek place if there is such a thing. I love the chicken-lamb kabob plate. The place is one of my favs and that's no easy feat considering how picky I am.

I don't usually review places...but this place deserves 5 stars!!! Great food, awesome friendly staff! I live close by and come here often! Several times they have brought us free hummus and bread! I bring all of my out of town guests here!!
Great food and this coming from someone who normally will opt out of eating Greek food.

Got the spanakopita and a basic gyro. Both were really good but not the best I've had. The staff was nice and then place was very clean.   Despite not being the best, the spanakopita was pretty damn good. I once had the ultimate spanakopita at a fair and have been on a hunt to find one that compares ever since. I've run into some really narly ones while on this quest. Let me tell you, Yassou's spanakopita is not one of those. Probably the best I've had aside from them legendary one.   My only complaint is the sauce and neat were kind of pushed towards one side of these gyro.

Okay, this became my very favorite lunch time spot because my office is (somewhat) close by and THE FOOD IS SO AMAZING. TOP NOTCH, FRESH CRUNCHY VEGTABLES in my salad, the most amazing dressing for the LEMON CHICKEN SALAD, literally it is to-die for. I had Given a bad review for this spot in the past because I was irritated with the system. I would call in my order from work, as i would never have time to wait in line, but then sometimes I would get here at prime lunch time rush hour and have to stand in the endless line just to pay. After I left the review, they entirely made up for this and tweaked the system, and would then allow me to run to the front of the line to make my payment and dash out with my lunch just in time to get back to work on time. THEY SAW MY (kind of rude) REVIEW AND MADE A CHANGE IN THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE. Jeez. Again, top notch, top of the line kind of place right here. thank you, and I love your food, Yassou is da bomb.

I am, by no means, an expert or an avid fan of Greek food so it was an adventure for my mom & I to come here. We certainly do not regret it because we had a fabulous meal together at Yassou!  Customer service was great. Friendly people behind the counter, especially (I'm assuming) one of the owners who served us, asked how our food was and bid us goodbye on our way out.   The food is delicious. My mom had the Tuna Mykonos Pita, I had the Super Lemon Herb Steak Pita & we shared the Greek Fries. Mom loved her super chunky, lemony albacore tuna pita with tomatoes and onions and the magical sauce. Lol. I also had the same condiments and veggies but mine came with seasoned, tender steak bites. The herb and feta cheese-topped fries were crispy and were a great pair to our pitas.  The ambiance of the place is casual and I would expect it to be super packed around rush hour cause it's not a very huge place. I must say too that the place is warm inside, we were a bit sweating while eating our food even when sitting in a shaded table so that was a little uncomfortable. All in all though, we are definitely coming back to try the Gyro and the Rice plates since everyone is raving about them!

Excellent food and good service gives this little gem a 5-Star rating. Being a picky eater it is always a plus for me when the restaurant can tell me what is going to be on my order and hold certain items from it. I know it sounds very basic but you would be surprised at how many places can't do that. While we tried several of their dishes I have to admit my favorite was their house Gyro. If your in the area and looking for something a bit different you won't be disappointed here.
Great place great food. My family said they loved the food and they wanted to come back very soon. The price is extremely reasonable. Will be back very soon.

I decided to check this place out after seeing some great reviews and being the closest Greek restaurant near me. When I walked into Yassou, I was greeted by Greek music and a bunch of Greek memorabilia on the wall. I love that kind of stuff and made me wish I was still in Greece.  I ordered the moussaka and it came with a Greek salad, tzatziki, rice, and pita slices. The moussaka had a huge crispy layer of bechamel at the top, but just a little too much for my liking. It tasted great though. The rice was cooked well and was seasoned great.  The pita was good and I love tzatziki no matter what. Everything to cooked for order and the service was very quick.  I will definitely be back in the future to try some different dishes!
The best greek food in Las Vegas!!! I just moved to Nashville and I'm slightly upset they dont have a Yassou's out there. Whenever I come back to town, you better believe I'm stopping by.

I am a freak for greek food and I had heard from my co-workers that this was a great place. Being that it is right down the street from work, I decided to try it out today. I took an early lunch and showed up and there is already a line to the door. Good sign. I ordered a greek salad with gyro and lemon chicken to go. It took close to 30 minutes to come out. I understand that they were swamped, but if it's like that everyday I suggest hiring more than one person to take orders and run orders and have more than two people in the kitchen. Highlight was that the salad was amazing. I will be back, but I will likely call in my order next time so I don't have to wait so long.

Decent. Open daily.   Very nice workers. Seems to be maybe family owned?   Came mid-day (around 4pm) - they had a lot of chairs flipped on tables to clean (between lunch and dinner time i guess where its not so busy.. still weird) While i was eating, they were cleaning around the restaurant. Upon entrance to the restaurant, almost had the feeling they were closing soon ! i had to double check the hours on the front XD !   I had ordered a steak and gyro plate. The rice was not that good. Steak was over-cooked and dry. Gyro meat was good but didnt make up for the previous too because it didnt really have any accompanyment to eat together with. Another sad thing was the pita bread couldnt be opened to make pockets for me to stuff and eat like i can at other Mediterranean/greek places.

I always come here for a quick lunch. Fast service and the food is good. My son always asks me to come here after school. He loves the big fat Greek gyro and the hummus plate. The gyro is seasoned well, the pita is soft and velvety and the hummus is creamy. It's always delicious however for the first time I ordered a baklava and that is a zero star. I have never seen a baklava as crumbly as this one. The taste is bland and stale. I will definitely never order again. We ended up tossing it away.

Yassou is not only the best Greek food but the best food PERIOD. I've come to this restaurant A LOT of times and they have been nothing but courteous, fast and efficient. To top it off the food is always the best, every time I go its like the first time going all over again. Love Yassou, I will be back again and again
It was nothing crazy. Nice lil family operated restaurant. Reminds me too much of my own family....

Love this place. Every time we are in Vegas, we try to drop by. I brought my family here, I brought my friend here and everyone loved it. The only gripe, this past weekend, they were out of teramasalata.

Working is Vegas this week. Stopped by this place for lunch. I got the "My Big Fat Gyro" lunch deal--gyro, fries and a soft drink. Ouch, $11+ wasn't so much of a deal. Nevertheless, the gyro was tasty. Pita bread was soft and fresh. Meat was tender and flavorful. Big basket of Greek fries that I couldn't finish.  The fellow running the place seemed friendly. The place was certainly hopping at lunchtime. The soda dispenser is self-serve, and I made sure I got my fill of refills, since the lunch was just a tad pricey.  Certainly not the worst Greek I ever ate. Would I eat here again? You betcha.

Had super high expectations based on the reviews, but food was bland, service was terrible, and we took our food to go and they forgot the grape leaves-the whole reason I got the veggie spreads plate!  Not cool!  Won't return.

Great food at great price, service though is a bit lacking. The Mini Souvlaki plate was really good chicken and beef were tender  and savory. The Salads are pretty good as well. A good healthy alternative although i would recommend getting the order as a take out instead of dine in. The front of the house is understaffed food on the other hand was excellent.

The food was good. Not great. Liked their salsa bar, ehich included a mango salsa that was really fresh and tasty. I went here a few weeks ago and check in. Just now dojng the review. Didn't take a photo and trying to remember what I even ordered. The restaurant had a cool bar in the back. I think they just need to do a good cleaning from top to bottom. Floors were not clean. Wonder what the kitchen looked like.
I'm a regular here and the food is always fresh and consistent in flavor. The portions are good for the price. I usually get the combo plates. Friendly service and nice atmosphere.
Excellent service, food most amazing.  Officially my new spot for Greek desires, have tried other places and this one deff tops.

I have been here many many times, and I love this place. But, today I was really hungry for My Big Fat Gyro sandwich. The top of my gyro sandwich was really delicious then I got to the bottom of my sandwich, the meats were dried and partially burned. I was very, very disappointed!!       I hope my next visit, it will be better!!

I went here today for lunch with my husband. The short, tan, Asian cashier with the long black hair told me that I look "MISERABLE" while we were ordering food. I am assuming that she said that because I am pregnant?!? I was so outraged but I managed to control my shock and keep my composure. It really hurt my feelings to hear that because I am already self-conscious enough from the baby weight. That was sooo rude of her. She looks like a pathetic ugly old troll but unlike her I wouldn't just straight up tell her that! We came here to eat food, not get insulted!

I've eaten here three times within a week. It is that good.  The Mini Souvlaki needs to have its name changed. It should be called "Perfect Souvlaki" because the portioning is perfect, and the food is perfect.  It's been only a month since I've moved to Vegas, and it's restaurants like this that make it easy for me to call a new city home.
Excelllent place! I have been here several times. My wife and I keep coming back. Try the Super Lemon Chicken Pita! Yum!!!
Hard to beat the food at this place.  The prices are great and the portions huge.  The environment is homey and inviting.  A great spot for lunch.  Try the chicken lemon soup, I hear it's great!

The food is awesome! Like, really delicious! I've done both take-out and eat-in here, with good experiences both times. The dining area has great natural light, and a good atmosphere, though the greek carnival-sounding music was a little louder than necessary when I was there. I docked a star because there were ants crawling around in the bathroom and in the secondary dining area. Perhaps that was a temporary issue, but it raises concerns about cleanliness.

This restaurant has the BEST LAMB CHOPS I have ever tasted.  My plate was overflowing.  There is such a personal touch from this single owner business.  I will always go back as everything is always fresh and delicious.  Donna D.

Not bad for a quick bite. The gyro was fine, nothing to get too crazy about. The veggies on the gyro were fresh so they get a thumbs up for that. The Greek fries were slightly disappointing as there was only one tiny piece of feta cheese. I would give it another shot in the future based on the fresh veggies.

Their Food is Great and the father and son that run the restaurant are great too. Everything is always fresh and good. I have a special interest because the son got married through my dating service (Interactions Dating). So Yassou keep up the great food.                                                              Elaine
All I can say is freshness is key. I just love love love it here. Everything is prepared so neatly and nicely. Tastes great and the employees are amazing.

I love the atmosphere! This is my favorite seat in Greek place hands down! I usually get the gyro salad or plate and am never disappointed. I also never leave hungry, if anything I have left overs or another snack or meal. The desserts are as good as the gyro meats, if not better!

BEST GREEK FOOD EVER!!! I go here quite often, and the customer service is always awesome, even when it's packed. The chicken pita with the greek fries are my go to. The atmosphere is really cool too. I wish I could give it six stars.
Favorite  greek place in town! Great food .Good service and the owners are very friendly. We go often!

We have been going to Yassou for at least 10 years and have always loved it (and still do). However if today were our first visit I am not sure how we would have felt. First things first the cashier (I believe her name is Sara) was somewhat rude. When she informed my wife that the red caviar spread was not available she rushed my wife on making a decision on which sauce she wanted extra of. This may have been acceptable if there was a line but we were the only ones ordering. Christian was working hard on the line so I am not sure if he was aware of the shape that the restaurant was in, once again if this was our first time we would have a really bad perception of Yassou.  During our dinner there was another woman cleaning, not a bad thing but the mop water was so strong with bleach that it somewhat interfered with our meal. There were two couples that came in after us and each had a less than stellar experience. The older couple seemed to be almost harassed for asking for an extra plate while the young family seemed to get attitude for requesting the fries and pita they ordered.   We have been avid visitors of Yassou and have recommended it over the other Greek restaurants in town so it was sad to see today be so off. Christian and his family work hard to make it a great experience and I commend him for having such an authentic and delicious restaurant. Maybe there was something in the air or everyone was just way over stressed but today was really just not a good day at Yassou. I really hope stuff like this doesn't end up hurting them as it is our favorite Greek place in town.

One of the best Greek places in town.  I have been here on a couple of different lunch outings.  We may sit in different seats every time we dine at YGGC but the one thing that never changes is the friendly service AND the super tasty, fresh chow.  The veggies are crispy, the meat is succulent (first time typing that word, thank you spell check!).  Beware the parking can be a bit insane depending on when you eat.  Remember if you have to eat fries, eat the Greek fries.
So amazing not gonna lie just orgasmed in my mouth eating this place.. I'm definitely coming back to this place best Greek place in town by far

We found his place on Yelp, and will never order a Gyro from another place in Vegas as long as we live here!   The first time we came here, the owner was super friendly- even gave us a couple pieces of meat to sample. We ended up each getting a platter combo each (I got chicken, he got steak) but it ended up being too much food for us. All the meats they serve here are amazing, and but what really blew the meal out of the water was the rice pilaf!!   Since our first visit, my boyfriend and I have since come up with our regular order; we each get a Yassou Gyro, an order of rice to share, a couple sodas, and extra tzatziki sauce. The only thing that would make this place better is if they put more tzatziki sauce in the rear of the Gyros, usually it's all up front so when you start unwrapping the tail end, it gets dry. :(

Good food, close to my house. The food has never been bad, and most plates they serve are more than I can eat.  Unfortunately, the parking sucks, and getting to the location is very inconvenient. So while they are the place I think of when I desire Greek food, I don't mind finding an excuse to try somewhere else.

We are from Chicago, and our Las Vegas friends met us here for a quick dinner.  Gyro meat is authentic and as good as we have in Chicago.  The steak souvlaki was tender and flavorful.  Everything was authentic Greek food.  Restaurant is very casual, we sat in the covered patio and it's off a busy street, but fenced and private.  They put a lot of effort into their restaurant and it shows.  Very enjoyable!
It's been hard to find a good Greek restaurant here in the valley....finally found it!!!so good. Meat is cooked but still juice and tender. Great customer service too
Amazingly delicious food! Hands down my new favorite Greek food go to! The chicken is cooked beautifully and has great flavor. Even my 2 year old ate an entire skewer of chicken!

Very good Greek fast food.  The gyros and chicken souvlaki (kabob) are a good tasty combo. The place could be a bit more inviting inside and the orders done a little faster but the food itself makes up for all that.  I go back when I get a chance and nearby!

I've been coming here for years. It's the only Greek place in town that I have found is quick and easy and cheap. As for taste, no it's probably not the best I have ever had, but for me, I order the chicken souvlaki plate or greek salad with chicken and I am happy with it consistently. The pita on the salad is very buttery and I believe fried, so not exactly the healthiest, but good. The dressing is excellent and I always ask for it on the side since they tend to go heavy on the dressing. It somehow always seems to be mixed in every time, but when I ask them about it, they say it's the marinade from the chicken that gives it that taste or feel that the dressing was still mixed it, but they say it wasn't. The people working there know us by face now and it always seems to be the same people working, I know the owner is always there, but the other guy might be his son? He is always there too.   The chicken and rice soup is really yummy but sometimes they don't have it, especially over the summer. My hubby orders the steak skewers or gyro and isn't as impressed with this place as I am. Friendly workers, quick food, and affordable is a plus in my book.
The best Greek food I have ever had. Will be back many more times. Suggest the souvlaki combo as it is a perfect mixture and shows how good the chicken and beef is.

Today I had this craving for Greek Cusine. My sister and I headed on over to Yassou Greek Grill Cafe. I ordered the Gyro Beef & Lamb pita sandwich for which I was very pleased. The cashier was very friendly. The restuarant was very clean. The best $7.00 dollars I ever spent

This is a great Greek casual dining restaurant. It has all the favorites and it is family owned.   They have great meat and kabobs. I specially like the Greek pizza with yummy calamata olives.   They have a enclosed patio area and a open air one.   They do take their time so if your in a hurry order ahead.
I have been coming here for more than 10 years. The food is fantastic and the staff is friendly. We love the gyros and Greek fries. My favorite is the Spanakopita plate.
I got the gyros plate and it's delicious! Service is fast and it's a fun Greek atmosphere. Must go!!
Super friendly service and food is ALWAYS good! I've been coming here for years and it has never let me down! The best Greek food in town!
The food and service are excellent!!!  Love their Gyros!!!  Their service is as great as their food!!

Decent Gyro sandwich compared to others I've tried in Las Vegas.  I am taking off one star because of the little amount of Tzatziki sauce that was on the lettuce and didn't make it into the sandwich and when I asked for extra side of sauce, they wanted to charge 55 cents for a little container.   It's not the money, and fine charge extra for additional sauce, but try putting on a decent amount on the sandwich in the first place.  Other than that I did enjoy it and would probably go back.

Yassou has been my go-to place for greek food for over 7 years now!  Food is flavorful and staff is friendly. I always get the Super lemon chicken gyro and my husband gets the My Big Fat Greek Gyro with greek fries...so good!

Yassou is my favorite Greek spot to dine in with super reasonable prices. I have tried many Greek joints in Las Vegas and Reno and it is by far the best. Their workers are always really nice and engaging.   I have dined in and gotten take out with both experiences being quick and efficient. My favorites to get are the chicken + steak souvlaki combo and the lemon herb chicken pita. I get the souvlaki combo when I want pita bread and their amazing rice pilaf (best rice pilaf I've ever had by the way). I get the lemon herb chicken pita when I'm craving that flavorful ultra juicy chicken. The chicken pita comes with an extra container of juice, like OKAY I SEE YOU YASSOU!! Serving the extra juices as if it's not ridiculously juicy enough. On top of that, the price point is really good for the large portions they give you.  Yassou never fails to deliver amazing food while still being pretty healthy!

Seriously the best Greek food I've ever had. We even had them cater our wedding last year. I have yet to find anything on their menu I don't like. Friendly, delicious and a great place to relax. Perfect first date location.

This is near my doctors office. I ordered some food but I noticed they do not have their grade from the health department up. I saw something near the drinks that said health permit but not hanging up it was just sitting down on the counter. A worker looked at me kind of nervously when he saw I was looking in that direction (of the permit.) I like to see letter grades and don't like to see worried workers. However the salad I had was good. I also ordered a soup that took like ten min to come out but I asked and they apologized and gave me a free baklava. The food tasted good I just hope to see they put the grade up on the wall soon!
I frequent this place (pretty much every week). They are extremely consistent, and their super mini combo for lunch is truly delicious. For a nice takeout type Greek place this is a great choice!

I catered an office lunch yesterday for 15. The food was on time and hot, prepared well with a full set up of plates and serving utensils. Staff was pleasant to work with. Everyone loved the variety and the generous portions.

Decent quantity and quality. Combo plates offer a very good deal. Steak was nicely marinated and tender. The gyro meat was terrific. It's cooked on the skewer and shaved as is proper. This is not a flat top grilled gyro. Thank the Greek gods for that. Limitations in my opinion are seating options.
Immaculately clean to go along with the outstanding food and fast service. Family owned and operated and it shows in how everyone shows ownership of the place.

This place is awesome! I ordered the gyro-spanakopita plate and it comes with so much food I had to divide it into two meals! My husband ordered the spanakopita plate and an order of dolmades (stuffed grape leaves with ground beef) OMG! They serve them with this lemon sauce that is so delicious.  The service is great and the prices are reasonable.

I absolutely love this place. And the ONLY reason they did not get 5 stars is because of the same small, simple thing that happens quite too often. I eat here AT LEAST twice a month of not more (sometimes once a wk)  and I pay EXTRA for extra sauce, and 85% of the time my EXTRA sauce that I PAID for is missing. It's already bad if an eatery forgets the sauce that comes with your meal, but for a sauce that is PAID for by yourself wether if it's 50 cents or $5, you, we, PAID for it. Please don't leave that out!!! I'm such a pushover and HATE complaining and esp over a $1 sauce. But hey, that's A DOLLAR (or whatever the amount is.) Other than that, the food is amazing and soooo good that I choose to come back. Plus I tried quite a few other Greek places and they are not nearly as good as here. I just wish they'd be a little more attentive to these "small" big things

Absolutely delicious and excellent service! The gyro meat was so moist and the hummus was great! Best bakalava around! I will def be coming back and recommend you try it. The people who were working were very welcoming.

By far my favorite Greek place in town. The lemon chicken & gyro salad is so delicious and refreshing. My kid loves their pizza. My husband DESTROYS the Big Fat Gyro... sooo good. Hummus side is a must. Today I tried  the big fat and totally get why the hubs likes it so much. Their fries are bomb. Calamari plate is delicious. This place is one of our staples for lunch and dinner. The owner is so incredibly nice and authentic. He is always there and you can tell he takes such pride in the restaurant he has truly made AMAZING. We've probably been to this place 30 times over the years, and each time has been a wonderful experience. If you are a Vegas local and haven't gone... you are majorly missing out. Just sayin. We are BIG FANS if you couldn't tell.

Some people say "I'm not a Chef but I know what I like... Well I was a Chef and I really like Yassou Greek Grill Cafe! My wife and I eat out all over town 3-5 meals a week. We may have become spoiled a little. So when I say to my wife "Let's Eat Greek" I know she will just look up and say "Yassou"    Ika

This place has the best Greek food we have ever tasted.  It's our new favorite spot. The people are so friendly and it feels inviting   I love their Greek pizza.  My husband eats the youri and chicken plate.  I give this place 10 stars if I could.
I love Mediterranean food and was hoping it would be good..Nope..Just not close to my standards..I ate half and chucked the other half when I realized just how lousy the food was..

OMG! Being a Greek has its privileges. Understanding Yassous to be like Gramma's homemade Greek food is one of them. The Dolmades (warm with meat) are to die for. The only bad thing about Yassous, is trying to decide what I want each time. The Spanakopita, Moussaka, Pastitsio, or the Big Fat....awesome stuff!!

Regular customer for several years.  I have to say the food is consistently delicious.  The fresh dolmades are excellent, best in town hands down.  Everyone is always friendly and helpful.  I've tried several other Greek/Mediterranean restaurants but Yassou's tops them all!  Worth the $, the quality of the food + large portions are totally worth their prices.

One of my professors recommended this place during a conversation about places to eat around.  The location was easy enough to find. I ended up parking in the McDonalds parking lot and walking next door. The decor is very nice with a few tables outside for outdoor dining during the warmer months.  Greek Fries Standard fries with feta cheese and some chopped parsley. Given the price difference between Greek fries and American fries being 50cents more i would have gotten the standard fries. There just wasnt enough feta or herbs to enhance the fries and make them tastes different or Greek for that matter.  Chicken Souvalaki Overall excellent, the side salad was fresh and crispy, could have done with a few more olives. The Pita bread is EXCELLENT soft and chewy very nice texture. Excellent rice pilaf, buttery with a fresh lemonly taste. Chicken was cooked to perfection, nicely flavored and still juicy in the middle.  I would highly recommend this place to others and will definately come back to try out other dishes.

I've been coming to this restaurant since it opened. This is an amazing little cafe. Food is always good. It's not fast food. But it is fantastic food. It's worth waiting for your order to come up. If you are in a hurry and want to take it to go call ahead.   Peter and his crew are always on the move.
Who can say no to some yummy greek food? Lemond herb and gyro platter and a sode of hunmous ooooooooweeeeeeh so delicious! Two thumbs up

Yassou is one of the best places I have been to here in Las Vegas. It is hands down the best Greek spot I have eaten at. The place is very spacious. Staff is friendly. Lots of options to choose from they even have a vegetarian menu. My wife and kids loved and because they at everything usually when we go eat the just pick at it but they at everything because the food is so flavorful every last bite of it.

All I have had here is the Greek Salad and the Greek Fries.  With that said, let me tell you how much I love both these items....together...one on top of the other!  It is a marriage made in heaven and before a big test I must have this for comfort!  Will return after the stress of nursing school has left my life to try a Gyro that I have seen in many reviews :)

Great place for lunch! I was introduced to  Yassou through friends and am so glad I was! Their chicken lunch special can't be beat. One chicken skewer (seasoned and cooked perfectly), rice, side salad (with the best Greek dressing ever) and pita bread w/ a side of tzatziki, all for less than $10. If you're feeling extra hungry, order the Greek fries - you won't be disappointed. Fries with feta, parsley, and I believe a squeeze of lemon (?). Yummy!  Be prepared because they do get very busy during lunchtime, but it's worth it!  They are family owned and nice people. They also own the dry cleaner in the same strip mall (super reasonable prices) so you can kill two birds with one stone!

Love this place. My husband and I ate there on a weekly basis at one point. Food is delicious, fresh, and consistent. Only gripe is tables were always dirty - it is pretty casual, but if in-n-out can keep their tables clean, I think this place can handle their 10 tables a little better. Obviously, the food is so good it did not deter us from coming back again and again!

I'm not fluent in Greek, but I'm pretty sure Yassou means "delicious food". Found this place on Yelp and bookmarked it, then heard from my BF that it was an old favorite place of his, so naturally we went by our first full day in town.  The lunch specials are well-priced and delicious- for $10/each we got a gyro (the big fat for him, the lemon chicken special for me), with greek fries and a drink. Not bad at all, and portions are huge. Price for value is excellent.  Both gyros were delish, but i'm more a fan of the traditional gyro meat rather than the chicken, though it was good to see a healthier option on the menu. Worth a try, at the very least. Greek fries are the bomb- regular fries with feta, and maybe some garlic?, and parsley. Delicious. And for a take out order, they are carefully wrapped so as not to displace any of the plentiful crumbly cheese. Smart thinking!  Love how the owner himself is working alongside the employees to make and fill the orders- great sign and also underscores the quality you can expect here.
Good environment. Love the Greek Fries. I haven't had much else. Also it's a Pokestop!
Hands down the best Greek food I have ever had.  Authentic feel, friendly service.  I would make a recommendation of what to get, but it is all amazing and made to order!!!  Can't wait to go back!

Wanted greek food today, had to go get it.    The MIni Souvlaki Special includes a chicken skewer, minus the beef skewer (I had enough beef this week), yellow rice pilaf, pita bread, small greek salad, and tzatziki.  This was the best greek food I have ever tasted.  The chicken was tender and juicy, the salad was fresh with fluffy feta cheese, and the bread was warm and soft.  If you want great greek food, this place is where it's at!

Good food good environment, went around 2 pm they weren't busy but it took 25 minutes to get our food. The people who ordered right in front of us (same items) got their food 15 minutes sooner.  I will go back again I just hope the food doesn't take as long to arrive. Without the wait I would give 4 stars.
This was pretty good. Prices low and a good spot to go for Greek food. The portions were large enough to take some home for later. The Greek fries were excellent! Yum ! Will go again.
Fantastic food and fair prices. It's hard to find a good Greek restaurant, but we've finally found it and that's yassou. All the meat tastes fresh and yummy.
My favorite place to eat in Vegas.. never a disappointment and the owner is always soo friendly

Yum! So glad I live close to this little gem. The gyro meat is some of the best I have had. It was flavorful and moist, and the tzatziki sauce was on point. I chose the chicken souvlaki and gyro meat plate it was around $12. It came with a small salad, rice and warm pita. I didn't care too much for the rice, but not because it was bad, just because I am not a fan of that style of rice. The owner was welcoming and friendly, and I appreciate that he helped out in the kitchen when it got busy to get the orders out quicker.  I can't wait to come back and try some of the other items on the menu.  Yelp 2015 Review #27

Have been obsessed with Greek/Mediterranean food for about 2 years now and this place is the best I've tried so far. Even beating out bigger chains like Luna Grill in California, whom I do love when im in town but if there was a Yassou in Cali I'd never step foot in a Luna Grill again. Not only are their plates mouth watering but the portions are large and very fairly priced. Large portions, financially savvy, and healthy?? It'd be irresponsible NOT to eat here! 5 stars without a doubt.

Huge portions, reasonable prices, and it tastes good? What more can you ask for.   I ordered a Greek salad with beef and lamb gyro on top. It was so delicious! My two complaints were that the olives not being pitted. I almost broke my tooth biting into it. My other complaint was that they charged $.50 for some gyro sauce. Which I think should come with it since it kinda was a gyro salad.   My girlfriend ordered a plate and it came with so much food! I loved the pita bread they have here because it's so soft and fluffy! How I like my bread.   Can't wait to come back and try their actual gyros!
Great food and extremely friendly staff!!! The hummus and pita bread is to die for! :) Would absolutely be back to this amazing Greek establishment!

I just ate at this restaurant. I had the Greek salad with gyro meat which was excellent. What I really enjoyed about the restaurant is in addition to good food, there's a very pretty patio to sit outside. We were lucky to have great weather so it was a very enjoyable experience. The owner came by and spoke to us and was very friendly. All in all its going to be a very refreshing new place to go to.  I really enjoyed it.

This place has the best Greek food in Lv. Great atmosphere! I have come here 5 times in the last month. Im hooked on great food and above and beyond great service. All the staff are awsome!!! And also all the customers that patronage the place makes it feel like one big happy greek family!. All smiles here w this place.
