O ya it always seems to be full when i go so expect to wait 15 min give or take for food to come out.

Yassou was delicious!  I ordered the chicken pita - juicy lemon herb chicken, veggies and just the right amount of tzatziki.   Loved it.  Also ordered a side of the dolmades (stuffed grape leaves).  Unlike most places that serve the oily canned meatless variety, these are homemade with ground beef.  It was odd though - in some, the meat was juicy and in others it was dry and crumbly.  Obviously I preferred the juicy ones, but they were hit and miss.  I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.  Great place.

My wife and I ate dinner there last night.  We each ordered the big gyro with Greek fries.  The food was really good and the portions were generous.  The staff was very attentive and the restaurant was remarkably clean.  We'll be back.
Woke up in the middle of the night craving a nice gyro.... Hmmmmm the feta cheese and yassou takes pride in the Quality...
This place is okay. Food does seem to be bland. My Greek fries seriously had 3 pieces of feta. The beef lamb was also bland. The staff was nice. I will not be back.

My first time visiting this place, and I am glad I did. Came in for lunch  with some work buddies. Really fresh, and we'll priced. I ordered the lemon steak gyro, and some french fries. The gyro was the best I have ever had. The steak was cooked well, and very flavorful. I will definitely be back!

What a great dining experience! We've driven by many times and always wanted to stop in and today we did! Greek music playing lively bouzouki, the wonderful smells of fresh food cooking and greetings from the staff. The place was hopping with a lunchtime buzz! We had a great meal that arrived in a timely manner and served by a friendly young man. So much food we took some back home with us. On our way out we stopped to refill our drinks and we were graciously thanked by the owner and invited back! What a great place!

Being born and raised in Michigan near Detroit Greek town I was spoiled with amazing Greek food. Whenever I'm craving a gyro I come here to Yassous it's pretty good not quite Michigan Greek town good but it's pretty close. Service is excellent greeted right away by the guy that runs the place and he checked on everyone to make sure everything was good! Def my go to place for some chicken souvlaki & gyro

Best gyro in town! Can't go wrong with the spanakopita and gyro plate. Excellent portion size and the dressing for the salad is amazing. Would recommended this place to everyone. This place is a must try!

A solid place for Greek comfort food in a casual cafe-meets-deli atmosphere.  Everything we had was delicious and served promptly.  My lemon-herb chicken pita went down very easily: savoury and herby and all-round yummy.  Hubby had a veggie combo with dolmades, spanikopita, etc. and enjoyed each bite.  Major points for food deliciousness but a star taken off for dirty floors and slightly sticky tables!  (I've made those comments about other places....broken record? or just over-observant clean freak?)  Staff was not as friendly as I expected them to be, but I'm still giving 4* because the food was great.

I can't believe I have been driving by this place for years and never stopped in! My husband and I just dropped by for a gyro and it was as good as it gets. We love gyros and tzatziki and Yassou's didn't disappoint. The Greek fries just tasted like regular fries, so I probably wouldn't pay extra for them next time. We also tried the baklava which was very rich and sweet in a light syrup. Will definitely return!
The best Greek food in Las Vegas. Everything is so fresh. Their Greek fries are delicious.
It's quite a hike from the airport/strip. Wasn't bad at all but nothing to write home about.
Love the chicken skewer plate, cute little lunch spot for me and my family, friendly service, but really... What's not to love?
Holy shit this place was delicious and Chris the owner was a super cool dude too. Definitely five stars on the service food and cleanliness. They have inside and outside dining
They have the best Greek food ever!! Reasonable prices, I come here every couple weeks and the staff is great. I recommend this place to anyone who enjoy Greek food

A gem in the Section 10 neighborhood. Very reasonably-priced all-day "lunch" plates/specials, and a very neighborhood feel. The owner/manager is always there and more than happy to make sure you have everything you need to grab a good, home-cooked Mediterranean meal.  You can't ask for much more than that.   Hot sauce options are slight - you've basically got a big community bottle of Cholula that you might have to "borrow" from one of the other diners. If that's a dealbreaker, just bring your own potion and keep it secret. :) I'm gonna next time I go. Cholula is just not hot to my seared 'buds. But that's my problem, I guess!
Big fat gyros, Greek salad and baklava were all wonderful! Would do the 10 mile drive again!

Not often am on that side of town. Whenever I do make it point too get my greek on! I think by far the best Greek food in Vegas. Everything on the menu is Greek heaven! I always get the gyros and spankopita! The gryos meat juicy, spot on cooked, as is the spankopita, and awesome greek salad (love the dressing, nice black greek olives, nice feta chesse, cucumbers) and rice. The price really REALLY affordable talk about food for under $10 get money worth! I tried the baklava normally never have enough room by the end. I had lunch with friends visiting decided too try much different things off the menu. Dessert was one of them. Nice. Really sweet and rich but then again that the only way I think of baklava! Music playing is authentic Greek music. You truly get that feeling of old school family (hold less then 80 people?) run restaurant. Not chain restaurant and tell the quality of the food feels like family secrets from one generation too another.   The staff is really friendly and visitors in town not normally eat greek food had questions. The server was very attentive and answered all of my friends questions.   The parking ample parking in front of the building the only thing gets me each time. I tend too miss the entrance for that little shopping complex. It tends too sneak up on you and that the only entrance for that shopping area. I had too turn around. Still for piece of Greek heaven so worth it! =)))
We love this place! Great food and frankly some of the best service you'll get in Las Vegas! Thank you for being affordable and consistent!

I have never been disappointed with my food from here. I usually get the super lemon-herb chicken Pita and a side of Greek fries and occasionally I'll get a side of hummus. My taste buds are screaming  from all the delicious flavors I love how fresh and flavorful the food is, and that the owner always remembers me and my boyfriend no matter how long it's been!
Ordered their Greek Lemon Drop Soup for my Greek Grandma and she loved it.  We'll be back to try some more of her favorites.
Yassou is one of my favorite Greek places!!  Homemade rice pudding, fresh food and great service!!  I've eaten here many times and I am in love with the gyro plate!!
My favorite thing on the menu is the Greek fries, they come covered in lemon, seasonings, and feta. Seriously amazing!!

I've tried my big fat gyro, the steak pita, and the gyro and steak souvlaki combo plate. Everything I've tried here have been insanely good. I didn't think I could finish the gyro and the pita but found myself devouring it. The gyro and steak souklaki combo plate is a huge serving. The steak was cooked perfectly. It went well with the rice pilaf and salad. The tzatziki sauce is addicting! I almost came back the next day to order it again. Customer service is friendly and excellent. An excellent choice to satisfy your Greek food craving!

This is one of my go to places for gyros. Growing up in Chicago I know what good Greek food is and sadly, Vegas is really lacking in the Greek category. Yassou's does satisfy my gyro craving though every time. The meat is always fresh and the sauce is the perfect consistency. The prices are fair as well. For the quality, definitely worth the price. I just wish it was located closer to me.

I was looking for mediteranean And find this place with the help of Yelp!!It was lunch time and they had lunch special the chicken was good, not a 5stars because the service was little too long  and the table outside not clean but for the price i have no regret and Yes i will go back if i am in this area of town!!

You definetly get your fill for the price. The flavors here are good but not great. Definetly worth it if you have a craving for Mediterranean and dont want to fix it at home. Not bad though. Will give it another shot when I get another craving. Lol

I absolutely love this place. Nice family restaurant and amazing Greek food. We stop by every time (at least once) we're in Vegas and have shared this place with friends and family and they all love it too. Everything I've tried is great but the my big fat gyro sandwich is my go to.
The Yassou gyro was really good and fries w/ feta cheese were tasty. Only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because I felt the portion was small for the price.

This is absolute best Greek in all of VEGAS and maybe beyond. I've had friends from Chicago tell me this beats anything they have there. We use them for catering as well. Authentic and the staff is fantastic. I would eat here every day if I could. Get the Greek fries.

Continuously the best Greek food I've ever had. I have been here 4 times and never once had a bad meal. I think that is because this is a family run business that puts the quality of their food 1st. They also know that they are number 1 for a reason, and that's because of all their customers who continue to return for the best Greek food in Las Vegas. I know I will be back again, and again!!

Thing I like most about Yassou is the lemon herb marinade/sauce that they use on several of their items.  They do this well.    Generally speaking, I'm not going to go out of my way to eat here.  I think there are better Greek/Mediterranean places at about the same price-point...and most of them are sit down places with more comfortable seating.   The gyros are solid here...they do their chicken gyros better than average...nothing else telling my stomach to tell my brain to come back here though.  I do love their black and white checkerboard tiles :)

Yum Yum Yum. Need I say more? This place rocks. Pizza for my picky son,a big fat gyro for my daughter who misses them from our trip to Greece, and for Mama a platter, really reasonable, really yummy, really fresh.
Great food.  Good service. Too much dressing on the salad but good vibe. The chicken and gyro tasted very good..
Really great Greek good!!! I am obsessed with this place! The workers are very nice and you see the owner back there working in the kitchen. It's a nice hole in the wall kind of place. I love it!

I'm long overdue for a review. I've been coming here regularly for over a year, ever since I moved close by. This place is my weekly staple.  I have been known to eat here 3x a week! I have only eaten the chicken and steak souvlaki. The chicken and meat is probably the most flavorful, juicy, and tender I've had from comparable restaurants.  The Greek salad is awesome! The rice is to die for! The pita bread is so good too. This is a great family owned and run restaurant and the prices are awesome considering the amount of food and quality you get. Most plates are $8- $9. Peak lunch times you will sometimes see a line out the door.   Give this place try, you won't be disappointed. 8D
This is by far the best greek restaurant in town. I'm a vegetarian so I always get the spanakopita and greek salad.

Had a gyro and couldn't complain about it at all. The pita was warm and chewy, the meat was seasoned well and very tender and the all veggies were fresh and delicious. I can't wait to come back and try this place again and try some new items off the menu.
My favorite Greek place! I always order the Gyro salad and steak souvlaki plate and eat the leftovers the next day!
I'm from Chicago and let me tell you that these Gyros sandwich are the best. The Greek Salad or of this world and those Greek fries and cheese.

After dabbling a few different Greek joints, this by far is my favorite in the valley. At some point, it was a little inconsistent with the seasoning/cooking BUT that was a long ago and after coming here and giving it another chance, I must say it's 5 star quality. The workers are all nice, the food is great, the baklava is definitely something to drool over, and the overall ambiance of this place is amazing.

3 years later and this is the only place my husband and I go for greek food. The consistency after all these years is hard to find in resturants but they are still top notch. Nick the cook is always awesome and has been there since i started going.Thank you :)

Not really that great of a place. The gyro meat isn't that great here. 60%-70% of the time it's dry or old.  The salad is put in with the rest of the food on takeout causing it to get warm and humid. Souvlaki is alright.
I normally don't eat Greek food but enjoyed it. Will come back and try other stuff on the menu

Consistent delicious Greek food every time! The Greek steak salad is my all time fav - salads CAN be tasty and Yassou does an awesome job at that. The gyros and grilled chicken are excellent as well, and the avgolemono soup, as well as the dolmades. Love love love all the time.

I tried to come here for lunch, they totally forgot our order. They were super rude about it and not very helpful. But the kicker is that the chef was eating his lunch in the middle of making food. Seriously? Either he is so over worked he isn't allowed a break for eating, or he and management don't care about hygiene. Either option is not good. Will not be going here again.

Here's the straight forward deal on this place. If you want a gyro they're great. Makes a good tzatziki sauce. Uses Kronos gyro meat which I like better than even homemade ones I've had and they must sell enough that Pitts are fresh. However, I wouldn't get a Greek salad or any of the sides like tiramusalata etc. I ordered a few because I love all those sides. They were very disappointing. Grape leaves were so so (there is one place that has by far the best in town). I was told once a week they make their own, but the ones I had tasted like the canned ones, which are fine but not what I was hoping for in a mom and pop place. Greek food is tough in Vegas, which is why it's generally first stop when I go home. I was really hoping for better, and I'll still go back when I want a gyro because really those were excellent but if I want Greek food, I'll wait till I head out of town still.
The best hands down! We've tried most of the menu all amazing taste, portions, and quality. My husband and I would be in trouble if we lived near by

After three one-star reviews in a row, I'm happy to add this (what's going on with the businesses in Vegas?!)  Can't get enough of this place - the food is so delicious.  And the staff is great.  I sometimes pick up food to-go to take to my guy who lives five hours away in the mountain with no Greek, no Asian, no nothing food around and they are awesome enough to fulfill my request in separating certain things to prevent sogginess/etc.  Usually order the Big Fat Gyro, or the dinner places of lamb/beef.  I've had the chicken slouvaki and that was delicious as well.  I'm going to try and make some lemon rice because their's has inspired me so much.

Normally I go for the chicken souvlaki plate. Super delicious and have never been disappointed. Today I decided to venture out and tried the Greek pizza with chicken. It is to die for!!! The olives really make this pizza something special.

Light refreshing and flavorful! Who said healthy eating should be flavorless? They really have a way with adding flavor with natural ingredients such as yogurt, parsley, lemon, etc. I'm thrilled this place is down the street from us, they are really tasty!   I ordered the super lemon herb chicken pita. It was a nice big freshly homemade pita stuffed silly with grilled lemon herb chicken and lettuce, also dolloped with a good amount of their creamy yogurt sauce. Squirt some lemon on that baby and eat to your heart's content. It is really refreshing and flavorful! I was completely satisfied and I also didn't feel guilty or overstuffed. Just perfect!   My boyfriend ordered the steak souvlaki combo which comes with a side of greek salad and also rice pilaf. We really enjoyed this dish! The steak was cooked perfectly tender and the seasoning was just right to where you can still really enjoy the flavor of the meat. The rice pilaf was super flavorful and addicting. Also the salad had a super light dressing that didn't overpower the flavor of the meal at all. Everything went together very well.   The greek fries were not my favorite. I'm sure it's because we ordered them to-go and by the time we got home they were soggy. But they were also lacking feta, parsley and seasoning.   Other than that, the super lemon chicken herb pita is a winner! I can't wait to try their other pitas.

Solid Greek food.  I preferred their rice to other places in town.  Nice and fluffy without being dry.  The lamb was also nice and moist and nicely seasoned and spiced.   The service was good but it's a walk up counter don't expect table side service.  I would definitely put this over the other places in town.

I've been eating here since before Yelp! was even around (no seriously.)  And I love it.  For years I've come here on a weekly or so basis and gotten my to-go order for lunch at work.  I get the Veggie Kabob (Vegetarian here) but back in the day before I was a Vegetarian, I had the Steak Kabob - SO.  GOOD.  Also the Greek Fries are like heaven in your mouth.  I could eat them all day (and I do, and that's why I also have a gym membership.)  I also tend to order extra salad or rice when I go, because it's so good.  They have plenty of ample seating and a nice background noise of music, as well as a TV usually on during the day.    The staff is also really friendly.  I love to just go in there and chat with them while I wait for my food - they're caring and this is a great example of a family owned business that we need more of in Vegas.  (I know I've said it already: but TRY THE GREEK FRIES!)

Waiting for my food for an hour and its for pick up and I called 15 mins earlier then only to find out it was just sitting there the whole time. I understand its packed and busy but waiting for no reason is a waste of time, always try to pay attention. Other than that the food is incredibly delicious and yes I will go back.

Terrible service. Ordered a chicken skewer plate and waited 30 minutes while who ordered after me received their food. I went up to the counter and told them that I hadn't received my food yet. Despite being given an order number, they couldn't remember what I ordered. I just asked for my money back.  Congratulations on your 1-star! Without a doubt the worst service I have ever received out here.

Best Greek food ever! Seriously I can't stop eating here! We came here 3 times in one week. I have had the lemon chicken gyro and it's soooo soo good! Chicken is juicy and has the perfect amount of lemony taste.  This place gets really busy at lunch so leave enough time to get your food. Owner and staff is also very friendly!

Hands down best place in town, we love their food and their service.  You alway feel welcome.  The food is amazing, great flavor and they always use fresh ingredients.  I highly recommend their Dolmades (Stuffed grape leaves), they are incredible.

Great food. Highly recommended, probably the best Greek food in Vegas.   Service VERY SLOW. Make sure to order in advance. Gyros meat is freshly roasted and shaved in the back; it doesn't get much more authentic than this.  Chicken Souvlaki was great; reflected all the classic flavors of Eastern Europe. Hummus was fresh, light, delightfully spiced, and tasty.   Enjoy.

Satisfied desire for Greek but not the best.... I love Greek food and have had many places. The spanikopita was not balanced... Way more dough than spinach and cheese. The salad was also not proportioned and I don't remember Greek salad with well done croutons. The hummus was good but pitas were Not made there as seen in the bags sitting on the counter.  They also were disorganized for a busy time of day with people snapping rude comments running around. One girl was nice and tried to be helpful but the guy then overpowered and was short with her even right in front of us. Now I love spanikopita so I guess my search continues.....

I've lived across the street from this hidden treasure for almost a year! I'd seen it plenty of times, and although I'd never eaten Greek food, I wanted to give it a try. So finally, I decided to try it. Because it was new to me, I decided to keep it simple. I ordered the Spanakopita. Lord have mercy, it was a flavor overload that my taste buds had been dying for!!! Imagine, such a simple dish with amaze ball flavor!   Since then, my husband has become addicted to the "big fats"; and I've tried the dolmades, and pastitsio. He's also tried the lemon herb chicken pita. We both have yet to be disappointed. In all honesty, we eat here weekly. So much so that when I call in my pickup order, they know it's me...and they make sure I get my 'spana'. Keep up the good work guys! We love and appreciate everything about Yassou!

I use to eat here EVERYDAY??   But I moved. Little far this is my favorite place there Greek food is AUTHENTIC   Always tastes fresh and very flavorful..... My favorite is the lemon herb chicken salad   U can see them making your good which is nice of you have some sort of trust issues....  This is defiantly a place I have never had anything bad To say about its amazing and I totally will keep Going and recommending
We have been all over Las Vegas and no other Greek place compares. The food is superb and the price is amazing.

i think this is the best place to eat greek or meditaranian food in Las Vegas. This is also family owned business for longest time in Las Vegas west area. Owner is the chef means always good food. Its always fresh and clean. Love their own sause and Big fat gyro. Checken greek salad has unique taste and way different that othe greek joints. Hidden place but  Must try!!!

Efcharisto! It is impossible for me to truly express my gratitude to the son of the owner of Yassou, who, despite the long take out order line out the door, continually asked my mother and I if we were satisfied with our meal. Satisfied hardly does this excellent Greek Restaurant justice! The souvlaki combo was composed of moist, succulent chicken that just fell off the skewer and the beef passed the same test remarkably well. The owner's son, who waited on us, made certain that calamari was available and placed our order. 10 minutes later we had our food. Terrific portion sizes, delectable entrees and sides, and mixed greens on the side for those of us who want to up their game when it comes to nutrition. Best Greek food this side of town? Hands down the best! Thank you for being close by and I will definitely be back soon as well as often!

This place is right around the corner from our house! Lucky us! We eat here at least once a month. I've never had anything I didn't like. Usually get the gyro souvlaki and have plenty of leftovers. Love me some Yassou's!

Stopped in as we were passing through the area - so glad  we did. Best Gyros ever! Meat was very tender and flavorful. Soup was fantastic. Baklava was wonderful - not overly sweet, savory and flavorful.  We will be back!

For Vegas there aren't many great Greek or middle eastern places. This place was awesome. I had the big fat gyro with fries and a drink as a take out order they didn't skimp on the meat and it was delicious. The pita was soft and flavorful. Fast friendly service. Will definitely return. Wish there was one in the north side.

I heard great things about place but but the one reason I'm giving this place two stars is because of bad management. The one time I went there to get their legendary lemon-herb chicken soup is when they were out. And, it was only 3pm. I was still recovering from a fever so my trip to tget food took way longer. I'll probably give this place another try sometime but until then this place has left a bad taste in my mouth--so to speak.
Recently, dined in and the food was fantastic .. Best Greek food in town. Their rice is always perfection.
Great atmosphere authentic feel and food we really enjoy coming here . The souvlaki is amazing and the have the best tzatziki sauce love it . Try the Greek fries !

Pro tip: The Gyros are full of good stuff so for an extra dollar you can get some extra pita bread (definitely tell them you don't want it cut up though because they did when I ordered it and it completely defeated the purpose of me trying to make an extra gyro. For that they lost a star.)   My bf and I came in here and ordered the big fat gyro and the super lemon steak pita. The onions are really sharp and give you that extra crunch to your pita. Pair that with the Greek fries and you're set for an extra delicious lunch. The fries are exactly what you want. Crispy and lightly dusted with fresh parley and feta cheese. Some places can over do it. My dish was great but it was falling apart (which is why I needed the extra pita). It fell on my dish and suddenly I was full. My bf really enjoyed his meal. He typically orders his gyro without any lettuce. I keep all the good stuff in. It's a perfect hearty rainbow meal. And if you're like me you can save some for a snack later.

Omg, if you want a fabulous fresh meal, this is the place to go.  Their salmon is out of this world, the best in town. The lemon sauce is wonderful and the fish is fresh and moist.   We have been coming here for many years and have never been disappointed.   The staff is friendly and the owner takes pride in his restaurant.    You will not be disappointed.

I'm new to the area and asked a coworker were I could find a Greek restaurant. This place did not disappoint! I was skeptical about the wait time because I decided to go inside to place an order for take out. The wait time was short and the food was fresh and delicious.
U cant go wrong with this place i love everything .....the chicken the steak salad smoothie bannas .yum yum yum

I typically order for pick up. The service is fine. No complaints there but it doesn't rank highly among some of the other Mediterranean places I like in Vegas i.e. Shish Kabob House  and Market Street Grille. The meats and veggies and rice all seem to be better quality at these other places. They do give pretty good quantity for the price but it's not a place I'd recommend if you have other options nearby.

My go to place for Greek food! It's so so so so good! I always order their mini souvlaki plate. Everything is always made fresh to order and is very well seasoned. Their Greek fries are also really good too. Basically anything you order will be delicious haha. Trust me!

I can honestly say this is a neighborhood restaurant that stays consistent.  The food is excellent, you cant beat the price for the well portioned meals, and the service is fast and friendly.    I've moved out of the neighborhood but I can say I'll go out of my way to come here for a great meal.

Was visiting a friend and saw this Greek place and WOW what a great find in LV! had the skewers, the hummus, the pilaf, the salad. SO GOOD! The staff was friendly and came over to deliver our meal. Great food. Other Greek people were eating there so it must be good! GO THERE! so yummy and the staff is engaging!  I can't say much else but I wish they were here!

I've been to many Greek restaurants and this is on the top of my list! This time, I ordered the salmon plate and it was divine!! Salmon wasn't dry or over cooked. It's actually the best salmon I've had from a Greek/Mediterranean restaurant! My 10 month old son enjoyed their avgolemoni. Definitely will be coming back here with my family again. Service was fast and friendly.

I went here tonight for the first time.. My order was completely screwed up and didn't even get a receipt. I even ordered cucumbers with my hummus and the guy at the counter said sure no problem but I never heard him mention it to the chef.. It appears I got the totally wrong order even though I stood there with a number which he called out!! I would never go back to this place.. Paymons and even the Mad Greek blow this place out of the water for both flavor and service. The fries which weren't even what I ordered Tasted horrible too !!!

I am a Food Network restaurant chaser.  Mainly Diner, Drive ins and Dives.  Not sure why this restaurant hasn't been profiled yet.  Great food, great prices.  Wonderful family owned business that takes pride in food quality and presentation.   I wish all restaurants had the same standard.  Worth the drive if you are from out of town and coming from the strip.

Let me start by saying that I am not a huge fan of Greek food. This place is pretty fantastic. I got the lemon herb steak salad and for something so simple, it sure was mighty tasty! The chef is friendly and will make suggestions for you as well.
Mostly Greek men working the grill and counter. Quality food, attentive staff, lively atmosphere. Had the Gyros sandwich several times and finally tried a combo dish and did not disappoint.

After trying a drive-thru greek stop and a couple others on Sahara, we decided to hop on to Charleston and give this place a try.  It looks so fresh and inviting in the building it's in, and because it's one of those places that you would normally drive by on a regular day, I wanted to see if it was any good.  My husband is the Greek food lover, while I am just so-so on it.  We ordered a lot--the stuffed grape leaves, two big gyros, some dessert, seasoned fries, pita bread and hummus.  Everything tasted great--the gyro was in this soft, yummy pita with some feta cheese and veggies.  The meat was really good, too.  Nicely seasoned.  The hummus was my favorite, and I had to order extra bread to finish it off.  I didn't eat the grape leaves but my husband said it was really good and had a strong herbal flavor to them.  They made this honey pastry cake and it was mildly sweet and sticky.    Overall, the food was great for a Greek stop and we frequent that place when we are in the mood for that kind of food.  The owner is there working once in awhile, and his son is there all the time.  Having a family work the business is a great sight to see, and ensures for me that they care about their food and therefore the quality there will always be good.  If you like Greek, you should give this place a shot and see if you become addicted to it or not.  Lots of yelpers are fans, and although the good was great, I'm not a total fan.  For me to give four stars it has to haunt me in my dreams.  Still, great food.
It's great here. Friendly staff, delicious food.   The souvlaki combo is my favorite. They also have a mini souvlaki combo, not on the regular menu, but posted by the register. It's still huge.

I love me some Greek. I had just moved to Vegas and was looking for a good Greek place. I think I have tried them all. Only Yassou's was worth my time to sit down and write a review. I haven't had anything there that wasn't amazing. I go at least once a week and every new person I bring there loves it. So glad I found this place. Try it. You won't be disappointed.   FYI the Super Lemon Herb Chicken Pita is nothing short of magic.
No other Greek restaurant compares to this place. While it can be a bit pricy, it has never let me down.
I am not a fan of Greek Food but this place was AMAZING. The food is fresh and so good. If you are looking for a great "Greek" place with food that melts in your mouth, this is the place...
Yum Yum! Delicious, great service, great food. The chicken salad was so good and tasty and the chicken was juicy and lemony. I'll be back soon!
Don't go there Sundays I got so sick I was in the bathroom for 3 hours I got a sandwich and it hardly had any meat inside it was full of sauce
This place is so delicious! The restaurant itself is a bit small and tucked away, but none the less the food is  good. The portions are pretty generous and the prices are not bad.

This is one of the best places for Greek food. They have an amazing selection of food and drinks. They get extremely crowded during lunch time, so be prepared for that. Otherwise, I'll be coming back here anytime I have cravings for Greek food!
Best lemon chicken salad! The staff is always so welcoming and friendly and the food is delicious. You can't go wrong with yassou
Authentic! Amazing! Flavorful! Price is on point! Never a disappointing meal. Recommend this place to families too!

I genuinely love the food here. The chicken and pita bread is so darn delicious. The staff is always so friendly. My food is always fresh. The greek salad dressing is delicious so get extra. They have great lunch specials too. I also get the baklava. I have had the beef plate which was good, but I think the chicken is better. The greek fries are yummy  I love the fact that you can see the kitchen, you can see the cooks prepare your food. Cleanliness is a must. They also have a very nice patio for dining.

Overall good food and would return for another meal... Our experience began oddly... As we were ordering, we were told there was no mango for smoothie... Jokingly, I told  the guy he was fired-- and he was ready to walk-- bad day apparently. After settling our order we sat and were served someone else's order... Which ended up a treat for all of us involved in the snafu (hope the kid who made the mistake isn't punished too harshly-- we left happy) we received the wraps given us in error, plus a complimentary potato caviar dip which I would never have ordered before this but now we will!! We enjoyed our dinner and have lunch for next day too!! And we'll be happy to eat it!!

Yummy yummy in my tummy! Best Greek food in town. They never get an order wrong and always took to perfection. I love how the owner is always there and in the back cooking as well. Real friendly and always fresh! Even open on Sundays  my favorite are "my big fat gyro" and "Lemon herb chicken salad" and don't forget the baklava for dessert!
Best Greek food in town. Spankopita & greek fries are awesome. Perfect for lunch don't forget they close fairly early no late dinners here.

This is our second time here and the food was great. The dining room could definitely use some love. It's a little cramped and getting to the outside tables is slightly confusing. The service was very friendly and I'm thinking this may be our go-to Greek place   If you're on the fence I say its worth a shot. Stop in and see what you think.   So far I haven't strayed far from the gyros but I plan on further exploring the menu (hopefully not at the detriment to my waist size ;) )

Went in for Some Greek food today I walked into the Greek Grill, the girl at front her nose was red as if she had a bad cold it was running and she was wiping her nose with her hand. I decided right then and there I am not eating here cause I don't want her handling my food and going food without gloves  Gross , walked out   Too bad , the menu look great ... But the lack of sanitary practices made our appetites go away

What's not to love about homemade Greek food served with a smile in heaping portions at reasonable prices? Family owned and it shows in the consistently good service and quality. I'm a big fan of the Spanakopita (flaky pastry stuffed with spinach and feta cheese), the gyro meat and the lemon garlic chicken skewers. You can double up on salad to keep it healthy or comply with all the low carb diet needs. There is a cute outdoor patio and plenty of indoor seating. Limited parking is the only downside to this delicious lunch spot.

TOP GREEK CAFE SO FAR!   **2016 YELP 100 LV CHALLENGE #1**   SO I thought I had tasted the best Greek cafe mom & pop shop, but w/ the new year I have found another GEM in Las Vegas!! Although it is a bit far I am willing to drive the distance! We even saw the owner working his but off in the kitchen which you know that the food is being prepared at it's best!!   The staff are SUPER HAPPY all the time it seems & enjoy what they do. You can definitely see it in the food. You order your food at the redigister & pay then they bring out the food to your table.  The restaraunt is nice & big w/ outdoor seating as well. One thing that I LOVED was that it was SPACIOUS & clean cut... not too much decoration clutter everywhere. The high ceilings also a plus. The kitchen is an OPEN kitchen so you can see all of your food being cooked & you get all of the yummy smell of the food being prepared as well. One more thing was how CLEAN the freaken bathrooms were.   BIG FAT SPECIAL W/ FRIES & SODA $10.59 - the flame broiled beef & lamb is something I don't usually get but that's an automatic meat that comes w/ the big fat special.... I be so SURPRISED at how DERICIOUS the darn meat was & how much meat came in the gryo! You can make another gyro out of it.  SMALL GREEK SALAD $3.99 - I will have to say this was the least of my favorite.... I like my dressing a little more salty & acidic but this one was more olive oil than I would want. Still protiom wise it was pretty big for a small salad.  HUMMUS $4.99 - absolutely PERFECT flavor!!!! Just the right amount of garlic & oil w/ citrus... the pita bread was warm & fluffy  MEDITERRANEAN PIZZA W/CKN $8.99 - they use a 9" flat bread & make a pizza out of it! The ratios were all EVEN! Chicken pieces in every bite... an OCD person's dream pizza ahhahaha

I go to this restaurant all the time because the food is good and the staff is amazing. Paula, the Manager and the rest of the staff always greets everyone, and the food is the best in town. The food of course and friendliness of the staff is why i continue to eat there at least once a week.

This is my fave Greek restaurant. Now granted I keep ordering the same damn thing, but baby its done to perfection. Its ran by a real Greek family, and they are super nice. They seem to know all of their regulars. So go there you won't be disappointed!

This place feels so authentic. The service was great and the food was plenty. One meal was enough for my husband and I didn't realize how close it was to our house. We ordered the slouvaki combo and the meat was so tender and juicy. The salad was awesome and the bread was fresh. We got a side order of Parmesan covered fries and it was to die for. Will definitely come back again.
Always fresh, tender, tasty... spanikopita was dry but the food's usually very consistent.  Good food, value...2 can eat for under $20
The big fat gyro is so yummy!  One of the best gyros I've had for sure.  The pita bread is delicious and moist as well.  We will be coming back for sure.

This time we were able to dine in.  Therefore I was able to witness, and be able to provide a nicer review.  I'll say it's better to dine in for the sake of no confusion as to whether they are speaking to you; versus ordering by phone.  Much more charming to have your meal indoors.  Cultural music is played, sorta gives the feel.  Their walls are white and blue as you would find iconic in Greece.  Although it was extremely warm walking in, they turned on the a.c. and it cooled up pretty quickly.  Yassou is busy during lunch hour, and they do work fast.  I saw them brooming up under tables inside and outside, cleaning off tables as guests were through.  Not so spic and span, but average dining areas.  It's great that they have outdoor seating especially right now in November afternoons, Vegas still has pleasantly warm weather, sunny and blue skies.  I'll give yay points for their food being tasty.  We ordered Greek pasta with gyro (spaghetti with brown butter imported mizithra cheese) and a Gyro plate.  They're winners; again a lot of food on one plate and average prices.  Cannot get over their yellow rice - so yummy!!!

On their menu it says "Greek food never tasted so Greek."  And I agree!  We found this gem because it is located next to Hottie Hair Salon.  We came during lunch last week and the place was BOOMING!  We had to pile into a line that was poking out the door.  Every table was taken (except for outside) and we were worried that we wouldn't be able to find a table big enough to accommodate our party of five.  Luckily, we came a bit later than noon.  By the time it was our turn to order, the tables had cleared out some and we were able to grab a seat.  I was torn on what to get, but I was kind of hungry so instead of opting for the "My Big Fat Gyro" which comes with fries and a drink, I ordered the "Gryo Plate."  The plate came with beef and lamb, greek salad, rice, pita bread and tzatziki sauce.  It took about 10 minutes for our food to come, but the sign at the counter says to please allow 15 minutes.   At this time I was so hungry that I grabbed a piece of pita, put some meat in it and tzatziki sauce.  I took a bite and I couldn't help but be startled by what I did next.  I uncontrollably said "WOW!"  I had surprised myself when I did that, but it really was that good.  The food was fresh and delicious.  The plate offers very large portions.  I felt like I got a bargain for the price that I paid.  The employees were efficient and friendly.  The place was really busy and I could TASTE why.  Next time I come I am getting the "My Big Fat Gryo" special with american fries and a drink.   I am hoping to eat there again soon for lunch.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Always a perfect five star eating experience in this place. I'm in the restaurant business and I can appreciate when a place goes the extra mile to make it fresh with quality ingredients.

The Big Fat Gyro is the best I've had in Las Vegas, though I'll try to convince myself to order something different the next time I come here. Why? Because that damn gyro is as big as my head! I couldn't even finish it all. Garlic fries were good as well. This is an order at the counter and take a number back to your table kind of place. They'll bring it to you, don't worry. The place has a casual diner style ambience with a nice patio and super friendly service. The pricing is perfect as well. For two people, we only spent $20 on two big fat gyro combos with greek fries (blue cheese and garlic). The restaurant and parking lot were absolutely packed when we came, and I can definitely see why. This is clearly a local gem.

I read someone else's review who had ordered the same thing as I did, and we share the same sentiments. The chicken pita & Greek fries were not good. The pita was dry like it was three days old, and the sandwich itself had no flavor. Then oddly enough, on the last bite I hit a mouthful of pure salt. I had to drench it in tzatiki to make it somewhat enjoyable. The fries were hard--not crispy but hard and there was zero flavor as well which is hard to imagine. Hardly any feta, and I threw them away after eating a few. I never add salt to anything but everything needed some sort of seasoning.   The people at the counter were nice, but I don't see myself returning.

Favorite Greek place, hands down! The quality is amazing!  I've tried practically everything on the menu...all are good.  Don't look any further,  just come here. Spanokopita..a must get. Salads are always fresh, and compliment any of the entrees. Can you say gyros!? Get one..you won't regret it. They've been in business for a while,  and you can see why. Staff is friendly and they really know the menu.  They explain everything, and make recommendations. Love it! So happy we live close by,  and can come whenever.

One of my fav spots for Greek food! Everything here is good! I usually order either the Yassou pita, the spanokopita, chicken/steak souvlaki or any of the plates! I'm happy each time. The yogurt tzatziki sauce is delish! The hummus is great as well. Never disappointed !

Co-workers rave about this place so I decided to take a detour on my way home and stop by for lunch.   All I can say is:Yum! this is one of the better Greek restaurants I have eaten at. I ordered the gyro plate. It comes with a Greek salad, rice pilaf, beef and lamb, and pita. I took a seat and minutes later they brought out my plate. The meat is so tender, the pita was nice and warm and the salad was fresh. My only complaint was that although the rice pilaf was soft and fluffy it was a bit too salty for me. But I still ate it and before I knew it my plate was empty and I was stuffed.   As I went to the coke machine for a refill one of the cooks came out for the kitchen and asked how was everything. I still had a mouth full of food so I gave him a thumbs up.
Love this place! Don't get to come as often as I would like as I live so far away. Thank goodness I was in the area for a meeting.   Awesome food and 5 star service!

This has to be some of the best Greek food I have ever tasted.  I ordered the Moussaka Plate and it was amazing. The dish itself was warm and flavorful (not to mention filling!). The pita was freshly made and was the perfect side for my meal.  The owner was working his tail off to make sure everyone was happy and the staff was very kind. My wife enjoyed her meal as well (I forget what it was).  I will definitely be going back here. The tea was tasty and hot (boom!).

I Always get the gyro plate. It's so delicious and they give generous portions of meat. The cucumber sauce is so good although extra sauce is $0.25 per new container.   Also tried the steak and chicken kabobs and they were amazing.. Juicy and moist...  The pastitio is good too...
My favorite place for Greek food, my faves are the deluxe Greek salad, the big fat gyro and you have to try the Greek fries delish! Friendly service and super good food.

the taste was really healthy, you know you are eating at a local restaurant that keeps to their name and tradition. my wife and i came here for lunch coz apparently her and her coworkers eat here for lunch. she knows to order in prior to her break to avoid the wait since we only have 30mins to eat. The food was amazing in portion and taste and presentation. The customer service of everyone felt like what a business should be like, family-owned through and through. It's a clean place, also good location and this place was always busy. Parking could be a challenge but it is worth it.

Even though I have never traveled to Greece, I feel that every opportunity I have to indulge in Yassou I get a little taste.  First and foremost the staff and atmosphere is great.  The cashier who is there almost everyday and is most likely a member of the family, is fluent in Greek.  One of my friends is studying the language and soon found himself being schooled by the cashier.  The food is quite good and I have had many items on the menu.  I still prefer Market Grills Gyros because you have the option of hummus over the normal spread.  It is also slightly more expensive then market grill so be prepared for that.  But I think the experience here is more authentic.
Great food, packed place. Playing Greek music in the background. Glad I found this place, I'll be back soon!!

The best Greek food in Las Vegas, made to order.  Fresh, hot, and filling.  Serving portions are wonderful.  The service is top notch.  Christian and his father work to make sure our experiences are great every time!  We will be back again very soon.  Thanks so much Christian!

Customer service here is wonderful. Everyone is friendly and helpful.   The seating inside is limited but theres another area where people can sit too, its an inside patio.  The food is well super delicious. I love the grape leaves with meat inside my favorite. I have had the gyro and its so tasty. The meat is just right full of flavor exploding in your mouth. The Greek fries are my favorite fries anywhere. My go to is the lamb and chicken plate. Both meats are flavorful and good portions. Rice is made to perfection and the salad too. I haven't had the desserts but im sure they don't disappoint.

Ordered spanikopita plate which includes greek salad, rice, tatziki, hummus, pita bread, dolmades, and 4 triangles of spanikopita. Ordered some baklava too. Food was good, good portion size, and I will be back to try their pizza since they ran out of pizza dough.

The food is always seasoned just right. They never just overload on spices and hope for the best. I have ordered the chicken souvlaki here several times and it always tastes the same...always delicious.   I visit duting random times so I don't really know when they're rush is like but there are always people going in and out of the place. The service is always friendly.

One of my favorite places -- super love their Steak Souvlaki plate! The steak is always tender, delicious and bursting with flavor! Once a week, we do a special lunch/cheat day at work and 90% of the time, this is where we want to eat :) The staff is also super nice and friendly.

This is always my go to for fresh, healthy, delicious fast food! Call ahead and pick up or order in. Their kabobs are so perfectly grilled. The salad dressing is on point, and I have tried SO HARD to recreate it at home- but no. Ive been eating here for YEARS and love this place!!

Love this place!!! We've been here a couple of times and we just can't get enough of the Greek Fries!!! It might just be the best fries in town :) The lemon herb steak pita was soooo good! I'm craving for it right now as I think about it! Hummus is yummy! And of course, the Greek Salad is something we'll be coming back for! What a great place! It is family run and you can tell that they take pride in preparing the freshest and best dish for you!
Yummy! I love the pork skewers and salad! Lots of good stuff here. So far all I've tried here has been thumbs up! This place has a great vibe and location.
Very underwhelming and thought the food was going to be a lot better due to their amount of great reviews. The food was just alright.
This is my go to Greek spot in town. Food is always delicious. Great portions and an affordable price.   The Chicken and Steak Souvlaki Combo is the business.

Once you walk in, someone greets you. It seems like a family run business. The father I think does the cooking. I ordered the gyro combo and my bf ordered the steak souvlaki plate. The gyro was delicious. The meat was tender and flavorful. The steak souvlaki was so juicy, flavorful and tender. It almost melts in your mouth. The pilaf rice was delicious. I live how I can taste the spices in everything. I will definitely come back to try the infamous Greek fries. The added plus is that everyone is incredibly nice and service is on point.

I am never disappointed when I come here! The food is amazing! I feel like it's really made with love! Sometimes the line is out the door. That's how you know its delicious! The only thing I would like to see is a different set up maybe move the soda machine down so that the line is not interrupting guest that need a refill. Other than that I love this place and I will continue to eat here!

Love this place come here ALL the time but today sucked.  I had to come back for taziki and then there were no tomatoes on my gyro.. really frustrating  Super bummed I'm sick and all I wanted was a nice easy pick up meal.. having t come back really sucked.  Not sure why there weren't tomatoes on my gyro when they are included in them all the time... prly won't be back for a while as this happens twice in a row. Please pay attention to what guests order... they even read it back to me and still didn't get it right. I'm not one to review on yelp but this really pissed me off

I am a Greek/Mediterranean food fanatic.  After reading the reviews on Yelp I decided to give Yassou a try. I was pleasantly greeted by the man running the register. He seemed friendly on a personal basis with several of the customers there which is a good sign (repeat customers).  I decided to get Yassou gyro combo with Greek fries. I was very impressed with the gyro. It was delicious.  The greek fries were good, but not impressive.  The spices advertised must have left out.  I got regular fries with feta cheese and a little greenery on top, but they are only fries. I'll take a good gyro over fries any day. I look forward to trying out more of their menu.
This place is fantastic. I tried the saganaki, spanakopita, and the big fat gyro. Everything was delicious. The service was outstanding as well. You won't be disappointed.

This place gets great reviews but I thought it was just alright. Maybe I'm missing something... The steak kabob was decent, but the chicken kabob was better. The portion size of the combo platter was pretty big -- large enough to get two meals out of it.  The super lemon chicken pita was good. Full of chicken, lettuce, tomatoes and other tasty stuff. It's also messy. Grab several napkins especially if you plan to eat on the go.
Amazing Greek food in Las Vegas it is far away from the strip but the drive is totally worth it

LOVE and obsess about this place! Completely on the other side of town for me but one of the best Greek spots in town, fore sure.  The Big Fat Gyro, any meat, I tried the chicken and it was super flavorful and juicy. The Souvlaki Como, also an amazing pick, however, after a couple visits, I have decided the Gyro is my fave! Don't think you can go wrong with anything on their menu, especially if you're a fan of Greek food.

the restaurant is located at Charleston and Buffalo. Their menu has all the standard Greek favorites such as Gyros, Spanakopita, and Dolmades. They also have Greek Fries which is served crispy and piping hot and drenched in garlic, spices and feta cheese.   I love their Greek fries and Big fat Gyro and it was enough for two people. The price is decent and the service is good. You order at their counter and they deliver their food to your table.  The atmosphere is casual, clean and have outside seating. It is good place for me to bring a  small get together party.

Can't believe the negative reviews that I read.........huh???  We must not have eaten at the same place?!?!?!? I consider this place to be far superior to Paymon's and all the other Americanized versions of Greek food that you can find here in town.  As for Lapriel H., that yelped about the man behind the counter was a Will Farrell look-a-like, etc. etc....................if you had read the literature on the wall, you'd have noticed that the man you're referring to is the owner, originally from Cyprus,  and  he spends 14 hours a day there both cooking and interacting with the patrons.  ~I recommend the Big Fat Gyro.......oh my, it's AMAZING!  It's a mixture of lamb and  beef and the meat is sooooooo tender!  The veggies are fresh and crisp and the feta is of a good quality!  The size of this thing resembles its name.......BIG & FAT! ~The Greek fries are fantastic..........a taste of lemon, parsley, salt and feta! ~And lastly, the Baklava.........what!!!!!!  I compare every single piece of Baklava that I eat to my mother's, who in my opinion, still makes the very best, but this was fantastic in so many different ways!  For those people who like Baklava for its traditional flakiness........this will satisfy your taste buds but with quite a twist.  It's covered with a honey sauce that makes it mushy to just the right degree......almost a cake like texture.  I can't describe it, can't put it into words..... ~It's a casual, near fast food type place with a very homey atmosphere!   A+

Yassou Greek Grill Cafe is some of the best Greek food I've ever had. The restaurant is very casual, and is a great place to have lunch. Portions are very large though. The staff is very friendly and kind, and food was out in a reasonable amount of time (10-15 minutes) and was so flavorful and tasty. The location was also fairly easy to find. My favorite dish is the gyro and chicken skewer. Great place for lunch and also for a quick bite.

Fantastic Greek Food!! We tried chicken souvlaki,  gyro and souvlaki plate, hummus plate,  spanakopita and the rice pudding.  Flavors were fantastic, portions ample, and the value was great! Would eat here again and recommend to all my friends.  They don't have falafel, that's really the only downside,  also a slight wait,  but well worth it!

As the Greek Festival approaches and we see those placard reminders just about everywhere, I feel it's time I review the Yassou Greek Grill Café.   After the disaster that is the Mad Greek, I was afraid I would be inclined to allow my distaste to taint my review of Yassou, so I made sure to try it a couple of times.  Don't ask me to remember the names of my orders, other than there's always a gyro and usually some dolmades. What I do remember is that they always put my Tzatziki sauce at the side. Don't get me wrong, I love the stuff, just not always slathered on like they do at some places.  The gyro was really good, with the perfect combination of ingredients so you could enjoy each bite, with sauce or without.  The dolmades are always wonderful - just knowing they're hand made is a huge plus n my book.  I am so looking forward to the festival next month, I hope the food there is as good as Yassou does it, or better even.

I LOVE me some Mediterranean Cuisine, it reminds me of my time spent back east hanging out with my Greek, Persian, Spanish, and Turkish friends and first being exposed to new ingredients and tasty cuisines for the first time. It also reminded me of my time spent at the Wine Spectator Restaurant at The Culinary Institute of America at Greystone where the menu items we made covered flavors from the Mediterranean Regions, from Paella, Moussaka, Dolmades, Kofta, and Skordalia, to Avgolemono, Lavash, Taramosalatta, Spanokopita, and Baklava we did a little of everything. Also taking Cooking courses with Mediterranean food authority and chef Joyce Goldstein was a great bonus.  Wifey's not as big as a fan as I am, so I kinda had to sorta beg and plead and twist her arm to check out Yassou Greek Grill Cafe since we were close by...(It worked!) Yassou was a good find! Perusing the menu, I see Taramosalatta, a dip made from cured fish roe, potatoes, lemon juice and olive oil. I love that stuff and I order it as a starter."Whoa!?!?!? you even pronounced it correctly!?!?! Great choice!" The guy behind the register says with a surprised look...(Refer to above paragraph)  We also shared a Lemon Herb Chicken Pita and a Souvlaki Combo. The Taramosalatta arrives and we dig in. Yassou's version was okay, but I'm used to a stronger taste of the cured roe, and I didn't really taste the potato in there, more like overkill on the olive oil. Every bite of the pita was delicious as was the combo, but the beef skewer was a tad on the dry side. Overall, a solid meal, and I still have to try out a few other spots that were highly yelped (Paymon's, Zaytoon, Parsley, Great Greek, etc.) ALOHA!!!

One of my favorite places to get Greek food! The plates are so good, rice and gyro, steak plates, pita, you name it--Just get it to go, because the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  It's more cafeteria style than restaurant.  But the food is very good.  The steak in the steak salad is juicy and flavorful, and just the right amount.  The salad greens are fresh and perked up with herbs and a rich salad dressing.  The gyro sandwich is very generously stuffed with lamb and pork.  The french fries are meh.  The Greek fries are not quite right, either.  But get the hummus and pita instead, which is much better than the grocery store variety (if you've been getting by on that kind.)  The baklava is quite nice, rich, and not too sweet, but really sticky--in a nice way.  Try the sparking Greek water.  Call ahead and order for pick up.  It is much better than waiting, if you're going to take out (the best way to do here).  They can get backed up, and depending on who is up front, it can be a bit slow.  But believe it or not, it can even be romantic here, in the evening.

The Gyro's here are just ok,  Meat is not very spicy, too much lettuce in the Gyro.  The lemon Chicken soup is not good.  It tasted like campbell's with lemon juice added.  Very disappointing.  Dear Yelpers,  I need help! Please let me know where the best Greek Restaurant is in Las Vegas!!!

I've never had Greek food before this place and this place made me LOVE Greek food. Their gyros and beyond delicious, packed with meat and flavor. Let's not mention the Greek fries, my mouth is watering from just thinking about it and the lemon juice and feta cheese. The entire meal will fill you up for the day so the price is good for a meal this size. This place started my love for Greek food and I'm so glad I lost my Greek food virginity here. It's casual, the staff is very nice, and most importantly, the food is amazing!
Best little bit of money you will spend. Food is made to order and always tastes super fresh. I love the plate with chicken skewers, rice pilaf and salad, a perfect $10 meal. Check them out.
Took my food to go: big fat gyro, Greek fries and extra tzatziki sauce. Love this place for both the quality, quantity and price.

Greek food is one of my favorites and I googled this spot and wow the service was amazing! He was so kind and answered my questions about the menu! He even brought my food to my table where I was sitting! I will definitely come back thank you!
Love the food. Hate The new music is hideous old world music. Can't stand to eat in anymore.  Please get rid of it.  Been going every week for years

Great experience here! It was my boyfriend and I's first time trying Greek food and wow, pretty amazing stuff they have going on here. The minute you enter you suddenly feel like you're not in Vegas. The people working, the people around eating in the restaurant makes you feel like you're in Greece, very authentic. Their hummus was addicting, glad we had more than enough to take home. Their mizithra pasta was, amazing! And the boyfriend enjoyed his Greek plate mini filled with pork, chicken and lamb. We had an amazing experience here, would love to go again.

So So - Greek food... I have had better in smaller joint across town... not bad if you are on their side of town - light fare... Was looking for the Wow factor - did not find it... nothing wrong with the food - just average...  your constant companion,  ~deirdra

Yassou!! This is a one of a kind family run restaurant with excellent food and friendly owners. If you want a recommendation the Big Fat Gyro with Greek Fries special is excellent. All of the food is great and they expanded their dining area to accommodate the constant overflow of diners that they had.

One of the best places that I've been for Greek food in all of Vegas! The food is PHENOMENAL I've tried multiple things at Yassous but my favorite is The Pork Souvlaki! All the food is great though. Service is top notch also, most times ownership is at the restaurant and they are so humble and kind. My most recent visit there was a new employee I believe his name was Demario and he just made the whole experience joyful!  Good job guys! And Vegas go check out Yassous!!!
The atmosphere, food and service is superb. I would not hesitate ot return to Yassou and to bring my friends. If you like Greek and Mediterranean food you will love Yassou.
Their food is pretty good. But make sure to check your order before leaving. I've been here more than a few times for take out and everytime my order is wrong. Just disappointing.

The Yassou Greek Grill Cafe was one of life's little happy surprises.  Although I've lived in the area for over thirty years and they have been open for seven, this was the first time I walked in the door (due to the yelp reviews I read on my phone). The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars, was that it looked like my home office at tax time (a bit unorganized and cluttered) with half of the chairs upside down on the tables in the middle of the afternoon.  The service was friendly, and was told that they get very busy at lunch time.  The food was superb.  It was the best Greek food I've tasted since I left Chicago thirty years ago.  The dolmodes (thank goodness not vegan) had it's ground lamb and rice spiced to perfection, and was treated to love in its lemon sauce.  The spanikopita was probably the best I have ever tasted, with its filo dough layered and flaky, and very pleasantly spiced.    If I was blindfolded and served this food on a porcelain plate with silverware, I would have paid 50% more for the meal and would have thought the food was a bargain.  I can't wait to go back and try the pastitsio and moussaka.
Love this place! We come here often and the food is consistently delicious. Always fresh and just made.  Best Greek food in Vegas!
Okay seriously I freaking love this place. Everything here is delicious the owner is always here working with his son. It's just amazing food with great service!!
Again...fresh, tasty food.  Don't forget a piece of that scrumptious baklava!!  Best value in town when it comes to Greek.

Nothing fancy here, but foods are good, people are friendly, about 20 tables here. I especially like their calamari, rice, and Greek salad. About half an hour drive from The Strip, but it's worth the travel!

THE BEST GREEK FOOD IN VEGAS hands down!!!!!! Family owned and operated they always care about quality of their food.  My husband and I have been coming to this place for years and never ever had bad meal or bad service! Unfortunately we moved to a different part of town and cannot come too often, but we definitely make sure we visit them few times a year.  I can never get enough of their rice! Chicken souvlaki and Greek salad are my favorites. As well as their "Greek lasagna" - pasticio.  My husband loves their gyros.  We bring our family here every time they visit out of town. Everyone we brought to Yassou, loved it and wanted more :) Amazing food!!! Nightly recommend!!!!!!!

NEVER DISAPPOINTS! There has never been an item we've ordered here that we didn't like. Their gyro meat is amazing! The service is great! Their tzaziki sauce is the best. Something about their coke is great too! It's always crisp and just the right amount of fizziness!   We love this place!

Gyros Heaven for sure. We go at least once a week. Food is off the charts and sometimes the parking is bad like the white Range Rover that took up two parking spaces today at 330PM, but hey, their kids were with them so I did not shame them at the table.  Food? The best. Period.

I gave this place totally a five star rating because it is well deserved. Everyone is super friendly and the food is outstanding, very authentic to the Greek cuisine. Even has a nice little outdoor patio that you can dine.

My husband and I both ordered the combo plates with a chicken skewer and a beef skewer. It seemed like they were filling a catering order, so we had to wait a little while. But, the food was worth the wait. I liked how the plate had both rice and flatbread so we could try both. The meat also had good flavor and was juicy.  The man with the Bob Ross hair (the owner?) also came by, gave us a wink, and handed us a free order if feta fries :) They were so good.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be going back here.

Wow! This place is a local gem! The food is very fresh and usually cooked to perfection. The chicken is moist and tender, salad tasty and fresh and the pitas are excellent. I did try a piece of Baklava once and it was heaven on earth. This place is even worth a drive out if you're not in proximity. It is located near Summerlin around Buffalo and Charleston. Go see what all the hype is about at this place. You won't be disappointed!
This is the best Greek place in town we are NEVER disappointed!! You have to try it. Say hi to Christian and Pete
I haven't had much Greek cuisine in the past. Usually my experience has been not good with gyro's but this place is the real deal. It's a great place run by a real Greek. You must visit this place!

We stopped here after a trip to the Social Security Office. What a gem of a restaurant. Very clean. Everyone was so friendly. We had the Big Fat Gyro. The menu is so delicious I wanted all of it. I guess that means we'll be back until we have tried everything and we'll have it with the rice pilaf. I highly recommend this place.  I have had some great Greek food in Greek Town in Chicago and this place is as good. It's a must try.
This place was absolutely delicious. I just had the gyro, but there was just the right amount of everything. Definitely a new regular eat out restaurant.
A fantastic restaurant. The most wonderful service and excellent food. We left feeling full and really valued as a customer. Can not recommend enough!!! Just fabulous!!!

My wife and I were told about Yassou by a friend of hers, and they were right on the money. There is something about walking into this place and you know that it is going to have amazing food. It's set up like a mom and pop deli/restaurant outside the city limit establishment. No fancy entrance but not run down. Lot's of Greek flavor inside.  We ordered the gyro's (of course) and Greek fries. Simply amazing. The food took about 7 minutes or so to arrive at the table. Good size portions, I got the Big Fat Gyro, and I'm just happy to have finished it! The staff there is great! Very friendly and helpful. They could tell we were new there and were quick to point out some of the more popular items on the menu. Will be coming back for sure!
DE-LICIOUS! My dad and I come here every time I am in town! Get the Gyro and Souvlaki plate! So good!  You can really tell when people care- and that's what you'll find here. I love Yassou!

Chicken lunch special is always perfect- hummus with Pita bread is never a disappointment. Love love love this place. Always clean and the staff there is super friendly. If you must go between 11:45-12:30 consider take out. It so busy because it's so amazing.
I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. The owner is engaging and genuinely cares about the food which is refreshing in Vegas. Highly recommended

This is the best Greek food ever!  Our office placed a to-go order for 8 people.  The order was correct and the food was delicious!!  I really appreciate the vegetarian options.  The meatless dolmades are delicious but I really love the spanakopita.  I come here about one a month and have for many years now.  Thank you!
My large Greek salad, with lemon chicken, was missing the dressing when I got home and had a hair in it!!! $13 for that!!!

I've only tried probably about 5 different Greek food places but this has hands down been my #1 FAVORITE! Greek food has never really been my go-to meal but ever since I've tried this place I literally CRAVE it.  My boss introduced me to this place for lunch one day and when I tried I just couldn't get enough. She always orders me the Chicken skewer plate which comes with 2 skewers, rice, Greek salad, pita bread, and hummus. There's not one thing I don't like from that meal-- first off, the chicken is so juicy and flavorful, the rice pairs so well with the chicken, Greek salad is my favorite, and you can never go wrong with pita and hummus. Not only is the food delicious but they aren't greedy with their portions either-- it's a lot of food on that plate and I always end my meal with a happy tummy. I want to try more things on the menu but that chicken skewer plate is sooo good I feel like I just can't steer away from it.  I will for sure be back and I have already been telling most of my friends about this place. I literally had to get this again the next day after trying it for my first time so that my boyfriend try it too.

I really like this place-I even consider it better than Paymon's or any of the Greek places I've been to in Las Vegas thus far.  The prices are very fair for what you get, and because it is "fast-casual", you don't really need to tip-a dollar or two is sufficient (IMO).  Food is fresh and very good.  It's a smaller place and not fancy, but it is VERY clean and is quite attractive.  The only negative is that they close rather early for my tastes (around 8 PM), and I really like to eat around 9 on weekends.  It's definitely worth a try-it's sort of "out of the way" in a retail/office building next to McDonald's on Buffalo and Charleston.

the staff here is super nice. i love that they greet everyone as they come through the door. the food is super good and you know its made to order because it takes a bit before they bring it out to you. i had the gyro and steak souvlaki combo...Mmmm Mmmmm! i also shared some greek fries with my friend. nice portions. it definitely fulfilled our craving for greek food. =)

The Big Fat Gyro is ridiculously big and fat....their Greek salads are fresh and delicious...add steak, chicken, or gyro meat for a reasonable price...hummus is smooth and silky...my only complaint is that street access to the place totally sucks and the parking is very limited. Otherwise, great!
Best gyros in Vegas. Family owned atmosphere. Great service. Excellent ambiance. Fresh ingredients. What more can I say about this place it's the best
Delicious food! Their avgolemono soup is amazing. All I want is a piece of Galaktoboureko and I would be one happy girl!

Hands down the BEST dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves) in Las Vegas. And I've tried them in every Greek restaurant I've been to. Their Avgolemono soup is delicious as well.   The service is great too. Everyone is friendly and they even remembered me after coming in only once. And they were crowded that day.   So between the service and food quality, I think I've found my go-to Greek restaurant when I'm in Vegas.

OMG!!! there gyros are filled with so much meat and other stuff. i went two time in two days, i couldn't get enough of the taste. Their Big Fat Gyro is so good and pita bread is real tender. this place is so busy all the time and. staff is super fast and friendly, Absolutely great place to try!! feel the real Mediterranean taste!!

OMG! Possibly the best Gyros sandwich I have ever had! I am always looking for a delicious, traditional Gyros sandwich. This one delivered! It was extra messy and I loved it! The Greek fries were good, but not great. I have had better, but I would/will come back again!
This place is great.  Whatever I order,  it's always delicious and fresh.  I think the old guy with the grey frow is the owner and  he is still cooking.

great food, nice staff, clean place, pretty Greek décor, amazing gyros and reasonable too. love it! I'm not sure if the curly haired guy is the owner but he's very nice, always asking if we're doing ok or if the food is good. I believe I saw him catered at the recent Greek festival as well. overall, this is my main go to Greek restaurant.

I stopped here with my neighbor this afternoon for an early dinner.  I had the Chicken Souvlaki and she had the Gyro plate.  We each requested no rice and extra salad and they were very accommodating.  Their tzatziki was excellent.    My only complaint with any place like this is the plastic plates and dinnerware.  I know it's common in places like this, but it still is something I don't like.  I brought home a piece of baklava for dessert, and it was quite good.  I will be back.  I'll probably do takeout the next time.

Great quick place to stop for lunch. Since my friend lives in Vegas now, we actually get to try local spots and not just touristy central. She suggested a gyro place, and I was in. I opted to keep it simple and tried a gyro sandwich with everything. Overall, good amount of meat and flavor. The taziki sauce was what I'd expect, but it could have used some more. Luckily my husband got his on the side so I used some of his. We also got hummus as a side. Pita bread was warm and fresh. Service was friendly and nice, with staff greeting everyone as they walk in.

Family owned delicious food... I'm really obsessed with the athenian veggie plate right now, but the steak Souvlaki is absolutely out of this world too.  Everything's so fresh and filling... Its not cheap, but definitely worth the price especially for the amount of food you get.  Yum yum yummy.  oh and try their greek fries... SO good...  I crave this place.

I am not an expert in Greek food, but what I do know is that this place is delicious!   Boyfriend and I usually get the gyro plate, but we've tried a few different things and no matter what we get its always soooo good and very filling.    I especially like the fluffy bread and the rice they give you with the combos, helps tie all the flavors together. Portions are generous and everything we've tried always has great flavor.   Let's not forget how friendly the people are, especially the man with the glasses who we think is one of the owners. He's always upbeat and welcoming when we come in that I feel very comfortable being there.   I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants to try some delicious Greek food at a reasonable price! :)

Good portions, good price, for good food.  I go to lunch here a few times a year as it is closer to the office than Paymon's.  If I am looking for speedy greek food, this is the place to go.  Stick with Gyros salad or Gyros and fries and you cannot go wrong.

Got a lemon herb gyro it was bursting with juices herbs veggies and just plain great we also got a gyro plate with a very flavorful dressing for the salad rice really complemented the gyro meat the tzaziki sauce was very good only complaint is a very small piece of pita needed more

I love my Greek food!  Yassou doesn't dissapoint.  After trying multiple dishes at this location I have settled on the Souvlaki Combo, delish.  You get your chicken and steak kabob's, salad, rice, pita/hummus.    I usually come in an hour or two before closing and the food is still up kept.  My Souvlaki Combo never dissapoints, either protein is always cooked perfectly.  One time they were out of rice and offered Greek fries as a substitute.  It was not bad at all but I like the rice better. The dining area is usually kept clean but there's not a lot of seats inside.    There was nothing unusual about the place or food except for maybe the restrooms.  They're not gender specific so pick and choose one without feeling weird about walking into the wrong bathroom.  Deserts:  Baklavah, really good.  I had to stop eating it because I didn't want to have a heart attack afterwards during work!

I don't often eat Greek food even though I really do like it.  Glad the stepdaughter introduced us to Yassou!  Good Greek food right off of Charleston near Summerlin.  Lots of folks visit, can tell you're in the affluent part of town because of all the cars parked outside!  Our lowly Acura was parked between a new BMW and a Mercedes coupe.  Dang did that make me feel poor.  Oh well, suck it rich people I can eat at Yassou too!  Upon entering the restaurant, it definitely reminds you of the diner from that movie "My Fat Greek Wedding".  White & blue dually represented!  Nice little family run place.  Wasn't particularly busy in the place that day, noticed that lots of folks were doing take-out, or picking up large catering trays for glitzy parties.    Menu is displayed prominently on huge boards right above the service counter.  Kinda hard to miss!  Menu was varied, went from traditional Greek fare to items of a more modern palette.
