We of course, stuck with what the Greeks know.  And what they know is pretty darn tasty.  Throw the spanakopita, dolmades, and hummus aside...show me the meat!  Although I'm sure those items on the menu are probably pretty good, I was here for some carnivorous action.  The wifey and I went for the Souvlaki Combo - one beef and one chicken skewer marinated in the house lemon herbs & spices.  Our plates came with a Greek salad, rice pilaf, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce.  Overall the plate was good.  The skewers were a nice serving, and you could definitely taste the lemon and herbs throughout.  My beef skewer was juicy, but the chicken skewer was a little dry probably because it was breast meat (which tends to dry out).  The Greek salad was good with feta, tomato, cucumber, olives, and lots of red onion (which the wifey didn't really like), topped with their house vinaigrette.  Tasty.  Pita bread and the tzatziki sauce was good too, pita being warm and soft, with the tzatziki being a good complement for dipping things in to.  I wasn't a fan of the rice pilaf though, it didn't do much for me.  It's probably because I'm more of a sticky rice kinda guy.  Overall a decent plate.  What I really should have ordered was what our kids ordered.  I almost wanted to switch halfway though our meal!  They got the popular My Big Fat Gyro - gyro sandwich with flame broiled sliced beef & lamb, feta cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.  Along with a large order of Greek fries - fries with herbs & spices, and feta cheese.  This stuff was delish!  The thin sliced beef with the lamb, all combined into that gyro made a wonderful dish.  Was hard to put down after a few bites!  I will definitely have this instead the next time I visit Yassou.    Prices were kinda on the high side for me (I'm a cheapie eater) but I guess if you want quality food you gotta pay for it.  Our plates were about $9 each, and the gyros were a tad over $7.  Fries were separate, and cost us another $3 or so.  Servings were generous though.  On the plus side, they serve Coca-Cola!  Figure it would have been Pepsi since of the blue motif and all.  The restaurant has two different seating sections, one is in the restaurant, but there is another area on the outside in more of a patio setting.  Nice if the weather is good outside, or if you have a large party of folks with you.  I'll be back.  OPA!

I Yelped this place before I took off for my trip to Las Vegas and I was determined to get here, even though I was dead tired from the drive and it was a little ways from my hotel. I ventured out and I`m really glad I did. This place is really good and hit the spot. I was looking for something quick yet fresh and healthy. I came to this little spot and was not disappointed.   The front counter person greeted me when I came through the door and took my order right away. I knew exactly what I wanted because I had been stalking their menu for several days online. I opted for their Greek salad with herb lemon chicken and a side of fries. Regular, please. I said "regular" and the guy corrected me and said "American". Potato. Poe-ta-toe. I didn`t want Greek fries that day, I`m sorry. Next time for sure.   I did have to wait a little while for my order(I ordered to go) but I didn`t mind. They were busy and I like places that are busy because it usually means that it is good. The salad to go container was filled to the brim with goodness. The salad was really amazing and they gave me TWO dressings(Thank you for not being cheap!). I thought it was really tasty and I wish I had one right now because I`m hungry. I want to go back and check out the rest of their offerings when I`m in town.  Go here. Go Greek. Good stuff.
Ordered through door dash.  Delish! I love Greek food and I had been craving the lemon chicken soup for so so long. Wasn't disappointed.  Also grabbed some Greek fries and rice pilaf.  Yummmm

The 2 stars, "Meh.I've experience better" cannot be more appropriate. I order the 2 vegetarian meal and pick around what had no dairy. The rice was very blend with no flavor and the hummus was very liquid.This not was I was expecting since the reviews were pretty good in general. The service was good and the person at the cash register were very smiley. Unfortunately I cross it from my list and I will not be back.

A bit expensive.  Service is slower than average, but the food is really good.  Gyro patter is good.  I especially like the rice.  The salad is also very good.  Domadas are very tasty - especially with the lemon dipping sauce.  The place is quite large, and seems clean and airy.
Delicious, drool inducing Greek yumminess. Decent prices and really freaking good food! Nicely air conditioned, pleasing aesthetics. I suggest the combination Souvlaki plate.

What a waste of 40 minutes. . My husband asked where our order was and they said it was coming out next. 15 minutes later, still no food. Gave our order to some other table. Asked for our money back then left. Can't say if the food was good since we never got to try any. Will NOT be going back - even for take out. This is my first negative comment about a restaurant on yelp. I always like to write about great service and food only but I'm fairly pissed that no one there really cared. Need more employees to handle the crowds.

Money.  For $7.95, I had a beautiful plate of Greek goodies.  Chicken Souvlaki lunch special gets you a fresh greek salad (the Kalmata olives are not pitted.  Don't crack a tooth!), 3 or 4 pieces of hot pita bread, a skewer of chicken and onion pieces which are really well seasoned, and some of the best rice pilaf I have had in a while.  A fountain drink adds $2 to the total, but for $10, I left very satisfied.  Lest I forget, there is a quiet little patio if you go through the restaurant.  Service was passeable, if not overly friendly.  Interior was clean and lots of lunch regulars.  Can't wait to go back when I am off the wagon and try the Greek fries!

Tried it for the first time and was quite pleased with the service and food quality. We tried the Greek salad, humus, and two gyro specials.   All the dishes were tasty, showed some pride in presentation, and exhibited a nice mild blend of Greek flavors.   The food tastes clean and fresh.  The meat was evenly cooked and lightly seasoned.    Overall this is great place for a healthy, filling lunch.

AMAZING! I'm from Chicago and its been hard to find a good gyro out in Vegas. Everything on the menu is delicious! Their hummus, gyro, saganaki, all the best! But besides the food the owners are super friendly and nice. We were referred by Pete and while we were there all we saw was him interacting with customers, cooking, helping everyone out, and working hard! For me personally besides the food, good customer service is very important to me. I love small businesses and I prefer going to a family owned place over a chain restaurant. My mom works at a local Walgreen's and had Pete as a customer who told her about his store and that's how we ended up learning about it. While my mom lives in Summerlin i live in Seven Hills and I can honestly say I will make the drive to get take out/dine in again. Its businesses like this that will make it very far :)

Absolutely delicious!! I have worked in the same plaza as Yassou for a good 2 years and STILL manage to crave Peters cooking daily. It doesn't matter what I'm ordering it is never anything short of amazing. Everyone who works here always makes sure I am well fed and taken care of. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a delicious lunch or dinner!
This is Greek food!  Excellent food, fast service, friendly staff. Prices are good for what you get

Came to try this place for the first time.  The food was really but really good !!!  The chicken was cooked soooo good, not dry but well done.  This place is my new favorite  and I do recommend it to anyone

I tried this place for the first time yesterday. I ordered the Souvlaki Combo (beef and chicken skewers with greek salad, rice pilaf and pita bread). The beef and chicken skewers were seasoned well. The beef could have been more tender. The pita bread was my favorite. Very fresh and soft. The thing that ruined it for me was the rice pilaf. This is the first time I have ever been served yellow rice with a greek dish. I would eat here again, but would pass on the rice. Maybe try a gyro instead.

My wife heard about his place from a friend. Being part Greek I have yet to find a great place serving authentic taste! Until now! This place was great! Food was perfect and atmosphere was quaint and family friendly. Felt at home and very relaxed. Could tell from the moment I walked in food would be perfect as Owner was at front counter greeting you as you walk in and working his restaurant. A lot of love, pride, and hard work goes into this place.  Great food, great place! Will be back soon!  OPA!!!

I've been here twice and I'm so sad I don't eat here more often ... the food is amazing, you have to try their banana passion fruit smoothie its amazing ( I believe thats what I had lol). I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.
Love this place. Come here all the time from across town. Good vegetarian options for me, fresh food and big portions. Family-run restaurant so that's a plus too!

How can I express my love for Yassou's?!?!   I love everything I have ever tried there and the staff always makes you feel welcome when you come in.  It almost feels like you are walking into a street cafe in Athens.  OPA!   I have tried a lot of things on the menu and everything is always great.  The meals are all big and will definitely fill you to the brim.  The appetizers are a decent size and easy to share.  The hummus here is really, REALLY good too!  Always a good sign for a Greek joint.    And the gyros....Oh the gyros!  I think they have the best Gyros in town hands down. In fact I often dream about the Big Fat Gyro and always wake up happy just thinking about. If you haven't been yet, go RIGHT NOW and get one, maybe two!  The meat is tender and packed with flavor!  The pita is so soft and fluffy. And the tzatziki sauce is amazing!  Yum, yum, yummy!  So the moral of the story is if you want some great Greek food, get to Yassou's now!

This is probably the best Greek food my wife and I have experienced in a while. It was all home made and tasted excellent.   Recommend to anyone who wants to experience home cooked Greek food. Not only is it Greek it is Great.

IMO this is one of the very best Greeks I have ever been to, and I've been to plenty in England and here in Vegas.  Here's what I think makes it stand out:  1) It's a family run business with the owner always on hand to make sure the quality stays perfect and consistent.  Everybody we have dealt with there has been super friendly and makes us feel at home.  2) I know, it's really all about the food.  Well everything we've had here has been great:    Everything is made to order, so when you get the chicken or steak kabob, it's not been sitting around then zapped in the microwave like some places I've been to, instead it's cooked perfectly on the grill, the chicken moist and tasty (I recommend you squeeze a bit of extra lemon on it for a final taste burst), the steak unbelievably tender and cooked about medium rare for a fantastic juicy chunk of meat you'd be happy to find in your best steak house.  The donner kebab is nicely browned on the outside and very tasty; I've been to far too many places where they don't make the effort to brown it before slicing it off, it makes a huge difference to the taste when it's done right.  The rice is super moist and flavorful, I imagine they are cooking it in some sort of broth.  The side salad on the plate has a nice amount of dressing and a good variety of feta, olives (but only a couple), cucumber and onion to go with the lettuce.  The pitas are not home made (there are hundreds of them on display in packages) but they are very yummy, more doughy than the usual thin ones.  If I had one recommendation I'd like the option to have them warmed on the grill.  I think the prices are extremely reasonable considering the large portion size.  Friendly family run business, reasonable prices, great food.  We can't wait to go back.

This place is clean and bright, nicely decorated and seemingly well managed. I went here for lunch with a bunch of other ladies for a meetup group last Sunday. Whoever got there first was to find seating for all of us to sit together. There were 14 of us. My friend and I were the first to arrive, so took a look around and saw that there are three options for seating. Most people sit inside which is the same place as where you order (at the counter). But they also have an outdoor patio and a separate dining room enclosed in glass which was not open. So I asked if we could all sit in that room and they said sure and opened it up for us.  We were able to get about 4 tables put together where we all sat in a row on each side of the tables and on the ends. They brought everyone's order out to us in a reasonably consistent time. We didn't wait too long for the food either. No one had any problems with their order as far as I could tell and we had a great time with great food. Lots of the ladies were saying the food was very good.  Personally, I ordered the Super Lemon Chicken Pita. It is the larger of the two Lemon Chicken Pitas but not much more money that the smaller one. It was delicious. I forgot to tell them no onions, so I picked off the slices of red onion. I was glad they were not chopped fine!  When we left, they were loading up a van for a big delivery of food. I was impressed that they handled all of us unexpectedly at the same time they were preparing a catering job. And just as they did with us, they brought the food out to the van quickly with several people carrying things out.   I would not hesitate to return here or recommend it to anyone. Great place and I will be returning!
Huge gyro... really good feta and cucumber sauce...but when I see packaged store bought pita... instead of homemade? It is really a turn off especially for the price you pay.

Yassou's is one of my favorite Greek places in town. The gyro meat is the absolute best. I drive across town just to get the Greek pasta. Only other place I had the pasta was when I was in Greece. The staff is incredibly friendly. It's a great atmosphere and most importantly great food. You can't go wrong with coming here.

This family owned cafe is so laid back yet serves amazing food! I love coming here even though I live all the way from the South! The owner is so friendly, the food is so great & the portions are perfect! Salad is phenomenal! I have been coming here for 3 years!

This family run restaurant is great! It was our first time so we asked for help and we received great suggestions. Food was fresh, fast and full or flavor. Lunch rush gets a little crazy but there is plenty of seating outside.

Three words....Chicken Lunch Special =) Yum! My daughter & I have been here several times, and even though we say we're going to try something new, we always end up ordering the chicken lunch special.  It just taste so good! =) Food is fresh and the staff is friendly.

This place was very great. It really added to our Vegas experience. There was a very authentic feel here. The music, the food, the decor, and so on. The use of space was very much appreciated. Totes yummy.

I used to frown when friends would suggest eating greek food.  Till now.. Thanks to Yassou I enjoy greek food. The Lunch Special is a bargain!  Try it! The works and the owner are nice and don't seem to mind being asked question about their food.

My favorite affordable Greek food in Vegas, so satisfying I've never looked to venture past Yassou. We always order the "My Big Fat Gyro" or the Gyro Plate. So much meat! I'd recommend one of these your first visit because I believe you can soundly judge a Greek joint by its gyro.   The plate is fun, but the gyro wrap is hands down the best beast you'll wrangle during your work week. They are massive. And I can't believe I'm saying this since I know it's an abomination, but sometimes I find myself picking out slices of meat there's just so much. Seriously, I have to prepare before ingestion, like putting down newspaper or eating outside near the hose. My husband can go to town on it without much of a mess, but he has man hands and a man mouth.   The traditional gyro meat is a shavers gift--how gyros or shawarma should come off (if you ask a foreigner like me), consistent like meatloaf. I'm always prepared to get one bad piece, just one. Maybe a piece of fat or ligament, but nope, hasn't happened yet.   We call ahead and do takeout most of the time, and probably won't change the routine up anytime soon. Can't beat these prices. Cheap greek!
Absolutely one of my favorite places to eat! Food is so good and the people are super friendly. Even my kids love it!

I had just finished my final and was hungry for something other than the burgers and tacos that plague Las Vegas Strip malls.   A quick look on Yelp showed me a highly rated Greek gyros about 10 minutes away. Hell yeah!  I arrive but realize the private parking is on the other side of the building. I parked by McDonald's but it was a 30 second walk to the restaurant.   I was immediately greeted by a friendly staff member who explained what the Greek Fries were and the combos and stuff. The Greek Fries are worth the extra dollar and change. I finished the fries before even touching the gyro. The whole meal was about $12 for a really good gyro (not too soggy, plenty of lamb or whatever meat, fresh lettuce, and onions mmmm), the awesome Greek Fries, and a fountain drink.  The atmosphere is great too. I enjoyed the Greek music and look/cleanliness of the establishment. There's an area outside and a closed off area.  I didn't see the bathrooms but I bet they're clean too.   Overall, really great experience. Excellent staff, good food, and decent prices ($7.89 I think for just the gyro).  I'd definitely come a lot more if I didn't live on the other side of town!
Great friendly service where food is phenomenal and prices that cannot be beat.  Quality authentic food that has me coming back on a regular basis.

First of all, i go to Yassou ALL THE TIME. The reviewers here that say this place is bad either A- Dont know good food or B- Have their own Greek place and want more business. The Big Fat Gyro @ Yassou is not only the best in L.V, it is the best PERIOD. If you want Greek fine dining go to OPA, but if you want a cozy lunch Greek grill, it gets no better than Yassou.
I love this place! It has the best chicken, Greek salad and rice I've ever had....My mouth waters just thinking about it

Best gyro in Las Vegas.  The meat has so much flavor and is so soft and crispy.  The pita was also soft and the tzatziki is very good. Fresh vegetables on it also.  Very very good.   My wife also ordered a salad, which she liked.  I ordered spanakopita.  I wish the phyllo was a little more brown. It was very pale and didn't have that great of a crunch.  The spinach and feta mixture inside was good.  Not great, but good.   I will be back when I get a craving for a gyro.

if you want experience a family run Greek restaurant this is the place to go. it is by Summerlin area, ample parking and very friendly staff. the food is fresh, delicious and good  portions.  restaurant is clean and gives you the Greek vibe with all white interior with lots of Greek photos and accent pieces. The prices ranges from about eight dollars to about $12 which slut bag. check out this place with your family.

Very good Greek food.  Plastic plates and utensils do little to decrease the pleasure of their friendly service, well prepared food and very reasonable prices.   A must if you're in the area - but also worth a drive.   Go.

This place is soooo freaking goood!!!! I always get the chicken place, with rice, salad and pita bread. Can't go wrong with it, always very filling leaving leftovers for later. Just not a big fan of their beef. Call and pick it up because most of the time is busy.

We have been to Yassou a few times now and we love it. The owner is super nice and very helpful describing the different kinds of food if you're not familiar.  The food itself is amazing. Full of flavor and served in a timely fashion. This place has not disappointed at all. We are making this one of our regular haunts.

Came in here today for the first time and WOW!! I don't know too much about Greek food and the boy Jackson and the counter was extremely helpful and guided me through the menu and gave me his personal recommendations of what to try. When my food came out I was very impressed with how great everything tasted. I will definitely be coming back for more!
Tasty Greek food. Not the best but I could def eat 2+ days in a row!

Ate at yassou today for the first time with a couple of friends of mine that raved about it.  I'm hooked now!!!   I had the Souvlaki combo and it was delicious!!!!!   The rice pilaf was fantastic, and the hummus and tsatiki was phenomenal!  My friend had the Veggie plate, and I think I might have to get that next time.   The Rice Pudding for dessert was EXCELLENT!!!!!!

We were out running errands on a Saturday and had watched "Mama Mia" the night before, so were in the mood for some good Greek food! We did a search on Yelp, read the reviews and found Yassou! I was interested in the Souvlaki Plate and the guy taking our order pointed out a special that was less expensive and was a smaller lunch portion - which was exactly what I was looking for! The platter contained a skewer sampler of chicken, steak and pork and I asked for double greek salad instead of rice. All the meat was cooked nicely and seasoned well. The salad was fresh, the pita was fluffy and tzatziki was delicious. Hubby got the Big Fat Gyro and said that it was tasty and satisfying. We were too full for the Baklava but saw it and will have to give it a try next time! I highly recommend this if you are in the neighborhood and need a satisfying Greek lunch or snack!

Some of the best Greek food in the city, but the hours are a disappointment. Who closes at 8 p.m. in Las Vegas? Do they not want to make money? If you do catch them open, try the lemon-herb chicken pita or any salad here. Delicious. The restaurant itself is charming and Mediterranean, in a family-style way. A bit cluttered and campy with mass-produced copies of old Aegean art and the de rigueur travel posters, but the staff is warm, welcoming and willing to accommodate any special request.  The only disappointing item on the menu is the baklava. It's among the worst I've had anywhere - shocking, considering these folks know, and produce, great Greek food. They should change the baklava immediately. It's a gaping hole in an otherwise very solid bill of fare. Don't miss this place.

Still keep returning for their flavorful and stuffed gyro pitas. The tuna one is becoming another fave. You can see the owner cooking in the back. Clean kitchen. In and outdoor seating.  Go to cashier, order and pay for your food, self help your drink (they have fresh brewed iced tea) then wait at your table with your order number for your food arrival.  Easy parking. Dependable.
Very good! The products are fresh and tasty! The big fat gyros is sooo good! Try the baklawa! It's amazing!

Easy to miss from the street. Cannot enter if west bound on Charleston. Not enough parking and small spaces. When it was my turn in line the cashier took order from people behind me. The guy and his pregnant wife ordered ignoring that I was in line ahead of them.  Perhaps I should have made a scene, instead I went back to the end of the line. I waited while five other people who were behind me ordered before me.  I ordered Gyros plate to go. Was $10.15 (included tax). Soda was $2! Are you kidding me? Hello, you are not on the strip. Food was mediocre. Nowhere near as good as Shish Kabob Cafe. I realize one is Greek and other is Armenian, but items on menu are similar. For dine in, Yassou serves food on disposable plates. Cheesy. I would describe as overpriced fast food.  I was not impressed and will probably not go back.

I wrote this review on Google but felt a need to stress how I feel on Yelp as well so here is my review:  Oh man!!! Words cant begin to express how excited I am to have found such an incredible greek restaurant. I just spent tons of time in Greece and didn't think I'd ever be able to recreate the experience of eating the most delicious, homemade, WARM dolmades. At first I ordered the lemon chicken salad which was to die for but then I figured I'd try an order of the dolmades. Best decision I've ever made! The food came out quick, was reasonably priced and truly outstanding. Jack was helpful, nice and answered lots of my questions. He was fantastic, polite and patient with me. What a great experience- can't wait to come here as much as possible and become a regular :) thank you for such a lovely and authentic meal.
Best tasting Greek Gyro in this part of town. Kabob was made with real tenderloin steak. Definitely puts Halal Guys to shame. You cannot compare the two! Highly recommended if you come for the food .

I eat here almost 4 times a week! What's my order? "Gyro-Chicken salad, meat well-done  to go!" This is the best way to order, I know because I'm the "DUKE"  Chicken well done am I insane? No! Trust me when you order the chicken well done, it ends up being crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside because of the marinated lemon juice.  As for the Gyro being well done, that should be mandatory at all gyro places due to the questionable meat, but I make it a point to do so. Plus, i like my gyro meat that way because it ends up tasting like bacon.  "To go" because of the Panda Express rule. Your just get more and  It is served in a nice container with dressing on the side. If you order to eat there, it's served on a plate and the dressing is way too wet for the salad.     So the whole order is sort of like a chopped chicken salad with feta instead. I forgot about the small bits of fried pita that taste like heaven!

Indoor/outdoor seating. Authentic Greek food with an authentic Greek vibe. Probably the best Greek salad with lemon herb steak I've ever had. Hummus and grape leaves are a 10/10. Great service as well, everyone has a sense of urgency and very friendly. I'll definitely be back!!
This little gem has been one of my favorites for years now. Wonderful service and even better food.
This place rocks! I think it is the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been to Greek places in several States and this place still is the best and the price is good too.

LEGIT!  I'm so happy to have found a go-to Greek restaurant here in Las Vegas. I like that it's casual and quick but you can opt to sit, take your time, and enjoy yourself if you'd like.   I called my order in for pick up and it was ready it about 10 minutes. For $26 I got the Big Fat Gyro with a side of salad/rice, the Gyro/Chicken Souvlaki combo, a side of Spanakopita, and a drink.   It was delicious and filling with enough to eat for lunch the next day. The chicken skewers is a definite recommendation as the chicken breast is so juicy, flavorful, and tender. The spanakopita side came with 2 large pieces which was very delicious.   They have a cafe to the side which I plan on trying sometime soon. I'll definitely be coming here often.

We did end up returning to this place and, while the service and atmosphere did not change at all, we thought the food was very mediocre. This would include our rice, fries, grape leaves, and chicken. We have had better food elsewhere, which is really disappointing because we had high hopes for this place and were willing to drive across town to eat here. After a meal this time, we both looked at each other and asked what we thought? Independently, neither one of us wanted to return.

Why in the world did it take me 2 years to stop and eat there?!!!!  *smacking head*   AWESOME food and best gyros EVER!  The meat is mouth-wateringly delicious and tender and the pita is always very fresh.  We also love their baklava, saganaki (flaming cheese), Greek salads, and humus!  All spectacular!  All their staff is very friendly and always customer oriented.  Not once have I had a problem that wasn't addressed quickly and made right, all with a smile and an apology.  Definitely not the norm in this town!!  The only downside I see to this restaurant is that it's so popular that they need more room!!!  :)

Stopped back for another amazing lunch. After spending a couple hours waiting in a govmnt office and hungry when I left , I decided to stop at Yassou. I always receive a wonderful greeting from the gentleman with the glasses, he is so kind. I ordered the lemon chicken pita combo plate and was not disappointed at all. The salad was cold and fresh and the chicken was cooked to perfection without being dry. This restaurant is always clean or they are cleaning while I'm there. They take pride in keeping it, organized and clean. I like that in an eating establishment. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to my next lunch with you all. Thank you

Order, take a number, and when ready they deliver to your unclean table. They have a clean charming window light room, BUT it's locked so you have to wait for a dirty table to open up. Food is tasty though, and complete with a thimble size serving of hummus.

The white guy behind the counter in front that packages up your food for take out is NASTY. he needs to stop touching his face, wiping his sweat, digging in his ears and touching his nose and mouth repeatedly w out washing. Just left the place and couldn't write this faster. I'm grossed out at his unsanitary methods. Great food, just a nasty ,dirty, sweaty, greasy guy giving it to you. Bon appetite!

My husband and I first discovered this Yassou through the entertainment guide. I started my order with the Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) for $5.99. They serve them with a thick lemony sauce on top. It is different from how my mom makes it but it still tastes pretty good. I chose the Steak Souvlaki plate as my main entree ($10.99). The steak kabobs were excellent ! They are marinated in lemon and herbs. It is served with rice and a fresh salad. The rice has a lemony flavor to it. I liked this place so much I took my brother here because he always craves this type of cuisine. He also loves the food here !

This is my first time yelping, but dear holy essence, this place is good.  I saw great reviews on Yelp and had to judge it.  I've had a lot of Greek food growing up and these people deliver.  Very fresh and tasty.  Fast, friendly, and perhaps cheesily but fittingly stylish.  Very impressed.  The standard lamb gyro platter was exceptional.

We've always enjoy the food here at the Yassou Greek Grill Cafe.  Got the Deluxe gyros & lemon herb chicken... also the Big fat gyro... Salad was very fresh & so was the meat... very tasty... Big servings, enough for 2! I have no room for the Baklava till later.... also they gave me a big portion of my favorite fries by following them in Instagram! :) this is the place you must go

Hubs took me here for lunch with our little one.  I'm not all that familiar with Greek food, but after this, I can say I'm a fan.  I have eaten at another Greek place on the other side of town and that was good, this place it's even a wee bit better.    Since I had eaten prior to our lunch date, I told my husband that I would just share with him.  We shared a Gyro plate and baklava.  This plate was full enough for the both of us.  Lots of lamb and beef.  It comes with pita, rice, and greens.  The beef skewers had four large cube pieces and it was not over cooked, it was cooked medium well, just the way I like it.  Service was fabulous and as a matter of fact it was one the workers b-day, I think it was Mary.  Anyhow, if on this dude of town, this place has some really good, healthy grinds!
The meat on both of our plates were raw. Bright red in the middle. Customer service was rushed and wanted us out because they wanted to close. Not a good experience and we will not be going back.

I ordered the Fat Big Greek gyro with a Greek salad for lunch. I had high expectations for this place because of the reviews and crowded restaurant. Unfortunately they were not met. They used white onions rather then purple on the gyro, wasn't too fond of that. The meat had no flavor and they provided very little tzatziki sauce.

The Greek salad was amazingly FRESH and DELICIOUS!!! Loved the feta cheese! And the hummus and pita bread is to die for!!! The guy who took my order, who I believe is the owner; was so nice and polite! Thank you for an AWESOME experience! Will definitely be back!

The first thing you notice when you walk in is how clean everything is, as well as how good the food smells. We ordered gyros and the Greek fries. The food was great, everything tasted like it was made with fresh, quality ingredients. Service was above and beyond as well. So good. We will be back!

Best Greek Food in Las Vegas!!! Seriously the best ever! Whenever I get the cravings for Greek food or if anyone I'm with asks where to find good Greek food I always bring them here.   So if you've never been to Yassou and want recommendations on what to get I'll give you a few of my personal favorites.   As far as sides go, I always get either the Greek fries which are perfectly seasoned with big chunks of feta though out or my favorite the spanakopita which is perfectly flaky with the spinach always hot and the feta blended into it and melted all the way through. If you want to stay traditional then they have great hummus and soft pita as well.   On to the main course, I always get the super lemon herb steak pita which is amazingly tantalizing. The pita is always fresh and warm with tender with juicy bits of perfectly marinated steak and chunks of ripe tomatoes and slices of onions and lettuce and feta. It comes with a slice of lemon. Sooooo good! Also the Chicken Souvlaki is pretty good too. But the pitas are always bomb!   For dessert I always get the baklava. Theirs is the best! Fresh honey dripping off every bite.   Like I said if you want the best Greek food than try Yassou. I think it's as good as it is because it's family owned and you can tell they really care about giving their customers the best food and service they can.

I wasn't even aware Gyros could get that big. Typically, I'm able to finish my lunches without getting a to-go box, but at Yassou is where I met my match. I guess now I have a snack for later. Vegas doesn't have a large choice of Greek establishments but if I were to choose one it would be Yassou. The Big Fat Gyro is pretty much all you need. I will definitely go back to try more items on the menu.
Favorite Greek spot!  Their pita bread are delicious !  Souvlaki combo is my favorite!

The best greek gyros I had. I'm from Europe where greek restaurants are everywhere and popular so I know what I'm talking about!! Go for the big fat gyros with extra feta and a tender and exquisite piece of baklava!   You welcome!!

Expected so much more with the great reviews. Over 20 min wait on the food and the chicken souvlaki was extremely salty and seemed to be covered with a lot of vegetable oil. Greek salad was okay but not worth the price.

Favorite Greek spot in LV!!!   We always take our guests here and make frequent stops for our fix!! We always sit outside and love how they checked on us.  Order the Souvlaki plate or anything Steak!! Their meat never disappoints!!   Amazing food, service, people, and yup... Again... FOOD!!   Thanks Peter and Christian!!!  PS I want to touch your hair!!

Yassou is our favorite place for Greek food! Here they make everything fresh as you order.  You must try their grilled meat plates  - served with salad, Greek rice, pita.  Their lemon soup is excellent!  Their calamari is yummy!  Ask for Christian or Mr Papas!  They treat their customers like family!! We eat here at least once a week.  Price is also very affordable.
Yassou has the best Greek food in town especially the Greek salad and the big fat gyro.

luv walking in this place. i always feel welcomed. i have gone to them since they opened. christian always makes you feel like family and we luv that pops is always on the line cooking. customer service is always at its best and it doesnt matter what you order because its gonna taste like it was made with luv and you're gonna fall in luv.

Best Greek food that I've had in town. I've been coming here for over ten years and I love it. The same family has been operating this restaurant for years and you can tell they pay attention to detail. My favorites include the hummus plate with the Gyro plate.

Yassou!!! We are very pleased with our choice to try this restaurant that we found on Yelp. We loved the gyro pizzzzzzzza, and the pasticio and dolmadas were just like our YiaYia makes. We had good, friendly service and a great lunch. The prices are very reasonable for the quality and amount of food. Only $50.00 for four adults and one kid with drinks. Plenty of food. We are from out of town, but will come back next time we are in Vegas.

Love eating here. I have been coming here for years now and they have never disappointed me. I don't think there is anything on the menu I haven't tried. Gyros, salads, pasta and pizza. Everything served here is fresh and awesome. Great customer service and great greek food. What more can you ask for?

I felt bad about the stars on my last review. The gyro was good. But the service and experience needs a little work.  Maybe I came at a bad time on a bad day. I still think the prices are a little high compared to my regular place. I might try them again.

I ordered the Veggie Spreads Plate and a side of Hummus... at the end of the meal I was left feeling "meh".    I glanced over the menu and picked from one of the two vegetarian options. I picked what I thought would have been the healthier of the two, Veggie Spreads Plate.   The Plate consisted of rice pilaf, greek salad, pita bread, two small stuffed grape leaves (I think it was grape leaves), and containers of spread.   Rice pilaf and pita bread dominated the plate, making it a hefty serving of carbs. In my opinion the rice pilaf was bland, lacking flavor. The greek salad was a ordinary salad, though the dressing was also bland. Keeping it consistent, the hummus was bland as well.   Like I mentioned in the beginning, I was left feeling "meh". I have definitely had better. Perhaps the positive reviews from my fellow Yelpers are as the result of meat plates?   As a vegetarian, this place definitely did not do it for me.
This is my favorite place for Greek food. The food is amazing!  Always fresh and delicious!  The staff are friendly and welcoming.  I would highly recommend eating at Yassou!!

The owner is awesome he is usually in the kitchen cooking and they get there gyros from Chicago.  They buy the most expensive cone (of Gyros Meat) and you can tell with taste.  If it is your first time go with the my big fat greek gyro and make it a combo with Greek fries.  It's the best gyros in Vegas hands down.  Other items on menu are good but take a little bit longer to cook.  They just upgraded by getting another gyros cone cooker to help with the increase of customers.  The word has gotten out this place is a hidden gem in Vegas.  If you are staying on the strip its worth grabbing it and taking it back to your room or suite like my friends did.   Enjoy!

A fantastic mom & pop Greek joint. The ambiance is mellow and casual w/ a walk up counter and comfortable seating. The food came out quickly and was really fresh. I had the Gyro and my wife had the Souvlaki & Chicken skewer plate. We also had the Feta Fries. The meat was fantastic, the salad/veggies fresh and crisp, and the seasonings on everything spot on. Cheap, quick and tasty. Fantastic.

Las Vegas has a lot of great Greek options hut Yassou just happens to be my favorite. I have regularly eaten here for 8 years and they have never let me down. I especially love the Big Fat Gyro with Greek fries and the Mini Souvlaki specials; both offer generous portions of fresh ingredients at ridiculously reasonable prices. The food is cooked fresh and lunch lines are long, so don't get frustrated when the food takes a few minutes to come out. Well worth the wait!

My wife and I luckily stumbled across this while visisting my Dad. All I can say is that it was the best greek meal either of us have had. The chicken was fantastic and the gyros as well. I recommend the beef and chicken kabob. Get the baklava as it is baked fresh (as is all their food) and is made from scratch on site. The owner was very friendly and accomodating.We went back the next day we liked it so mush.  My Dad loved the lemon chicken soup and like everything elseit is made from scratch. I don't know why they do not have a cafe n the strip. All thumbs up from both of us.

This place was great. Wait was a little long for lunch but that's because the line was out the door during lunch and my friend ordered the salmon plate. I got the gyro and feta fries. It's nice to have another good place for Greek food.

When I am craving Greek food, this is the place I come to. The Big Fat Gyro is the best Gyro I have had in town, not lacking in anything. Have you ever had a Gyro and thought that if it only had more of something then it would be better? Not the case here, the name explains it all. Its big, its fat, and it is yummy.   There are also a lot of other sandwiches stuffed and sides. My favorite side from here is the Dolmades. There were canned Dolmades on a shelf and I'm not sure if that's what they are serving but it definitely tastes better than any of the other places.  It's not the cheapest Mediterranean food joint but it the food justifies the prices IMO. So far I haven't had anything better along the lines of Mediterranean fast food so this is my top pick for now.

Yassou is a place I have visited many times over the past several years. I can always count on them having delicious gyros and fries. I love the My Big Fat Gyro and I order it without onions. My friend ordered his without tomatoes. I know, who doesn't like tomatoes? Haha.  I was a little disappointed the last time I was in there since they got both of our orders wrong. Not a huge deal, but definitely disappointing. I also asked for ketchup and they forgot it. It's the little things that make or break the experience at a restaurant. If they had been busy, I would understand. They weren't busy.   If I was reviewing the quality of the food alone, I would give them 4 stars. Due to the not so great service, I felt I had to deduct one star. Makes me sad, but I'm sure I'll be back.

Yassou has the best Greek food in town and is family owned and operated, which is nice because everyone who walks in the door is treated like family as well. This is always my go-to when meeting friends for lunch. The food is always freshly prepared and affordable too.

Best Greek food in this part of town. Wife & I have been going here for at least ten years. The father (who cooks) and the son (who takes orders) are always so pleasent. Now to the food, always fresh,abundant, and tasty with reasonable prices. Get here before the noon rush as this place is popular.

so i tried this place twice just to make sure before my review. To me this place is just average. It wasn't great and it wasn't bad. i just think the rating of 4.5 stars is a bit of an over reach. either people don't know what above average is or they have no taste. the first time was the gyro platter second time was the big gyro sandwich. Both times the meat was dried out,was not moist or tender and was just an overall uninspiring meal. I also don't like being nickle and dimed for extra sauce is it really gonna break you guys? offer a proper size of sauce with each meal then customers wouldn't need to ask for it and be charged 50 cents extra. I guess i have been exposed to much better and therefore I am more critical. It seems that in las vegas anything approaching average is considered out of this world,I have seen this at many restaurants here.
Never disappointed here. Everything is great! Food is fresh, fast, and delicious. Perfectly cooked gyro meat. Wonderful iced tea. The staff is friendly and completely on top of things.

By far my most favorite spot ever ! Their gyros are amazing the best I've ever tasted in my life!  The prices are amazing too I can never get enough of the food here.  The workers here are nice and welcoming as well !  I recommend everyone to go taste the authentic Greek food the chicken, gyro , everything is recommended!   Thank you so much for the delicious food.
This is our go to simple easy yummy favorite. Family favorite. And we love the sweet awesome workers. So happy to go there all the time. Bomb town chicken

Omg! Soo good. I came here on recommendation from a friend. I will definitely come back. Go the gyro plate.  It comes freshly sliced gyro meat with buttery and lemony rice pilaf and a salad with feta cheese sprinkled on top. Around $10. The portion is large enough for two to share. Will come back for sure.
Pretty good prices on all of the traditional Greek stuff! And I've always had great experiences with people working there. And it's a great deal for the quality and portions!

I've been coming here since I moved to Vegas, over 10 yrs now. I've tried different items but my Favorite is their Greek Salad, Just Love It!!They always have tasty food and great service. Definitely recommend you try it!

My favorite for Greek food with a diner atmosphere and low overhead pricing.  Sometimes there is a wait as the food is made to order, but it's worth it.  Some items are prepared ahead of time and reheated to order (saw the moussaka taken from the fridge/freezer and reheated) but still made from scratch and delicious.

Was on my way to Red Rock Canyon when I stumbled across this spot. Don't be fooled by the modern, chain-looking exterior. This is about as authentic a Greek dining experience you'll find (and as someone who lives in NYC, that says a lot)..  I ordered the big fat gyro and rice/greek salad. With a fresh iced tea, the total was $11, a true bargain. Also of note, the staff (from the son at the register to the owner, exactly as you'd picture a Greek chef, working his magic in back, to the pleasant food runners) couldn't have been better.  The food: the gyro literally is big and fat, but the perfect combination of meat (beef & lamb), veggies, tzatziki and feta. It's not too big that you can't pick it up, but literally perfect. A top 5 gyro among the many I've eaten in life. The salad and rice was good, but nothing too special. The Greek fries I saw headed to other tables looked delicious, but you need to draw the line somewhere.  Overall, amazing food, great staff and more. Do yourself a favor and eat here if you're ever nearby!
Best Greek food in Vegas!!! The Papas family always delivers. Can't go wrong with any item you order.  Make it a must eat joint

ok so I've only been here once but I'm already in love. We found this place w/ the Entertainment guide book. (and Yelp of course)   LOVE at first sight. The place is so cute and they have the greek music in the bkground so you feel like you're on the set of that wedding movie.   I ordered the souvlaki mini. Perfect for me. mini greek salad, a skewer of chicken, skewer of steak, rice, pita bread, that yogurt sauce and lemon.  I'd order that again in a heartbeat.   My bf went w/ the super lemon chicken pita sandwhich and it was to die for. I loved it. even just the one bite, I'd drive all the way bk from Henderson /Green Valley just to order that.   After reading the reviews the only thing we knew for sure was we were going to order the greek fries. eh. that was the lowest rated item I tried. Nxt time I go I'll get the lemon pita and a baklava.

GREAT Greek Food.  The kabobs and the gyros are delicious!!  The meat is always perfectly cooked, and the rice is my absolute favorite!  Everything is always fresh.  Never had a bad experience.    Very friendly staff, you can tell it is family owned.  It's the perfect place for takeout... call in your order, because this place gets busy!!

This is my go to place for Greek food!! I love their  vegetarian options.  I love the veggie pita, the Greek fries and the spanikopita(spinach) plate, ooh and the Greek pizza.  Everything is so fresh.  The salads are green, the salad dressing is very tasty, everything doesn't taste like it's just been sitting out all day, then warmed up.  Oh, and i love the cucumber dipping sauce that comes with the spanikopita...It's da bomb.  By the way, the prices are great.  Any time, a meal for 2 is about $20... that's a deal in my book!! Oh and omg, I forgot to mention their baklava.  I think it's the best in town, ever.  So good, that I ordered a pan of it for my bday party.  It was a hit and they made the whole process of it very easy.  I just had to return the pan the following day and got my deposit back for it. The owner, the son and the staff are very friendly and they take pride in their business.  They know their customer's faces and names.  Since I live close, I'm kind of a regular, haha.  I also love taking my friends and family who are from out of town to this place.  They always tell me how good the good is and how fresh it is.   Give it a try, even the vegetarian menu, I know you will like it too!!

I'm no expert on Greek food, but I've had my share of souvlakis.    I ordered the Steak Souvlaki ($8.99) from their lunch special menu from 11 am to 4 pm.  It came with a side salad, rice pilaf, and pita bread.  There were four pieces of meat skewered along with a side of tzatziki sauce.  First off, I think I was expecting something else.  I was expecting more of a souvlaki wrap, as this is how I used to have it.  So that part was different for me.  It was okay, nothing spectacular though.  (I soon learned that most souvlakis served here are with pita bread, and not wraps.  So I'll have to keep my eyes out for that.)  The Husband ordered the Moussaka "Ground beef, eggplant, and potatoes layered and topped with Bechamel sauce" ($8.99)  It did sound a lot more appetizing and once I read it off the menu, he was easily sold.  It was okay and he said he's had better.  We also downed it with a Greek soda - blue raspberry.  Overall, Yassou Greek Grill Cafe was a decent Greek food experience.  You go up to the counter and give your order and pay.  They'll give you a number and you take a seat and your food will arrive a few minutes later.  They were pretty busy the weekend we went, so they are doing okay.  It didn't have me screaming for more though.

Let's put it this way, I don't eat here enough. The food is delicious and the quality is great. I love how passionate the father and son are about running this business. They're always working hard to keep the food flowing and the restaurant clean.   My only problem is deciding what to order! I usually end up getting a gyro, lemon herb chicken salad, or the mini souvlaki special. There were a few occasion that I noticed the meat was ever so slightly on the dry side. More of an observation than a complaint, nothing that a little lemon or tzatziki can't fix. Everything is well seasoned and flavorful. I'll have to come back more often.

Food was so good!!!! The Greek salad was well dressed and the feta cheese was a good amount.  Service took awhile. I do understand it's a Friday during lunch time. 30 minute wait for a salad.  I definitely will come back to try their other good looking foods :)
I love this place. Everytime I go I get a consistently tasty gyro. The staff is always friendly and food is always great. This is my favorite spot for gyros in Vegas.

Still love love love the food here.  I've yet to branch beyond the Mini Souvlaki Special (one mini steak skewer, one mini chicken skewer, rice, salad, pita, and tzatziki sauce), with a side of Greek fries, because it's sooooo delicious and filling. It's great when dining in, and even better when I send my partner out to bring it home.  Yassou has become my go-to takeout spot for nights when I'm feeling too lazy to drive or cook! I'm posting a photo of the up-to-date menu, since it's not available on line.

Love this place.  Grateful that Yelp friends J. and C. introduced me to this place.  Fell in love after one meal.  The Greek Fries covered in spices and feta cheese were SO good.  Nicely crispy and perfectly complemented by the spices and LOTS of feta cheese.  They went perfectly with the equally tasty Olympic Veggie Pita.  Soft drinks are self-serve and refillable, a plus on hot days.  Parking is ample in the lot but might not be able to park right in front of the restaurant.  Dine-in space is more than you'd expect from looking at the place from the road but probably gets completely full at peak lunch/dinner hours.
I love this place the only thing is I wish it was closer to my house. But, whenever I am in the area and hungry I come here. Everything is made to order and great quality.
Pita and humus was really good!  I had the Athenian plate.  Lots of food. I was looking for a different Greek restaurant and was not disappointed.

Omg this place is amazing!!!! My favorite is their mini slouvaki combo which includes rice, salad, chicken, and beef skewer! It's so filling and tastes amazing. The prices here are so reasonable and everything is quality. The only thing is, ask for your pita on the side. I had two orders, one was stale and inedible and my other one was soft warm and fluffy.   This place is tucked in on charleston and buffalo, and is always filled with hungry customers! The staff here are really nice and the menu is quite large. Overall one of my favorite Greek places.

BF were in the area and hungry so I popped in on Yelp to find a place and Yassou came up.   I also saw that there was a coupon for $5 off $20 here: http://www.citycoups.com/yassougreekgrillcoupon.html so we were sold. When we got there, the lady at the counter is firm that you MUST print out the coupon off the website. Kinda a bummer considering I was already in front of their place, saw that ad and because of it decided to come in.   We shared-  Super lemon chicken pita sandwich ($6.79)- the difference with the super and regular lemon chicken is theres more meat and feta cheese in it. I think the super is the way to go since the feta helped meld the chicken, lemon, tzatziki all together. I think this is definitely something I'd get again and recommend getting here.   Gyro and Spanakopita plate ($8.59)- the gyro meat is pretty standard good, salad greens were fresh, pilaf is good, pita is soft. I appreciated that the spanakopita wasn't greasy, but it was just missing something for me so the plate over all was just okay.   It's order at the counter and find a seat so I don't have much to say about service other than what I stated above. Prices are reasonable and it's a cute little place If I'm in the area, I might stop in for that super lemon chicken sandwich but so far my overall impression is that this isn't I'd go drive all the way down for.

My favorite Greek place EVER!  That is not a easy bar to clear because I had to opportunity to go to Greece while I was in the service. The food is so amazing I just can't keep myself from coming back! Additionally, the customer service is superb! The establishment is spacious and offers complimentary wifi. I love this place!
Amazing food and service. Great place to go. Love it always.  Yum yum.  Best gyro shop in town.  Great stuff.

I went here because it was close my apartment. I had the big fat gyro special with greek fries and my girl got the spanokopita/gyro combo plate. We also ordered a side of hummus & a baklava. Total of all of that was just under $30.  Overall very disappointing, the spanokopita was just bland with crappy pastry, the greek fries had a pinch of herbs and feta and otherwise tasted worse than fries from burger king. The gyro sandwhich was ok but didn't stand out and the baklava was mostly pastry with little filling.  Every single one of these dishes is done better close by at Mad Pita Express on Durango between DI & Sahara with comparable prices. But by far the best greek place in town is The Fat Greek on Flamingo & Decatur. If you try the spanokopita at Yassou then go have the same thing at fat greek you will just laugh at the difference as it's not in the same universe.  Disappointing for sure. Save your time and go to Mad Pita Express or if you want to kick it up a notch Hedary's or Fat Greek.

Located off of west charleston just past buffalo. The food is great. Only been here twice and will definitely be back. You get lots of tasty food for your $$. I ordered the double chicken bob. Nice lemony tang and just the right amount of spice. Tender and juicy! Includes rice and Greek salad with pita bread.  5 stars! Check it out for lunch.

We went here one evening craving Greek food, saganaki in particular. We showed up 45 minutes before they closed and the employee didn't look too excited to see us. Most of the place was already cleaned up and closed off. We were a group of 8 and no one offered us help with seating as we struggled to drag tables together to accommodate us. We expected a dining restaurant with waiters and such, but this is more of a cafe feel where you order your food at the counter and then get your own beverages. They were out of saganaki. Sadness. But I ordered the Spanakopita Plate and it was enough for two people. And all of it was good. Looking at everyone's plates, portion sizes were a definite plus. While we were eating, several people came in to pick up carry out orders. We'll be back, hopefully on a day where they have Saganaki.

Excellent food. Layout and atmosphere are strange. Feels like they can't decide if they want to be a restaurant or a fast food joint. Not saying the food is that quality, just the look of the place makes it feel that way. Was not at all what I expected. Definitely more of a quick-casual place than a sit down lunch as I had expected.  Back to the food though. Ordered the "My Big Fat Gyro" and it was delicious. I wanted to get another one. Had Flame broiled beef & lamb with feta cheese. Also comes with Tzaziki sauce but I'm not a fan of that so had them hold it. Didn't need it anyway.   Kacey ordered the Souvlaki Combo with Chicken and Steak. The chicken was really good. Steak was just ok I thought. A little tough for my liking but that may be the way its supposed to be made in that dish.  Thought about trying the baklava but it was just sitting out uncovered on top of a display cooler right next to a table where people were eating. I'll pass.  Service was decent for a quick casual spot. I'll definitely be back. They should really do some updating and freshen the place up a bit though.

Quality has degraded.  From souvlaki with juicy chunks of either beef or chicken interspersed with onions and green peppers, now there's grainy chunks of lower-quality beef and overcooked, dry chicken, one or two slivers of onion and no green pepper to speak of.  All we ever get is the souvlaki plate, but lately we're considering finding another place to order out.  Sad, because for years we got consistently delicious food.

Had dinner here over the weekend. We ordered the gyro plate comes with salad n rice. Always fresh. I love their Greek fries. It's all very delicious. The meat nice n tender the pita bread nice n soft. The owner is very friendly. He comes n say hi to his customers when he has time. I never had a bad experience. I will continue to come back. :)

I can really appreciate some good Mediterranean food. Mediocre Mediterranean? Not so much... As far as it is from my house, I doubt I'll make the drive all the way out here any time soon.  KABOBS: Doesn't Mediterranean food revolve around grilled meats? The steak souvlaki was a little tough, quite flavorless, and dry. Given I did take my order to-go, but the 15 minute drive home exasperated an already existing issue. The gyro meat was pretty tasty! It was thinly sliced and quite flavorful unlike the beef chunks they threw on a stick.  SIDES: The combo plates we ordered were supposed to come with greek salad, rice, and pita. The pita was stone cold and they were out of rice--they replaced it with extra salad. We also got an order of the garlic fries. Basically, french fries packed with feta and some garlic powder. I've eaten better at the greek festival.   The kabobs and the rest of the sides were somewhat lack-luster. But we really enjoyed the calamari. It was just as delicious as the stuff I get at Firefly. But the dipping sauce it came with was disgusting . It was some stale tasting butter concoction.  After this meal of good and bad, I'm kind've over Mediterranean food at this point. After finishing the whole meal, I couldn't substantiate that the $25 I spent plus gas was worth it.
If you love Greek food, this is certainly the place to sit down and enjoy with friends. The BEST gyro in Las Vegas.... I swear.... With a respectable price to accompany a large portion.
Me and my girlfriend come here all the time, and every time the food just wows us. Only thing we can complain about is the wait time for the food, but its because its cooked to order!
Best Greek spot in Vegas!!!!  I come here at least once a week for lunch always consistent, good clean food!!!!  Thank you!!!

I feel it is necessary to begin my review of Yassou by mentioning that I may have a slight obsession with Greek/Mediterranean cuisine. I love everything about the food - plain and simple. To give some perspective, I eat Greek/Mediterranean cuisine 3 times a week on average; and I refuse to order from any other restaurant in this category. Why? Because Yassou has thoroughly impressed me every single time.  Let's start with service quality. I would give these folks 6 stars out of 5 if it was possible. From my understanding, Yassou is a restaurant run by multiple generations of a single family - a family that is truly passionate about what they do. As soon as you step foot in the restaurant, you get the feeling that every employee loves where they work. In a perfect world, every restaurant would evoke these sentiments in their customers. And how about the food? Outstanding food quality and generous portions makes Yassou my absolute favorite Greek restaurant in Las Vegas. Always fresh and high-quality ingredients make every dish a winner. I'm a huge fan of both the greek salad and the gyro + chicken kebab combo plate. The protein is perfectly seasoned and bursting with flavor, and the rice is nothing short of delectable. Do yourself a favor and give Yassou a try!

Easy 5 star....here's why :  Not only was it the best tasting gyro I have had to date, but it was one of the best priced lunches.  I went with the combo, gyro, fries, and smoothie shake for $10 and change.  The gyro was great...I think the feta cheese puts it on another level.  The fries were kind of plain...wish they had a sauce or seasoning....just get another cucumber sauce to dip the fries :)  The smoothie was surprisingly good...a nice touch, instead of offering a soda with the combo.  I would have went with water otherwise.  Also had a chicken pita sandwich...zesty lemon and herbs...also a good choice.  Can't go wrong here!  We will come back again!

I was staying with friends in the area and wanted to try something different for dinner.  Thanks to Yelp with my search for a restaurant nearby, I found Yassou's.  My friend's meal was delicious as was my grilled chicken in a lemon marinate.  The grandson of the original owner came by our table to welcome us and to make sure we were happy with our food.  I wish I had a similar place like this back home.  The good news is that my friend, whom lives nearby, can't wait to bring her husband here, knowing he will love it.  And when I come back to visit, I will definitely be back to try another dish!

Busy place! We ate here on a Tuesday around noon and the parking lot was full. Food took  a while to receive, but it was worth the wait. I ordered the Souvlaki combo - grilled chicken and beef skewers served with rice, greek salad, and tzatziki sauce. The total with a soda came out to about $13.00. The chicken and beef were seasoned very well, a little dry, but still very tasty. The rice was absolutely amazing though, full with flavor. My friend got an order of the greek fries and they are a MUST try! Super crispy and tasty fries. Thumbs up!

I was tired of McDonald's, Burger King, and all the other fast food restaurants I was eating from.  So, I yelped for places and found this with some good ratings and others not so good.  Needless to say, I had no expectations for this restaurant.  I figured anything that doesn't have anything to do with American fast food will be good for me.  Our order were as follows: 1.)  My Big Fat Gyro 5.79 Flame broiled beef & lamb with feta cheese.  This was tasty and had a lot of flavor to it.  Because it was so fat, it was hard to put my mouth around it.  That didn't sound too good, should I have written this differently so it doesn't so graphic?  All jokes aside, this is definitely a no joke gyros. 2.)  Greek Fries  $2.69 I have had better greek fries.  For some reason, this was more bland than the other ones I've had in other restaurants. 3.)  Veggie Spreads Plate 7.49 A delicious assortment of Hummus, Tzakziki, Taramosalata & meatless Dolmades.   I felt this one was lacking something.  The rice was just so bored on its own, and I found the salad to be just okay.  Everything else on the plate was pretty good.  As for texture, there wasn't much added to it.    I rated it A-Ok because it's just that, A-Ok.

Went back on Sunday, the food was still delicious! You really get your monies worth of food here. I can't wait to go back. Actually I've been back about 5 times since my first review. The food is so good!

This is probably the best quick Greek food in Las Vegas.  They also do the food at the annual Greek festival.  I love the gyro and rice.  The baklava is quite good as well.  The service is good and so are the prices.  :-)

Yassou's is the place to get good Greek food.   They make amazing Spanakopita (spinach pie) and their lemon buttery rice is delish.   It took about 15  minutes for the food to be served but it was worth the wait. Prices are reasonable, $8 to $9 for a sure-to-fill entree. The staff was friendly and prompt.   Black and white checkered floor tiles, dainty Greek music, and abstract(-ish) paintings on the wall creates a friendly comfortable atmosphere in this little cafe.   If you're trying to fix a Greek craving, this is it.

Not enough can be said about this place. Upon first impression it's your very typical Greek cafe. Lots of blue and white tile. Greek music. Friendly staff. And awesome food.   My wife often makes fun of me when we go to Greek restaurants because I complain that they don't serve enough meat on their gyros or gyro plates. Not this place! It'd be fair to say that they even serve to much. I ended up forcing myself to eat all of the meat and left the trimmings because I didn't want to waste any of it. It's so good, that no matter how full I was, I still wanted to eat more.   I had the traditional beef and lamb gyro, and my wife and I split the gyro pasta. The kids had the beef skewers. Awesome!

My family and I used to come to this restaurant regularly about 10 years ago. It always served excellent Greek food and today for Fathers Day we were in the mood for Greek and thought we'd revisit...only to be really disappointed.   The first thing we noticed was how dirty the floor in the dining area was and the bathroom's poor condition. One restroom was out of order and the other was disgusting, in the most literal sense. It smelled very strongly of urine (it was so intense it actually reminded me of cat urine ) and the floor was covered in dirty marks, paper towels and long hairs. I have no idea how so much hair has accumulated in a restaurant bathroom unless someone literally washed, blow dried and styled their hair in there. Additionally, the bathroom hardware was dirty, rusty and in pretty bad shape.  Next we ordered our food and were surprised not to see any actual Greek ppl behind the counter or on the line. We always felt like we had a genuinely Greek experience when we previously came as the person at the til and the cooks obviously had either a hand in ownership or had a personal connection to Greek culture and cuisine.   As for pricing, we were expecting it to be slightly overpriced, as good Greek food can be. If you aren't eating at Del Taco, you can't expect those prices. Unfortunately, Yassou's prices no longer represent the freshness or quality of the food. The food came out very sporadically and some entrees took an exceedingly long time. There were 9 of us eating and all of our meals came out at different times, which is awkward for a family meal with kids who get their food last. I had requested that my Greek Fries be extra crispy and when they were delivered mine didn't look any different than the other normal Greek fries we had ordered. When I asked the food server about my fries' appearance she said that mine were definitely the extra crispy ones and that they all are, in fact, prepared extra crispy. It was a weird comment and didn't really make sense since none of the fries were very crispy anyway, but it was obvious that she didn't have much of a say behind the counter and was trying her best to help the customers in the dining room. The hummus portion was generous but only comes with 1 pita cut into very small triangles, so unless you plan to eat your hummus by the spoonful, you'll have request more pita. Lastly, the meat on my gyro plate was shaved very thinly and the slices were dried and hard before I was even half done. The only thing redeeming about our experience was the excellent customer service of the food runner. She was very friendly and helpful. Offering a cup lid for my young daughter's water and bringing extra napkins, etc. She was great. Overall, we are very disappointed in the current condition of what used to be a fantastic Greek meal AND experience in this part of Las Vegas.

My husband introduced this place to me and I fell in love with it! After a few more times of coming here I brought my co-workers for lunch and they enjoyed it as well. I always get the lunch chicken special which comes with rice and salad. Tonight I tried the chicken gyro which was also really good. We also got to speak to the owner during this visit and he spent at least 15 minutes talking to us about how he got started in the business. Absolute pleasure to speak with! I would say we come about twice a month and have always had a wonderful experience. I really pay attention to customer service and this place has great staff!

This place is pretty good. I did order a gyro plate and it definitely wasn't a gyro. More like a deconstructed gyro? Pretty hard to eat. The food took a while to come out and there isn't any parking. It is definitely a family restaurant and I loved that!  The food is good but the inconvenience of the wait time and how hard it is to eat I don't think I'll be back.

I was going to this place since it opened. The owner is a great guy. His two sons are complete idiots who don't know the hospitality business. I always ate the same thing. I finally tried the hummus. It came with one piece of pita. I ate the pita and half the hummus was still on my plate. I asked the older brother for another pita slice. He says that will be 80 cents. That's it. You don't treat a good customer like that. I haven't been back. Now I go to Paymons every week. Better food. Better prices. And much better service

Whew just finished my meal I got the mini souvlaki special which is one bee and one chicken skewer both with about 3 pieces of meat on it, salad and rice and a pita. I opted for no rice and double salad  It was so good the meat was so flavorful and neither were over cooked, the salad was so. Great too! I looked at other people plates and everything looked amazing! Will def come back!!
Best authentic Greek food in town. Privately owned and not a chain. I go here all the time for the great quality and full menu.

I enjoy the little place and the location. I love that greek isle feel. I really enjoy the chicken pita here it is so flavorful. Love how you can taste the lemon. The only thing I don't like is the pita bread with the chicken platter because it is so bland but it does taste good when it's a sandwich. Lunch specials are pretty good here.  PROS: decor, location, and food

I love this place! As a vegetarian they have a lot of options, but my favorite is the veggie gyro with Greek fries! Everything I've had here is delicious. The restaurant is clean and the service is great. I would definitely recommend it, 5 stars.
Love this place! Peter and his family are the nicest people and make the best Greek food in Las Vegas!!! If you haven't been please do!
Food was very good. Had the the lemon herb chicken pita. Very tasty. Lots of flavor. Staff is very friendly.

I've gotten takeout from here a handful of times with the fam. Everyone is alway happy and well fed. I'll update the review when I finally eat in, that's the only reason I'm unable to provide 5 stars at this point. The Big Fat gyro is my fav. And the grape leaves are yummy as well. Everything is always put together well and appears fresh.   Totally worth a try if you're craving Greek!

Went here for lunch and got a combo for $11. It comes with a gyro, fries and a smoothie.  For my combo I picked Greek fries and strawberry banana smoothie. I've had my fair share of gyros in this town.  Gyro: Not as heaping with meat as my favorite gyro place in Henderson. The meat was more cooked and saltier than what I'm used to. I couldn't finish it. More tzatziki to mask the saltiness please. 3.5/5  Greek Fries: I love fries. Crispy, crunchy and hot with a little bit of feta cheese and parsley. Not the best Greek fries I've had but still good. They only give you a handful so you might want to order another side of fries. 4/5  Strawberry Banana Smoothie: This is absolutely great since I don't drink soda. They have strawberry, mango, banana, etc. I asked them to make strawberry banana smoothie for me if it wasn't too much of a hassle and they did. Yay!  5/5  But for what you get with the combo, it's definitely good value. I'd much rather drive 3 more miles to get here than eat at G Time. Plus, the service was great.
I use Pete for catering often!  The Greek salad is amazing, and he truly prepares the best gyro meat in town...the lamb is so tender and flavorful that it melts in your mouth.
Consistently delicious!! The service and the food is excellent and never disappoints!!

What a nice Greek spot in the middle of the desert. For many years I would pass by this place but never got the chance to check it out. After work, I finally decided to complete another restaraunt that was bookmarked in my app for awhile. I'm so happy that I did, because I had great experience at Yassou. The moment you walk in this place, you'll notice the Greek artwork and typical blue and white motif that is allover the restaraunt. There is a cool story along the wall about the history of the restaraunt. Greek music in the background is played throughout and the open kitchen provided a cool interaction between guests and employees.   Onto the food, everything was simply delicious from the Lemon Chicken Pita combo with Greek Fries to the Chicken Souvlaki meal was spot on. They make really good Pita bread and the Tzaziki Sauce was delicious. The Chicken was tender and really seasoned just right. Every bite of my Lemon Chicken had a refreshing taste yet balanced savory flavor. Another item that stood out was the fresh Baklava, very good and made just right. Great amount of sweetness and crunch with a moist texture. I would come back to try out more of the other dishes that they offer in the near future.  Another cool thing about this place was when I went to use the Restroom, I notice that there is a Patio to the left side facing Charleston Blvd was a cool dinning option during days when Vegas has mild weather. The Restroom was clean but I had to share this experience because when I used one of the Restroom. I immediately notice a blue bottle to the corner and couldnt contain myself because it was Windex. All I could think of was, "My Big Fat Greek Wedding!" LoL.  2017 Yelp Review #31

I got the lemon chicken gyro and my husband got a skewer combo and we shared hummus, and everything was delicious and fresh. Everyone was very friendly and the service was quick. I will definitely come back!

Yassou is the best Greek food I've ever had!  We eat here once a week, and crave the Gyro Plate.  The meat is always perfectly cooked and the portions are generous (In fact writing this is making my mouth water.)!  Peter the owner is friendly and welcoming you always feel like you are coming home to eat.  If you are ready for the REAL deal, and haven't tried Yassou, you should, even if there is a line out the door. . . the food is worth the wait!  Outstanding!!!
Extremely well priced. Excellent food. Huge portions. Will definitely eat here 2-3X a month going forward. Nice atmosphere on all levels. One of my favorites for this food category. A MUST TRY! !!
Good food but kitchen and service was disorganized. Gyro sandwiches were delicious. Food 4 star service 2 stars.

The first thing that drew me to Yassou Greek Grill Cafe in 2008 was the building.  I'm a fan of Greek Mythology and had only had Greek food once before, and thought this place with the Greek lettering and broken pillar logo looked quite inviting.  Plus, it was very close to CSN.  My favorite thing to order is the My Big Fat Gyro w/o onions... because, well, who likes onions?  You get a great, heaping helping of lamb, tomatoes, lettuce, feta, and tzatziki sauce.  The Greek fries are also yummy-- I think they are sprinkled with a touch of lemon, and then lots of feta cheese.  The owners are amicable and if you're unsure of what to order, they can make great recommendations.  One of my friends hadn't had lamb before, and they sliced a sample off the rotisserie just for her to try.  They also sell the pita bread they use on their gyros.  I'm so happy that a mom and pop place that actually serves quality food is surviving this economy.

A sandwich fit for a hungry man. That was the only thing running through my head as the waitress placed down my enormous gyro. A combo with American fries and a smoothie comes in at a cool $10.99. It might seem like a lot for fast food, but once you see the gyro it is not outrageous. What is ridiculous is the thought that any single person could finish this colossal pita sandwich alone.   Yassou does give a generous portion of meat, veggies, feta, and tzatziki sauce. I was torn about the meat, because I love the crispiness, but it was also a little dry. With the amount of yogurt based dressing, it is easy to overlook. I am glad that I split this meal with my sister. By the time we finished, we were both out of commission and ready for a nap.

I had seen the building many times but hesitated to stop and try the food until I read the reviews. Lovely place. Clean as a whistle. Great service. Ordered dolmades and Greek salad to go. Fresh and delicious. Enough for lunch the next day. Will be back when I am hungrier to try the other goodies on the menu.
