How lucky to have found this spot of Greek heaven I can walk to from my place.

This place rocks!  I stop by every time I visit Las Vegas.  The food is clean and tastes great! Prices are reasonable so you don't feel like your breaking the bank to eat some good Greek food.  They do make everything as you order so sometimes it may take awhile to get your food.  I'd recommend calling in your order if you're going to take-out anyways.

The service was so horrible. They really ruined my experience and would not want to visit again based on that. The star I guess would be for the cook with the curly gray hair. He seems nice and he was really working. A small piece of advice that I could leave would be for the employees to not go smoke on their break by the people dining outside. Also, there are no pictures up so if someone asks a question about the menu there is no need to be annoyed. One last thing, maybe you should bring everyone's food out at the same time. It's awkward for one person to be eating the the other person doesn't get their plate for another 15 minutes and they're left to eat alone.

Delicious! Took Mom-n-law and was not disappointed! Hubby and I had the huge gyro with rice and salad mom had mixed souvlaki plate. Everything was scrumptious and we were stuffed. I also purchased some dry pasta and a bottle of Mythology Greek olive oil. The oil is so yummy we eat it plain with bread and vinegar!!! I have yet to try the pasta. The only negative I can give is that the Baklava was dry, as other have said. AND the last last negative is...... We live on Sunrise Mountain, we NEED a YASSOU East side ! PLEASE !!!!

So after a couple years, I decided to give this place a try again. Now I'm hooked. I love the spanakopita plate and lemon chicken soup. The spanakopita is perfect and the dolmas are delicious as well, not too salty like some places. The rice pudding is also a welcomed ending to the meal.

Visited a couple times - mostly for special occasions. Service is decent but not outstanding. The food is what brings us back. Most recently we placed an order for pick up and 1) ordered Greek coffee which we received in a cup less than half full. Not sure if this is the normal serving?? 2) found a hair in our food. Never a pleasant finding.

The quality of the food and the yumminess were right on point. However, the service was super slow and the gyros were really lacking on the meat portions. Unfortunately they drop from 5 stars to 3 for me.

The food and the service are equally great here. Definitely a city favorite for me. Family owned place with not a bad item on the menu. I could come here multiple times a week and not get tired of this place. They make everyone feel welcome and are also generous with their portions.

Finally checked this place out yesterday. Trying to hit up all the spots I have bookmarked! Anyway, the service was very friendly and I ordered the chicken special for lunch, which was 1 souvlaki skewer, salad, rice, tzatziki and pita. The bf ordered the super lemon chicken pita. My chicken souvlaki was nice and moist, but the salad was drenched in dressing that seemed to be dumped on top of the lettuce and not tossed through. That's a pet peeve of mine...hate getting one bite of dry salad and then the next bite swimming in dressing. Small thing, but kinda ruined the salad for me--the feta on it was yummy though. The tzatziki was ok,  but I've had better. It just tasted a bit processed or something--can't quite put my finger on it.   Overall we both thought the food was good, but it wasn't so spectacular that I can't wait to go back. Don't get me wrong, I would definitely stop in there again for lunch if I was in the area, but I prob won't go out of my way to make a special trip over there.

I guess this would be an okay place to eat if you're leaving the Social Security office down the block and are literally about to die of old age and want to have one last gyros sandwich before you go. But otherwise, meh.  We had lunch here and it was unremarkable. A Greek salad and gyros sandwich were both without any standout features. French fries were obviously from a bag, frozen. Not worth the calories. The sandwich had too much lettuce and not enough onion on the gyros sandwich, so it was bland, and tomato diced, and on top, which made the sandwich unnecessarily messy.  The service was friendly and the dining room was bright, spacious and sunny - and the presence of a coffee bar is definitely a plus - but I won't be back.

A Greek man once told me "This is the only good Greek food in Las Vegas". I can't say that I've eaten at every Greek place in LV, but I can say that none of the other places I've tried have come close.  Let's start with what to expect, the employees/owners do not seem to be the most service oriented people. Some days they greet you with a hello, other days they convey a sense of "hurry up and order". I would like to go on record as stating that I don't believe this is a bad thing. I don't care if the staff doesn't hug and comfort me in times of need, I just want good food which is exactly what Yassou provides.   Their prices are fair given the quality and size of the plates they serve. I usually end up spending 10-15 dollars a meal. The thing that really sets them apart for me is their meats. Cooked perfectly, not dry, not tough, and definitely not bland.   They offer a few of those "powder from a box" smoothies, not good at all, but again, what really makes this place worth visiting is the food.   For all you folks who feel limited by "doors" and "walls", they have tables outdoors which is a plus.

We tried Yassou today, as we've been looking for good gyros since leaving Ohio where a strong Greek community resides. We each ordered the My Big Fat Gyro, and one of us had the salad + rice pilaf for an extra $2.49 while the other got the fries.  The gyros were not bad. They are a mix of beef and lamb and definitely worthy of the Fat name. We did not find them to be better than the gyros we've had in Ohio, but they were still good. I think much of the flavor came from salt, to be honest.  I was surprised by the rice pilaf, which gets high reviews. All I got was rice cooked in chicken broth- basically, yellow-hued rice with nothing more in it. That's not pilaf.  The Greek salad came with no vinaigrette- no salad dressing whatsoever. It was Greek by virtue of the feta and single olive that came with it, I guess.  The American fries were fine- just normal.

I.Just.Love.This.Place. I've been going here for probably 5 years now, if not more. They are consistently good. It's worth the drive from Boulder City (where I live) if that tell you anything!  Produce on salads and gyros is fresh, as is the meat - always well seasoned and cooked well. I've tried several things here, Spanakopita is fresh, truly made by hand (no pre boxed frozen stuff here). Fries are perfectly cooked and it's worth the upgrade to Greek fries. Feta cheese on salads and fries is creamy and tangy. Pitas are soft and delicious, and the gyros are made with generous portions. Sauces are delicious! The Baklava is made daily, SUPER fresh, warm, and the perfect balance of sweetness with the richness of the pastry and nuts. One word of warning, they do not serve pitted olives so watch your teeth!   The staff are attentive and fast. This is a true family owned business and I see the owner and his son working their butts off every time I'm in. The eating areas are kept clean, and there's lots of natural light coming in and a nice outdoor patio area if you like. For what you get, the price is very reasonable.

I LOVE Mediterranean food, and I have tried a lot of restaurants in Vegas, and California. I was stoked to try this spot after reading the reviews (I even ran a block in the rain to get here!), but it was mediocre at best. My absolute favorite thing in the world (other than maybe koala bears) is koobideh/luleh/lula/ground beef kebab. They didn't have it here!  Major fail.  We ordered a chicken kebab plate, their special fries, and a gyro salad.   The chicken was dry.  For me, that's inexcusable at any med place.  Their whole deal is grilling things.  If you can't grill meat, don't open a restaurant that specializes in grilling meat. Period.   The fries were kind of nice with the spices, and feta bits, but the cut was a bit too thick, and they were overall a bit greasy (even for fries). The salad was pretty good.  I would eat it again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it either.

The best Greek fast food I've had in Vegas.  The wife and I ordered the big fat gyro and the super chicken sandwich.  The cashier also let us try a sample of the greek lemon pudding which was excellent so we got an order of that too.  Sandwiches were made to order so you had to wait a bit but its all worth it!

So decided to check out this place after seeing all of the great reviews on Yelp.  I'm a fan of Greek food, despite not having eaten at all of the Mediterranean restaurants in the valley.  For my initial visit, I decided on the Big Fat Gyro combo which included "Greek" fries (garlic and feta) and a fountain soda ($12). Their menu was quite large and encompassed a very nice range of specialties I look forward to checking out on future visits.  I arrived on a Thursday around 11:30 and was greeted by a friendly cashier.  After paying for my order, it magically appeared about 10 minutes later. Opa!!   The gyro was neatly wrapped in foil, and about a third of it was poking out, revealing tasty looking meat topped with tzatziki sauce and feta crumbles.  I was disappointed the meat didn't seem to have very much flavor; typically used to stronger Greek spices and flavors in the gyro meat, this was much more mild.  The pita was decent and definitely not fresh made, as stacks of pre-packaged pitas were displayed 10 high.  Anyway, it was pretty good.  I did notice the owner, Mr Pappas, to be working his tail off preparing nearly every dish himself.  This proud owner only had the assistance of another guy who helped him out when he had a chance.  His red faced determination was evident as he rarely stood still and ensured every dish was prepared as it should be.  Las Vegas needs to continue to support local, hard-working businessmen like Mr Pappas.   Look forward to my next visit when I plan on ordering Souvlaki platter with side of hummus.  Can't wait.

What else can I say except it's one of the best gyros you can get in the valley and at a solid price.  The Big Fat Gyro is just that.  They don't skimp on anything the comes in the gyro.  The lamb is well seasoned.  The tzatziki sauce it's refreshing.  Living in NLV, it's always worth the drive to eat here.  You can get the fries either American ( just fries) or Greek (w/feta cheese & herbs) with the meal.

Wow!  Everything is great!  Lived in Greece for 3 years, and the food here takes me back.  Everything I've tried (saganaki, gyro, pasta, chicken, dolmades, pork) have all been wonderful.  Not to mention the staff--all very friendly.  Definitely recommend!
This is my favorite Greek restaurant in vegas. Sometimes their service is slow but it's because they are so busy because the food is so good! Service is always friendly though. Food is delicious!!!!

I love the food here but service is clearly an issue.  Went to eat here with my boyfriend and it's like they forgot about us.  There were only two tables in the restaurant, and people were coming in and placing orders to go.  About three of these to go orders that were made after us were given out before they decided to cook ours.  We arrived with plenty of time to eat but because of this we got our food very close to closing time, and felt like we had to rush to eat.  Not cool.  The food was great, but the service ruined the experience for us.  We're not terribly picky people or anything either.

I walked out rather than wait for what looked like good food.   I was all excited about getting calimari in a mediteranian restaurant.  Never got so far as seeing if it was the real deal with tentacles or the scrappy calimari steak made out of octopus served in California most of the time.   The lunch plate sounded very good...beware. The olives have Pitts...a good way to break a too th...but truly olives are more tasty with Pitts....so the staff and the owner wouldn't wait for me to pull up their 5 dollar coupon and wouldn't honor it on line...only printed out.  They tried to guilt me into why I can't I plan in advance and get my printer to link with my computer....not their business.  I will return with a caseload of tourists and my service puppy and see what they have to say...rude people...they refused another coupon for a mature couple who didn't show the coupon assertively before the order was rung up....thumbs down here...I walked out....no stevia...no napkins....no wait staff to take your orders.   I get that the owner is Greek...this is a mediteranian restaurant...they have hummus but no tabouli or Tahini...REALLY.....go to chick pea or sababa in summerlin....imho...ShadowZRanch

Perfect for me.  Excellent place for a 1st date or quick, tasty & healthy meal.  Just went 1st time here yesterday.  It was freaking fantastic!  Seems like the owner knows everyone, because he didn't recognize me and started to help me make some decisions.  He then offered me a sample of some rice & greens, which appeared simple to the eye, but surprisingly delicious, light & fresh.  The portions are very generous and everything I had (platter of stuff) was simply perfect.  The owner truly cares about his quality of food and gave top notch service.  Other reviewers complain about the service, I assume the owner wasn't around at those times.
Love this place!!! I always order the Souvlaki combo. The meats are perfectly cooked.

This place is a hidden gem! The food was really good. I had the Souvlaki beef/chicken plate and my bf had the Moussaka plate. The meat was tender and cooked perfectly. The salad and rice are made well too. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the fact that the moussaka was really soggy. The place is very clean and the staff is friendly. They're priced well too. We plan on going back sometime soon!

Best gyros in town. HANDS DOWN.   I randomly walked in about a year ago to see what it was about. i tried a specialty plate. ehhh. it was alright, but i noticed everyone around me had a gyro. and so i decided that i was going to come here again and try to gyro.  oh man was that a good idea!! i crave gyros from here all the time.  i tried a gyro someplace else, and it wasn't very good.  thats when i truly appreciated how good this small deli-like restaurant was. i don't like the yogurt stuff on it, so i always ask for them to put it on the side. then i have the option of taking a couple bites with it instead of the whole thing.   again, this is a locally owned restaurant. so go support them!
Love it!  Been here well over 20 times, great food and great service.   The mousaka is my favorite dish.
Seriously good. You will not be disappointed! I had the super lemon chicken gyro with Greek fries!! Mmmmmmmm!!!!! Wish this place was where I lived!

I walked in just now after they had closed at 5:00, and although the kitchen was put away, the owners nephew offered to serve me the things that he could still make up. :) I thought that was such a nice gesture instead of turning away a first-time visitor, and hungry one at that! :) I had the Greek Salad and Rice Pilaf, and the Hummus, and all of it was awesome! Yum! I'm a new fan of this place because of everything they did. Wish more businesses were like them. Everyone come here and try these guys. Family owned, let's support them! :)

Very excellent Greek food. I had the Gyros plate and had enough left to take home. Great tasting with real Lamb shaved off of rotisereie , not the brown lunchmeat type. Girlfriend had the Big Gyro sandwhich. Large and filling !! I Tsadziki was great too. Recommended !!

This place is delicious! I go here whenever I visit my sister who lives in LV. I love the greek fries!! Actually, everything I had was great. They don't always have smoothies but with so many other great options, who cares!! Best Greek Food in LV!! Yassou even came out to say hello, he has awesome hair!
Wow! This place is amazing whole family visited for the first time today. Tried several different plates and sandwiches everything was amazing. Also highly suggest a smoothie
Es sin duda la comida griega más rica el lugar muy limpio y el servicio excelente se los recomiendo no se arrepentirán

I've been coming to yassous for 9 years and I'd say they've stayed consistent throughout all these years. I tend to always order the same things bc I'm a creature of habit and it's just really tasty.  They are family run with the dad cooking in the back most of the time and his son running the front. I get the avgolemo (lemon rice soup) mmmmmm you must try it! Also the big fats are insanely good and you can't forget dessert with there scrumptious baklava. I highly recommend and will continue to come here as often as I can. Great customer service.

What can I say, best gyros!!! Got to get a big fat gyro with those feta fries!!! I have tried many gyros around town and no one can compare. I don't know what about it makes it different?!?! I've tried adding some of the things on this gyro to other gyros at other places and it still doesn't compare. Super friendly service-I feel like they know me here ha ha. Love love love! If you like gyros--try it!!

If I could give Yassou's 10 stars I would do it in a heartbeat.  Absolutely THE BEST gyro (big fat) in the valley.  We have tried them all and if you want the best for Greek food then this is it.  Prices are very reasonable, portions are huge.  The owner works behind the line and he works hard - yet always finds a minute to look up and wave or say hi, especially when he sees the hubby's Yankees hat!  Awesome food, friendly staff, clean restaurant, great prices, you can't ask for anything more.

Gr8 Greek fast food w/quality ingredients and a big menu.  Casual atmosphere w/good service.  Hype is true here. Vegetarian and carnivore selections are delicious. Generous servings and good service. Recommend the Greek Plates and desserts. Yummy pita and gyros.

Where do I begin? I always passed this cute little Greek restaurant on my way to my friends house until one day I decided to give it a try. Thank goodness I did the food was amazing you can just taste the  freshness and authenticity but also the passion the chef has for his cooking the minute I walked in I was greeted not only by the cashier but the chef came out to say hello as well I felt very welcomed and most definitely content with my food. You have the option of taking you food to go, eat inside the restaurant, or eat out in their patio which is what I did. :)

Looking for something to eat when I ventured beyond the strip for work and found this great Greek place!  Plenty of seating!  Ordered the Greek Salad with Herb Chicken and while there wasn't much chicken, the vinaigrette was perfect. Feta cheese on point. Personally, I love cherry tomatoes on my salads but that might be just me.

I had the big fat gyro...it was okay, but the main issue I had was that it was so salty.  My boyfriend had one of the plates, and he did not like the excess salt content either.   We were drinking water hours afterwards.  The place I think needs a little TLC.  Pictures do not depict what it is really like.  The bathroom was really dirty, a real turn off.   I doubt we will return.
Excellent Greek food,  prepared by excellent staff, my husband and I enjoyed it!, we'll definitely return

We had Yassou's delieverd to our office and it was my first time having Yassou. I was enjoyed my meal very much, the traditional gyro was so flavorful and the chicken kabobs were easily eaten on the stick, i wasnt a fan of the baklava the ratio of filo and filling wasnt even there was to much filo and not enough filling but other than that the meal was fantastic

This was the first restaurant I ate at in Vegas, and, 9 years later, it continues to be one on my favorites! The gyro, souvlaki, and spanakopita are all absolutely delicious!   My parents come from Ohio every year for Christmas, and we eat here at least twice because my mom loves it.   Great, family run business. If you're looking for amazing, affordable Greek food, this is the place.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Amazing gyros!!! Also love the salads here too!! So tasty and good family owned place! The gyro meat is the real deal here!! And the dessert is so good!! Baklava is so good and also the rice pudding!!!

Okay, this is pretty much a brand new restaurant. So, maybe they're working The Kinks out. I ordered the filet Kabob. The menu says filet mignon. Yeah, I don't think so. I'll try again and update my review later. The stuffed grape leaves were not bad. The  humas was pretty authentic.

Amazing food, best Greek food in Las Vegas! I enjoy the Greek Salad with Gyro meat, my wife really likes the chicken skewers with rice. Friendly staff always happy and willing to help. It gets really busy around lunch time so arrive early. Great for catering as well.

Wow! Thanks LVYELP for all the great reviews! I love trying new places! Today I made my way to Yassou for the first time with one of my besties. We ordered 3 appetizers and a main entree and shared everything. $30 for 2 people for lunch is reasonable! Everything we had was delicious! I'm a fan of their pita bread and hummus! I found my new favorite greek spot for lunch in the city! I will come back! My gf and I both agreed YGGC rocks! Love it! If you're in the area or visiting the city and looking for greek food... come here! no regrets! great customer service, no problem with seating (indoor/outdoor) or parking, affordable! -Miss Yelp 2012

Best greek food hands down baby.  Owners 1 of a kind people.  Work their asses off.  Great guys.  Came to my wifes work for one of their families bdays and boy they spread the love tipping everyone and treating the staff like gold.  1 thing i will say is the portion of saginaki seems small but taste good.  Best gyro ever.

So yummy!! Attentive staff! The gyro was delicious and everything tasted fresh. The cashier was good and attentive and the staff is friendly. Best Greek food I've had in a while! Also the baklava is delicious and highly recommended!

Food is great. Service is lacking. Girl behind counter all though super nice is pushing retarded. You tell her one thing she does another. I watched it with my own eyes in the 30 minutes I sat in the restaurant.

The food here is delicious. In from out of town but would come back regularly if we could.   We ordered the big fat gyro. All the ingredients were fresh and perfectly portioned. The meat wasn't greasy or dry. We also had the Greek fries which tasted like heaven. Definitely recommend those for a side. My husband really enjoyed the baklava for dessert - which was a big piece, enough to share.   The inside is small but clean and charming.   Highly recommend!
I have been coming here for five years now and every meal is great. I highly recommend this restaurant. They are fast, friendly and the food is always fresh!

This is a mom and pop joint for the Mediterranean food.  The chicken kabobs were really good, and the Greek salad was okay. I think I had the lemon herb chicken or something like that. Everyone seemed to love their dish. Prices are quite modest as well. I'd come back since the workers are super sweet and they have great service.

I returned to the "Yassou" grill, to see if they had returned to their original recipe for the lemon based salad dressing, certainly a house speciality and worth the trip across town,  sorry to report they have not, and serve only the oily inferior blend, sad.  (sure wish they would rethink the dressing change,   old dressing a 10+, new version a 2-

I came here 4 years ago, thought the gryo was too salty and otherwise average, and never returned.   Came back with a friend on a super busy lunch time on Friday. The hummus was good and seems house-made. They didn't have the red caviar for another dip on the menu I wanted to try. My friend like her Greek Salad.   I would give it 1 star for the dolmades if not for the above. Why is there meat in it?? The grape leaves were hard, old, and stringy/veiny. The dip that came with it was lemony-sour but also oily in a way that its yellow tallowed appearance reminded me of lard. And the texture was similar.   I'll stick with Meraki Grill.

Service, Sweet Sweet Excellent Customer service is what takes this local-owned and family-run restaurant over the top.   They try their darndest to remember your first name and treat you as if you had been going to their restaurant for years even if you are a newbie.  I hope they will be around whenever I make my yearly trip back to LV
This wasn't too bad.  I had the lamb gyro.  Needs a little more flavor some where and thats where the sauce comes in.  I would come back for seconds and try something different.
Got a gyro plate and loved it. Fantastic service, delicious food, convenient location. Will definitely come again.

Excellent salmon plate. Delicious lemon sauce on the salmon kept it moist and tasty. Yassou maintains consistent quality and has a good variety of menu selections. Family owned and operated. Pleasant staff. Everything I've eaten here has been good quality.
Great food prepared by Greeks for great prices! What more can you ask for. The moussaka was amazing! Thanks Christian!

The Best Greek Food in Vegas....  A Big Fat Gyro is the bomb.   The chicken plate is the perfect change of pace if you don't want a gyro.   They cater too.  Easy and simple.   I eat here 3 times a week.  I stopped eating meet for almost 300 days, but the thought of missing out on not being able to have a gyro brought me back to being a meat eater.   They have delicious spanakopita too...

Stopped by here for lunch with a colleague to grab a bite to eat. First of all, their customer service is TOP NOTCH! As soon as we walked in, the guy behind the register greeted us and chatted with my friend (he's a regular there). He was very polite and went out of his way to make sure I was comfortable and had everything and anything I could have wanted. He was like that with every person who walked in. KUDOS! It seemed like most of the people who came in were regulars, or they treated them that way. I can't say enough nice things about how awesome the service was. Now to the food. I had a Big Fat Gyro Sandwich that was yummy. My only complaint was that it needed more tahini sauce (again, you can never have too much!) but I stole some from my dining partner. It was a great, light meal. I definitely will be back!

Attempting to eat a little better than usual, I had my eye on a salad for lunch. I have wandered by this restaurant on many occasions and finally decided to give them a shot.   They were packed for lunch, so I put in my order and found a seat to sit and wait. It took a good amount of time since there were a number of orders ahead of me, but once it was ready I was so excited to dig right in to my lemon chicken and gyro Greek salad.   There was tons of meat, feta, onions and kalamata olives to accompany the lettuce. I didn't even feel the need to pour any dressing over it, since it was packed with so many delicious toppings. The salad really hit the spot the well-cooked gyro and chicken made my day, it was so delicious.   I plan on making this a regular on my lunchtime rotation and I look forward to trying many more menu items in the future. I might call my order in ahead of time to save time.

Love the food. Usually service is great too   Today service was terrible- the cashier, which is what dropped the rating down. He argued with another person who said her order was incorrect then went and tossed it back with the rest of the food with a visible attitude about it. Was t very pleasant when our order was taken. Owner wasn't in as he usually is- must have a big impact

Service/Owners are always friendly and smiling.  Hands on ownership with father and son team that take pride in their work.  Food is always excellent.  Most people love their chicken kabobs the bust but many other great things on the menu.  I usually order the steak and gyro combo plate.  Their calamari is absolutely incredible when they have it but they have been unable to get a supplier to get them the quality of calamari they want/used to get so they haven't been serving it anymore.  Their greek pizza is also terrific.  Hard to find places where they make the food from scratch after you order and is so fresh and tasty and inexpensive.  You order in a line and they bring it out to you but you don't have waitresses so a bargain and aren't required to tip.  Consistently good place that is a once a week place for me.  Don't forge to try the Lemon Soup!
Grest food. Phone in order ready when we arrived.  Christian the owner is very har woeking and friendly. Love this place.
This is by far the best Greek restaurant in Vegas. The gyro has been seasoned to perfection and the portions are generous.
